original: de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang po med pa ni nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang po med pa ni nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first absence of violence is due to the abandonment of all faults.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs shing bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad spangs shing bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is due to the abandonment and separation from all faults such as passion.

original: kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnyis pa med par ston to //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnyis pa med par ston to //
translated: The second absence of violence is due to the absence of the envelopments, etc.

original: 'dod chags la mngon du rgyu ba ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la mngon du rgyu ba ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: The envelopments are the manifest activities of passion.

original: kun nas dkris pa dang skye ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang skye ba dag ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang skye ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang skye ba dag ste /
translated: The envelopments and the arising are the envelopments and the arising.

original: de dag la rag lus pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rag lus pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is free from the suffering that is dependent on them.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skye ba'i tshe lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris pa la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skye ba'i tshe lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris pa la rag lus pa'o //
translated: The suffering that is characterized by the torment of body and mind when passion, etc., arise is dependent on the envelopments.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba la rag lus pa'o //
translated: The suffering of birth, old age, and disease is dependent on arising.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba gsum pa med pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba gsum pa med pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The third type of violence is the absence of the taste of the bliss of nirvana, which is the absence of passion, etc.

original: rab tu zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is characterized by the absence of passion, etc.

original: de'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de'i ro myang ba de la skyo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de'i ro myang ba de la skyo ba med pa ste /
translated: The taste of the bliss of that is the absence of disgust with it,

original: rgyab kyis phyogs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not turn one’s back on it.

original: yang dag pa'i don can ma yin pa ni yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don can ma yin pa ni yang dag pa'i yul can ma yin pa ste /
translated: The absence of the object of reality is the absence of the object of passion, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of passion, etc.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that there is no external objective cause.

original: 'o na de ji ltar skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how does it arise?

original: nye bar len pa'i stobs las byung ba can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i stobs las byung ba can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It arises from the power of the appropriation,

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog cing bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba can no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog cing bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba can no //
translated: from the power of the false imagination and the residual impressions.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is so because the cause of consciousness, which is the seed of attachment and so on, is erroneous.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnyen po'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not so because the antidote, which has the characteristic of being the opposite of attachment and so on, is fully grasped.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i nyes pa dag ni yang dag pa'i don 'dzin pa gnyen po'i phyogs gnod pa can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i nyes pa dag ni yang dag pa'i don 'dzin pa gnyen po'i phyogs gnod pa can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The faults that engage by superimposing error are not produced because the antidote, which grasps the correct meaning, is fully grasped and is harmful to them. This is the meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i don can te /🔽phyin ci ma log pa'i @252a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don can te / phyin ci ma log pa'i @252a * //
translated: It is not so because it has the correct meaning.🔽It is not so because it has an object that is nonerroneous.

original: yul can ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: yul can ni mi 'gyur ba ma yin te 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is so because it is changeable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dngos po'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it arises by the power of things.

original: ji ltar gnas la sogs pa'i dngos po'i nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas la sogs pa'i dngos po'i nus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it produces the power of things such as the basis.

original: re zhig nyes pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas na yang mi rtog pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i tshad ma dag gis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam skyed par byed na /
analyzed: re zhig nyes pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas na yang mi rtog pa la sogs pa yang dag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i tshad ma dag gis gnyen po'i phyogs kyi lam skyed par byed na /
translated: Even if one abides in a state of fault for a while, if one generates the path of the antidote by means of valid knowledge that comprehends the correct meaning, such as non-conceptuality,

original: 'on kyang lhag mthong goms pa la gnas pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhag mthong goms pa la gnas pa lta ci smos /
translated: then what need is there to mention one who abides in cultivating insight?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa can te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa can te /
translated: Even faults such as attachment, which are not the correct meaning,

original: bden pa'i don can ma yin pa yang dag pa'i don can gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i don can ma yin pa yang dag pa'i don can gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: become the antidote, which is the correct meaning, and become the nature of the antidote.

original: rang bzhin du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la gnod pa byad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la gnod pa byad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which becomes the nature of the antidote cannot be harmed.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na nyes pa spangs pa can dag gi nyes pa yang skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na nyes pa spangs pa can dag gi nyes pa yang skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Because that is so, faults do not arise for those who have abandoned faults.

original: nyes pa skyed par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol yod na yang blo ni yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid las rtsol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa skyed par byed pa'i 'bad rtsol yod na yang blo ni yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs nyid las rtsol bar byed pa ste /
translated: Even though there is effort that generates faults, the mind is the cause of taking up the side of good qualities, so one should strive from the side of the antidotes of attachment and so on.

original: rab tu brtson par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu brtson par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when there is effort that produces faults, the mind is the cause of taking up the side of virtues, so one should strive from the side of the antidotes to attachment and so on.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i ste /
translated: One should strive for the side of virtues that is endowed with realization.

original: re zhig nyes pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas na yang rigs pa dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig nyes pa'i bdag nyid can du gnas na yang rigs pa dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Even if one abides in a state of faults for a while, one should analyze with reasoning.

original: khyad par du ste phul du byung bar skyon med pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: khyad par du ste phul du byung bar skyon med pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: In particular, one should strive for the side of virtues that is of the nature of faultlessness,

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa yon tan dag la rtsol ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa yon tan dag la rtsol ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abides in the nature of the antidotes and strives for virtues.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa de dag skyed par byed pa ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste 'di las skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa de dag skyed par byed pa ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ste 'di las skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of producing those faults such as attachment is the cause of production, because they arise and occur from that.

original: nyes pa'i rgyu gang gis gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa las de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas nyes ba spong bar 'gyur ba yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rgyu gang gis gnyen po'i phyogs goms pa las de'i bdag nyid du gyur pas nyes ba spong bar 'gyur ba yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of faults? What is the cause of the removal of faults?

original: nyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa'i rgyu smos te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa'i rgyu smos te /
translated: The cause of faults is stated in the verse:

original: nyes pa'i rnam pa thams cad dag ste /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rnam pa thams cad dag ste /
translated: “All the aspects of faults

original: nyes pa'i rigs ni 'jig tshogs lta bas skye ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rigs ni 'jig tshogs lta bas skye ba yin te /
translated: arise from the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dag las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa dag las byung ba yin no //
translated: They arise from the attachment to ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: lung las nyon mongs pa dag ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lung las nyon mongs pa dag ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can du gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren’t the afflictions said to have ignorance as their cause in the scriptures?

original: de la ji ltar gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: How is that not a contradiction?

original: de ma rig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ma rig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “That is ignorance.”

original: 'jig pa'i tshogs su lta ba de nyid ma rig pa yin pa de bas na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i tshogs su lta ba de nyid ma rig pa yin pa de bas na 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That very view of the transitory collection is ignorance. Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: go rims gang gis nyes pa rnams 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: go rims gang gis nyes pa rnams 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: In what order do faults arise from the view of the transitory collection?

original: der chags @252b zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der chags @252b zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “Attachment to that.”

original: bdag dang bdag gi nyid du mngon par zhen pa can gyi yul de la der chags pa ste bdag gir chags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi nyid du mngon par zhen pa can gyi yul de la der chags pa ste bdag gir chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to that object, which is the object of the conception of “I” and “mine,” is the attachment to “mine.”

original: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa de las zhe sdang la sogs pa 'byung zhes bya ba ni go rims yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa de las zhe sdang la sogs pa 'byung zhes bya ba ni go rims yin no //
translated: Hatred, etc., arise from the attachment to “I” and “mine.” This is the order.

original: nga ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /🔽nga ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rnam pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nga ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la / nga ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rnam pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: He explains with “not ‘I,’” etc.🔽“Not ‘I’” is the negation of the form “I.”

original: nga'i ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: nga'i ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba'i rnam pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: “Not ‘mine’” is the negation of the form “mine.”

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang bdag gi med pa'i rnam par skyes bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang bdag gi med pa'i rnam par skyes bu lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a person who has the form of selflessness and the form of the nonexistence of “mine.”

original: 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi nyid dang de'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pas kun du brtags pa'i 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa ste /🔽de med par yul 'ga' zhig la yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi nyid dang de'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pas kun du brtags pa'i 'dzin pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa ste / de med par yul 'ga' zhig la yang chags pa med do //
translated: “Without grasping” means that there is no grasping of any object whatsoever, because there is no grasping that is imagined by the conception of “I” and “mine” and the grasping of that.

original: rjes su chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med pa ste /
translated: “Without attachment” means that there is no attachment to any object whatsoever.🔽“Without aversion” means that there is no aversion to any object whatsoever.

original: bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa'i chags pa med pa 'ga' zhig la yang zhe sdang med de /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa'i chags pa med pa 'ga' zhig la yang zhe sdang med de /
translated: There is no aversion for anyone who is not attached to i and mine, etc.

original: rjes su chags pa med pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no attachment to them.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how,

original: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽bdag dang bdag gi la nye bar gnod pa med pa can te /
analyzed: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / bdag dang bdag gi la nye bar gnod pa med pa can te /
translated: it is said, “i and mine, etc.”

original: mi mthun par gnas pa med pa'i ngang tshul can bar ma'i phyogs la de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun par gnas pa med pa'i ngang tshul can bar ma'i phyogs la de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no aversion for those who are neutral, who are not hostile to i and mine.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar gnod pa 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro // nye bar gnod pa 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no aversion for them.🔽“Destroying the harm”

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa nye bar gnod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa nye bar gnod pa ste /
translated: means that the harm of grasping i and mine is the harm of violence.

original: 'tshe ba gang yin pa de 'joms par byed cing de 'gog par byed pa mdza' bo'i phyogs la de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba gang yin pa de 'joms par byed cing de 'gog par byed pa mdza' bo'i phyogs la de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no aversion for those who destroy that harm, who stop that, who are friendly,

original: zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no aversion for them.

original: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i yul du gyur pa la 'gal bar gnas pa mi mthun par 'jug pa gang yin pa de la zhe sdang yod pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir chags pa'i yul du gyur pa la 'gal bar gnas pa mi mthun par 'jug pa gang yin pa de la zhe sdang yod pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: But when there is a conflict in the object of attachment to “I” and “mine,” and they operate in opposition, there is hatred.

original: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa med par zhe sdang med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir chags pa med par zhe sdang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when there is no attachment to “I” and “mine,” there is no hatred.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: “ Therefore” and so on concludes.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dag gis chags pa skyed par byed do zhes tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dag gis chags pa skyed par byed do zhes tshig rnam par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
translated: “they” refers to the views of “I” and “mine.” The statement should be construed as “attachment generates hatred and so on.”

original: 'dod chags des zhe sdang la sogs pa skyed cing skrun par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags des zhe sdang la sogs pa skyed cing skrun par byed do //
translated: That attachment generates hatred and so on.

original: 'on kyang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag gir lta ba de dag gi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag tu lta ba dang bdag gir lta ba de dag gi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: But what is the cause of the views of “I” and “mine”?

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text declares, “The cause is a concordant aspect.”

original: rigs mtshungs pa ni bdag tu lta ba de nyid de /
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa ni bdag tu lta ba de nyid de /
translated: A concordant aspect is the view of “I.”

original: de goms te thog ma med pa'i dus nas yang dang yang du skye @253a * //
analyzed: de goms te thog ma med pa'i dus nas yang dang yang du skye @253a * //
translated: Having become accustomed to that, the view of self arises again and again from beginningless time.

original: ba dang / de'i bag chags de las skyes pa'i bdag tu lta bas bdag gir 'dzin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ba dang / de'i bag chags de las skyes pa'i bdag tu lta bas bdag gir 'dzin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: And from the latent impressions of that, the view of self that arises from the latent impressions generates the grasping of “mine.”

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all the afflictions are generated from the view of the transitory collection.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las 'jig tshogs su lta ba de nyid kyang mi shes pa ste ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las 'jig tshogs su lta ba de nyid kyang mi shes pa ste ma rig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The treatise on the stages of the path to enlightenment says, “That very view of the transitory collection is ignorance.”

original: gang gis ji ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na ma rig pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar 'jig tshogs su lta ba kho na ma rig pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is said that the view of the transitory collection is ignorance,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni gti mug yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa rnams kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni gti mug yin te /
translated: the primary cause of faults such as attachment is delusion.

original: mdo las nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las nyon mongs pa thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: A sūtra says, “All afflictions are caused by ignorance.”

original: mdo gzhan las nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba yin par gsungs so //
translated: Another sūtra says, “The cause of faults is the view of the transitory collection.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de spangs pa na ste /
analyzed: de spangs pa na ste /
translated: When that is abandoned,

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa na nyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gti mug de ni nyes pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba spangs pa na nyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gti mug de ni nyes pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: because when the afflicted view of the self is abandoned, the faults are abandoned.🔽The Fortunate One has said that delusion is the cause of faults:

original: nyes pa'i byed rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: nyes pa'i byed rgyur gsungs so //
translated: “Delusion is the cause of faults.🔽”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rmongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rmongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because faults arise in those who are not deluded,

original: mi shes pa dang bral ba la nyes pa dag ni skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang bral ba la nyes pa dag ni skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: who are not ignorant.

original: phyogs gzhan dag tu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyes pa'i rgyur gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan dag tu ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba nyes pa'i rgyur gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In other places, the afflicted view of the self is said to be the cause of faults.

original: gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rgyu de dang de nyid rgyu'i gtso bor bstan pa yin na 'gyur gyi rgyu tsam bstan pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rgyu de dang de nyid rgyu'i gtso bor bstan pa yin na 'gyur gyi rgyu tsam bstan pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The same delusion and the same afflicted view of the self are the principal causes of faults, not just any cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dbang po dang yul ngang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i tshogs du ma las skye ba can gyi nyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba gcig las skyes ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul ngang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i tshogs du ma las skye ba can gyi nyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba gcig las skyes ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The faults that arise from many collections of improper mental attentions to the mode of being of the faculties and objects arise from delusion and the afflicted view of the self, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: de bas na rgyu gzhan yod na yang gtso bo gzung nas gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba dag rgyu nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu gzhan yod na yang gtso bo gzung nas gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba dag rgyu nyid du gsungs pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if there are other causes, it should be understood that the root of delusion and the afflicted view of the self is taught to be the primary cause.

original: gal te gti mug kyang gzhan yin zhing 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gal te gti mug kyang gzhan yin zhing 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang gzhan yin la /
translated: If delusion is one thing and the afflicted view of the self is another,

original: de dag kyang gtso bo yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag kyang gtso bo yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: and if they are the root,

original: gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba gnyi ga'i gtso bo yin na ni re re bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba gnyi ga'i gtso bo yin na ni re re bstan pa ste /
translated: then if they are the root of both delusion and the afflicted view of the self, they are taught individually,

original: la lar gti mug dang la lar 'jig tshogs su lta ba bstan pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: la lar gti mug dang la lar 'jig tshogs su lta ba bstan pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the meaning is that delusion is taught in some contexts and the afflicted view of the self is taught in others.

original: mdzes pa la brten pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mdzes pa la brten pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not based on beauty.

original: 'chad pa po mkhas pa nyid ma yin par ston par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chad pa po mkhas pa nyid ma yin par ston par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is not a scholar.

original: gang gi tshe de dag gi rang bzhin dbye ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag gi rang bzhin dbye ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When their nature is not differentiated,

original: gti mug gi sgra dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i sgra rnam pa gnyis ka yang don gcig @253b gis rnam grangs su bstan pas gtso bo la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gti mug gi sgra dang 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i sgra rnam pa gnyis ka yang don gcig @253b gis rnam grangs su bstan pas gtso bo la 'gal ba med do //
translated: then the terms “ignorance” and “view of the perishable collection” are both synonyms with the same meaning. Therefore, there is no contradiction in their being principal.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba gtso bo yin pa yang nyes pa de dag gi nye bar len pa nyid de rgyu nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba gtso bo yin pa yang nyes pa de dag gi nye bar len pa nyid de rgyu nyid kyis yin no //
translated: The view of the perishable collection is principal because it is the cause of those faults.

original: de nyid kyang 'das ma thag tu bstan cing le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyang 'das ma thag tu bstan cing le'u gnyis pa las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is also taught immediately above and will be taught in the second chapter.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba de spangs pa na nyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba de spangs pa na nyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: When that view of the perishable collection is abandoned, the faults are abandoned. Therefore, it is principal.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since that is so,

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skye ba can gyi nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bdag med pa mthong ba de goms pa las spangs pa yod par 'gyur ro //🔽skyes bu ched du bya ba nyes pa zad pa can rtogs dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba las skye ba can gyi nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bdag med pa mthong ba de goms pa las spangs pa yod par 'gyur ro // skyes bu ched du bya ba nyes pa zad pa can rtogs dka' ba ste /
translated: The faults that arise from the view of the transitory collection are abandoned by the cultivation of the vision of selflessness, which is the antidote to that view.🔽The person who is the object of the injunction is one who has the purpose of eliminating faults, and he is difficult to understand.

original: khong du chud par dka' ba de nyes pa zad pa gang gis bstan pa las 'jug par 'dod pa can 'dis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba de nyes pa zad pa gang gis bstan pa las 'jug par 'dod pa can 'dis rtogs pa ste /
translated: He is difficult to understand because he is difficult to comprehend.🔽The person who is the object of the injunction is one who desires to engage in the teaching through the elimination of faults.

original: des bstan pa'i don nan tan du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bstan pa'i don nan tan du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is one who will practice the meaning of the teaching.

original: skyes bu la brten pa can te skyes bu'i rgyu can gyi tshig ni lung ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu la brten pa can te skyes bu'i rgyu can gyi tshig ni lung ma yin no //
translated: The words of the teaching are not scripture because they are dependent on a person and have a person as their cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis lung byed pa po rtogs dka' ba nyid de khong du chud par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis lung byed pa po rtogs dka' ba nyid de khong du chud par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the person who is the speaker of the teaching is difficult to understand, difficult to comprehend, in the manner that has just been explained.

original: yang na rtogs pa ni bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa ni bsam pa yin te /
translated: Or, understanding is thought.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa de la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa de la zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in the case of one who has faults such as desire” is to be supplied.

original: bsam pa dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because the intention is difficult to understand.

original: tshig rnams log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams skyes bu la brten phyir te /
analyzed: tshig rnams log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams skyes bu la brten phyir te /
translated: The faults that are the cause of the perversion of words are based on a person.

original: log pa'i don gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis te /
analyzed: log pa'i don gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu nyes pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis te /
translated: Those faults that are the cause of the perversion of the meaning of desire, etc.

original: 'di ni byed pa po'i drug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa po'i drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the genitive of the agent.

original: rten par byed pas na brten pa te skyes bu la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rten par byed pas na brten pa te skyes bu la brten pa'o //
translated: They are based on a person because they are supported by a person.

original: skyes bu la zhes bya ba ni las kyi drug pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu la zhes bya ba ni las kyi drug pa'o //
translated: The phrase “on a person” is the genitive of the object.

original: de bas na don ni log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams kyis skyes bu yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don ni log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams kyis skyes bu yongs su gzung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is: because the faults that are the cause of the perversion of the meaning are based on a person.

original: yang na nyes pa rnams zhes bya ba las kyi drug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na nyes pa rnams zhes bya ba las kyi drug pa yin te /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase “the faults” is the genitive of the object.

original: nyes pa rnams skyes bu la brten phyir te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams skyes bu la brten phyir te /
translated: The faults are based on a person.

original: skyes bu rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is held by persons.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i don can yin te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i don can yin te /
translated: Some say that the words of a person who is not a creator have a true meaning,

original: log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni la la ste dpyod pa po rjod par byed do //
analyzed: log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni la la ste dpyod pa po rjod par byed do //
translated: because there is no fault that is the cause of error.

original: skyes bus byas pa'am ma byas pa'i lung thams cad ni 'khrul par mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'am ma byas pa'i lung thams cad ni 'khrul par mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: But all scriptures, whether created or not created by a person, are not necessarily free from error.

original: 'khrul pa ste slu ba gang la srid cing dogs pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ste slu ba gang la srid cing dogs pa yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro /
translated: The word “error” is to be construed with “possible” and “suspected.”

original: @254a * // 'on kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na 'khrul pa srid pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: @254a * // 'on kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na 'khrul pa srid pa kho na yin no //
translated: However, only that which is created by a person is possible and suspected of error.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'khrul pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'khrul pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the causes of error,

original: slu ba'i rgyu nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba'i rgyu nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the causes of deception, faults, are dependent on persons.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa bden don can //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa bden don can //
translated: The words of a person who is not a creator have a true meaning.

original: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag gi yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag gi yin te /
translated: This is the opinion of others.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag la skyes bu ldog pas de la brten pa'i nyes pa ldog pa nyid kyi rgyu rnams med pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag la skyes bu ldog pas de la brten pa'i nyes pa ldog pa nyid kyi rgyu rnams med pa yin la /
translated: Since the speech of a non-person is not dependent on a person, the causes of its cessation do not exist.

original: rgyu med pas ni 'bras bu med pa ste ldog pa nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis skyes bus ma byas bden don can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pas ni 'bras bu med pa ste ldog pa nyid med pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis skyes bus ma byas bden don can yin no //
translated: Since there is no cause, there is no effect, i.e., cessation. Since it is established that there is no cessation, the just-mentioned method proves that the Vedas are true and not composed by a person.

original: de skad du smra ba'i dpyod pa de nyid la gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba'i dpyod pa de nyid la gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The author of the treatise himself teaches this very analysis of the opponent’s position.

original: ci zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: What does he say?

original: tshig rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshig rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “The words . . .

original: tshig rnams bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan de rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig rnams bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan de rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The qualities that are the cause of the truth of the words are dependent on a person.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag la skyes bu ldog pas bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan log pa'i phyir 'bras bu bden pa nyid kyang ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag log pa'i don du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes gzhan dag rjod par byed do //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag la skyes bu ldog pas bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan log pa'i phyir 'bras bu bden pa nyid kyang ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag log pa'i don du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes gzhan dag rjod par byed do //
translated: Others say: Why would the meaning of “speech not made by a person” not be reversed? Because the cause of truth, the quality, is reversed due to the reversal of the person. The result, truth itself, is also reversed.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with “Just as…” and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu brdzun du smra ba de ltar brtse ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu brdzun du smra ba de ltar brtse ba ste /
translated: That person who possesses attachment and so on and speaks falsely, in the same way, he is compassionate,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i chos nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i chos nyid kyang yin no //
translated: and he has the nature of compassion.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab dang dad pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab dang dad pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term “and so on” includes wisdom, faith, and so on.

original: de dag dang ldan pa bden pa smra ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa bden pa smra ba mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the one who possesses those speaking the truth.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: ji ltar tshig ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir log pa'i don nyid yin pa de ltar bden pa'i don yang skyes bu la brten pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar tshig ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir log pa'i don nyid yin pa de ltar bden pa'i don yang skyes bu la brten pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the meaning of a word is false because it is dependent on a person, so also the meaning of truth is dependent on a person.

original: skyes bu log pa na bden pa'i don de yang ldog par byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu log pa na bden pa'i don de yang ldog par byed do //
translated: When a person is reversed, the meaning of truth is also reversed.

original: yang gi sgra ni ldog pa'i don yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni ldog pa'i don yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word “also” means that the meaning of reversal is also like that.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the meaning of truth is not made by a person, it would be meaningless.

original: ci ste bden pa'i don log pa de lta na yang don med par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe bden pa'i don can nyid dam phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste bden pa'i don log pa de lta na yang don med par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe bden pa'i don can nyid dam phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: But if you do not accept that the meaning of truth is reversed, then it would have the meaning of truth or it would be non-erroneous.

original: log pa'i don can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: log pa'i don can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: It would have the meaning of non-erroneous.

original: don gyis bden pa'i don can ldog pa na rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis bden pa'i don can ldog pa na rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the meaning of truth is reversed, there is no other form.

original: bsam pa 'dis kyang log pa'i don ci min zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa 'dis kyang log pa'i don ci min zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This thought also explains the verse “What is the meaning of reversal?”

original: gzhan du na ni don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it is meaningless.

original: @254b 'dod par ni 'gyur na skyes bu la ltos pas sgra rnams don dang ldan pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: @254b 'dod par ni 'gyur na skyes bu la ltos pas sgra rnams don dang ldan pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that they are, then because they depend on a person, sounds do not have meaning by nature.

original: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
translated: However, they do have meaning by nature.

original: sgra rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, he says that sounds do not have meaning by nature.

original: ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyis don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyis don dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not have meaning by nature or essence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brda brdas byas pa skyes bus byas pa nyid ma yin te /🔽'di ltar skyes bus legs par byas pas don gsal bar byed pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: brda brdas byas pa skyes bus byas pa nyid ma yin te / 'di ltar skyes bus legs par byas pas don gsal bar byed pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: Because the convention is not created by convention, it is not created by a person.

original: rig byed ni skyes bus byas pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed ni skyes bus byas pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Even if a person creates it well, it does not follow that the Vedas are created by a person.

original: de ltar yang don shes byed pa dag gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang don shes byed pa dag gi rgyu ste /
translated: Thus, the cause of the understanding of meaning is a convention.

original: don gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu brda ni rang nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu brda ni rang nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the understanding of meaning is a convention because it itself understands meaning.

original: de yang brda ni skyes bu la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de yang brda ni skyes bu la brten pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the convention depends on a person.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed kyi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin gyi dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed kyi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin gyi dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they follow the wishes of people, they do not engage in accordance with the way things are.

original: tshig rnams skyes bus byas min yang ste /
analyzed: tshig rnams skyes bus byas min yang ste /
translated: Even though the words are not created by people,

original: khas len pa na brda skyes bu'i 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa las de phyir log pa nyid du srid /
analyzed: khas len pa na brda skyes bu'i 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa las de phyir log pa nyid du srid /
translated: when one accepts them, they follow the wishes of people who create the conventions, and therefore it is possible that they are reversed.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: This is explained by “this” and so on.

original: rig byed 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rig byed 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of investigating whether this Vedic knowledge is not created by people?

original: dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means there is not the slightest purpose.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the knowledge of the meaning

original: brda gang las te /🔽gang gi phyir brda las skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag ni don rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: brda gang las te / gang gi phyir brda las skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag ni don rtogs pa ste /
translated: arises from the conventions.

original: don gsal bar byed pa'i brda de skyes bus byas pa yin pa de'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: don gsal bar byed pa'i brda de skyes bus byas pa yin pa de'i phyir phyin ci log ste /
translated: Because the conventions that create the knowledge of the meaning, that is, the conventions that clarify the meaning, are created by people, therefore they are mistaken,

original: brdzun par yang 'gyur te rang dbang can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun par yang 'gyur te rang dbang can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, they are false, because they are independent.

original: de bas na tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the one who practices morality

original: rgyu mtho ris 'di la yod pa de ni tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtho ris 'di la yod pa de ni tshul khrims sgrub par byed pa can yin no //
translated: is the one who practices morality in this world.

original: de ltar gyur pa yang de la mtho ris kyang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yang de la mtho ris kyang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And that is also heaven, thus it is said.

original: rig byed kyi tshig gang yin pa de dang de la skyes bu 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don las brda rnam pa gzhan gyis phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig gang yin pa de dang de la skyes bu 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don las brda rnam pa gzhan gyis phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: In this and that Vedic statement, this person, by a different convention than the one intended, becomes mistaken.

original: don phyin ci log pa nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don phyin ci log pa nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He makes a mistake about the meaning.

original: rgyu des na don ci lta ba bzhin ma yin pa yang ston par byed pa srid pa'i phyir de nyid ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu des na don ci lta ba bzhin ma yin pa yang ston par byed pa srid pa'i phyir de nyid ston pa yin te /
translated: For that reason, it is possible that even what is not the meaning as it is can be taught, and therefore it is taught.

original: skyes bus byas pa dag la skyes bus byas pa ni skyes bus nyes pa las 'khrul pa srid pa can yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dag la skyes bus byas pa ni skyes bus nyes pa las 'khrul pa srid pa can yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that in the case of human products, error is possible due to human fault.

original: skyes bu rnams kyis sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma byas su zin kyang /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyis sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel pa ma byas su zin kyang /
translated: Even though people do not make a connection between words and meanings,

original: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang 'brel pa yin na yang skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dra bar rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang 'brel pa yin na yang skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the sounds that indicate are related to the meaning in the same way as the intrinsic nature of the sound, they are not produced by a person.

original: @255a * // 'brel pa skyes bus ma byas min na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @255a * // 'brel pa skyes bus ma byas min na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the relation is not produced by a person,

original: rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na /
translated: if you accept that the relation of the sounds that indicate with the meaning is not produced by a person,

original: don rtogs pa ni brda rig pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni brda rig pa med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: then the understanding of the meaning would occur without knowledge of the convention.

original: brda shes pa ni brda'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: brda shes pa ni brda'i rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the convention is knowledge of the sign.

original: de gang la med pa de ni brda rig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de gang la med pa de ni brda rig pa med pa ste /
translated: That which does not have that is without knowledge of the convention.

original: brda mngon par mi shes pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brda mngon par mi shes pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not understand the sign.🔽If that were so,

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad pa la sgra gang dag la skyes bus ma bskyed cing 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad pa la sgra gang dag la skyes bus ma bskyed cing 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: this is explained by the phrase “and so on.” Those sounds that are not produced by a person and do not have a relation produced by a person are called “unproduced by a person.”

original: sgra de dag ni don rnams la skyes bu dag gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i don las phyin ci log pa ma yin par 'gyur te /🔽'khrul pa'i rgyu byed pa ma yin no //🔽phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu de bas na skyon yod pa ste /
analyzed: sgra de dag ni don rnams la skyes bu dag gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i don las phyin ci log pa ma yin par 'gyur te / 'khrul pa'i rgyu byed pa ma yin no // phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu de bas na skyon yod pa ste /
translated: Those words would not be mistaken with regard to their referents, because they would not be the cause of error.

original: slu ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi nyes pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽grub pa'i mtha' smra bas da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slu ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi nyes pa yod pa ma yin no // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since they are not the cause of error, they would not have the fault of being deceptive, that is, they would not have the fault of being unreliable.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa skyes bus byas min na brda la dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa skyes bus byas min na brda la dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: The Proponent of the Middle: Now, if the connection is not made by a person, what is the point of a conventional symbol?

original: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //🔽gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: There is no point at all.

original: gang las don rtogs pa de nyid ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa yin no //🔽gal te don rtogs pa'i rgyu'i 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gang las don rtogs pa de nyid ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa yin no // gal te don rtogs pa'i rgyu'i 'brel pa ste /
translated: If the connection between words and their referents were not made by a person, then what would be the point of a conventional symbol?

original: skyes bus ma byas pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the connection that causes the understanding of the referent were not made by a person,🔽then the connection would be established naturally.

original: skyes bu 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i 'brel pa can gyi sgra las don rtogs par byed pa na sgron ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brda la ltos pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i 'brel pa can gyi sgra las don rtogs par byed pa na sgron ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar brda la ltos pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: This person, when he causes the understanding of the meaning from a word that is related by intrinsic identity, would be like a lamp, etc., and would not depend on a convention.

original: rig byed pa'i sgra las kyang don rtogs pa'i phyir skyes bu brda la ltos pa bde bas na /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i sgra las kyang don rtogs pa'i phyir skyes bu brda la ltos pa bde bas na /
translated: And because the meaning is understood from the words of the Vedas, it is easier to say that the person depends on a convention.

original: sgra rnams don te gdams pa las yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams don te gdams pa las yin te /
translated: The words have a meaning because of an instruction.

original: sgra de las don rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra de las don rtogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning is understood from the words

original: don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is comprehended.

original: lus kyi brda la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lus kyi brda la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is like the convention of the body, etc.

original: lus kyi 'gyur ba dang mig 'dzums pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi brda'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'gyur ba dang mig 'dzums pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi brda'o //
translated: The convention of the body is the change in the body, the winking of the eye, etc.

original: dper na de la brda las don 'ga' zhig rtogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na de la brda las don 'ga' zhig rtogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when one understands a meaning from a convention, it is like that.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin nyid kyis sgra rnams rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin nyid kyis sgra rnams rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the words are made clear by their intrinsic reality, then

original: brda la ltos par mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: brda la ltos par mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: they would not depend on a convention. Therefore,

original: sgra rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis don rtogs par rung ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra rnams ni ngo bo nyid kyis don rtogs par rung ba nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Sounds are not suitable to be understood as having a nature that is meaningful.

original: 'on kyang rjes su mthun par yang rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su mthun par yang rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: However, they are suitable to be meaningful in accordance with convention.

original: sgra rnams ni sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa nyid du rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni sgra ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa nyid du rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Sounds are suitable to be used in accordance with the sounds themselves.

original: gal te ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you ask, “How are they understood?”

original: brda ste gdags pa'i @255b tshe skyes bu de'i gang la sbyar bar 'dod pas sgra rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brdar byas shing brtsams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brda ste gdags pa'i @255b tshe skyes bu de'i gang la sbyar bar 'dod pas sgra rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brdar byas shing brtsams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because when a convention is made, a person who wishes to use a sound makes a convention and begins to use the sound in accordance with his or her wishes.

original: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni don 'ga' zhig la sgra rnams 'gyur ba de'i tshe /🔽kho bo nyid kyis grub pa dag la skyes bu 'dod pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni don 'ga' zhig la sgra rnams 'gyur ba de'i tshe / kho bo nyid kyis grub pa dag la skyes bu 'dod pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: If sounds were established by their own nature to have a meaning,🔽then it would not be suitable for people to use them in accordance with their wishes,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brdas don bstan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du brdas don bstan par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be established by their own nature and not by the wishes of people.

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyis don med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyis don med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are meaningless by their own nature.

original: de dag kyang don med pa can du gyur par skyes bus legs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang don med pa can du gyur par skyes bus legs par byas pa ste /
translated: And they are well-made by a person, but they are meaningless.

original: skyes bu'i brda las don dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu'i brda las don dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: They become meaningful by the person’s convention.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis don gsal bar byed par nus pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i brda la ltos par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis don gsal bar byed par nus pa ni sgron ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i brda la ltos par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not like lamps and so on, which are able to illuminate objects by their own intrinsic nature and do not depend on the person’s convention.

original: ci ste don med pa can du ma gyur cig snyam pas rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni skyes bus legs par byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste don med pa can du ma gyur cig snyam pas rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni skyes bus legs par byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that the sounds of the Vedas are well-made by a person because you think, “They should not be meaningless,” then they are made by a person.

original: gang gi phyir sgra de dag kyang de dag gis legs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra de dag kyang de dag gis legs par byas pa ste /
translated: Because those sounds are well-made by them.

original: skyes bus legs par byas pa kho na skyes bus byas pa nyid du rigs kyi skyes bu las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus legs par byas pa kho na skyes bus byas pa nyid du rigs kyi skyes bu las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Only that which is well-made by a person is reasonable to call “made by a person,” but it is not reasonable to call that which is produced from a person “made by a person.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu'i brda de nyid las don las 'khrul pa ste slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i brda de nyid las don las 'khrul pa ste slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of those sounds is confused, that is, deceptive, due to the person’s convention.

original: 'di ni mi slu ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi slu ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that this is not created by a person because it is non-deceptive.

original: gal te ma skyes pa yang skyes bus legs par byas pa las 'khrul par dogs na ma skyes pa nyid kyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni don med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa yang skyes bus legs par byas pa las 'khrul par dogs na ma skyes pa nyid kyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni don med pa yin te /
translated: If you suspect that what is not created is created by a person, then it is meaningless to say that what is not created is not created by a person.

original: 'di ltar skyes bus legs par byas pa nyid las sgra rnams ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gis log pa dang bden pa'i don can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bus legs par byas pa nyid las sgra rnams ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag gis log pa dang bden pa'i don can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, due to being created by a person, sounds would not have the meaning of true or false, whether created or not created.

original: de ltar na skyes pa yang rnam pa gzhan du brdar byas pas zhes bya ba log pa'i don can nyid dang 'gal bas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du brdar byas shing brdar btags pas /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes pa yang rnam pa gzhan du brdar byas pas zhes bya ba log pa'i don can nyid dang 'gal bas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du brdar byas shing brdar btags pas /
translated: In that case, it would contradict the statement, “Even what is created is created by convention in another way,” which has the meaning of false. Therefore, it is created by convention in accordance with the thing.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skyes bu'i chos dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skyes bu'i chos dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is similar to other phenomena created by a person.

original: dper na sgra las gzhan pa skyes bu'i chos mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don med pa can yin na yang /
analyzed: dper na sgra las gzhan pa skyes bu'i chos mig 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don med pa can yin na yang /
translated: For example, the nature of the phenomena of a person other than sound, such as opening and closing the eyes, is meaningless.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du skyes bu brdar byas pa mi slu ba yin pa de dang 'dra bar 'gal ba med pa can te /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du skyes bu brdar byas pa mi slu ba yin pa de dang 'dra bar 'gal ba med pa can te /
translated: Just as a person’s conventional symbol is non-deceptive in accordance with the thing, so it is not contradictory.

original: 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is without error.

original: ji ste 'khrul pa yod par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes bus legs par byas pa mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ste 'khrul pa yod par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes bus legs par byas pa mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if one does not accept a person’s good conventional symbol, thinking that error should not exist,

original: bya rog gi skad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar don med pa can du 'gyur @256a * //
analyzed: bya rog gi skad la sogs pa dang 'dra bar don med pa can du 'gyur @256a * //
translated: then it would be meaningless, like the cawing of a crow.

original: ro ; ; de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: ro ; ; de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir skyes bu 'di ldog pas rang gis byas pa'i brda las byung ba can te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir skyes bu 'di ldog pas rang gis byas pa'i brda las byung ba can te /
translated: Therefore, because of this, the cognition of the object that has the nature of arising from a person’s conventional symbol would be reversed.

original: gang la skyes pa yod pa'i don gyi blo ste don du spobs pa de ldog par 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang la skyes pa yod pa'i don gyi blo ste don du spobs pa de ldog par 'gyur ro // de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: That is, the cognition of the object that has the nature of arising from a person’s conventional symbol would be reversed.

original: de ldog pa ste ldog pa'i don can gyi rgyu mtshan gyi skyes bu de log pas gang las bden pa'i don can nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa ste ldog pa'i don can gyi rgyu mtshan gyi skyes bu de log pas gang las bden pa'i don can nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of this, the person who is the reason for the reversal, i.e., the person who has the nature of reversal, would be reversed.🔽From what would the truth of the object arise?

original: 'on kyang don med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang don med pa can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would be meaningless.

original: ci ste yang skyes pa kho na skyes bus byas pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste yang skyes pa kho na skyes bus byas pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If it is said that the mere fact of being produced is the human action,

original: brdas byas pa ma yin na ste /
analyzed: brdas byas pa ma yin na ste /
translated: and the connection is not made by convention,

original: dag la 'brel pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dag la 'brel pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa ma yin te /
translated: then the connection is not made by humans.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi rtags la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi rtags la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that it is like the connection of a flag and so on with the wind.

original: 'dod par ni 'gyur na sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dod par ni 'gyur na sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kho na yin te /
translated: If that is asserted, then the connection between words and their meanings is not made by humans.

original: de yang rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skyes bus brda la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin pa de'i phyir skyes bus brda la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is not based on understanding. Therefore, it is based on humans making conventions.

original: rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is not based on understanding,

original: don rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin pa yang ci ltar na 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa la brten pa ma yin pa yang ci ltar na 'brel pa yin te /
translated: how can it be a connection?

original: rtogs pa la brten pa nyid ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa la brten pa nyid ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: The connection between words and their meanings is based on understanding.

original: de lta ma yin na gang yang rung ba'i tshig dang don dag gi 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang yang rung ba'i tshig dang don dag gi 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, any word or meaning would be related to any other.

original: ci ste 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: ci ste 'dod mod kyi /
translated: If you accept that,

original: don rtogs pa'i rgyu kho na 'brel pa yin zhing skyes bus ma byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i rgyu kho na 'brel pa yin zhing skyes bus ma byas pa yang yin la /
translated: then the mere cause of understanding the meaning is the relation, and it is not created by a person.

original: de la yang brdas gsal bar byas nas don rtogs pa yin no zhe na /🔽brdas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: de la yang brdas gsal bar byas nas don rtogs pa yin no zhe na / brdas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: And the meaning is understood by clarifying it through a convention.

original: brda'i rgyus 'brel pa de dag gsal bar bya ba yin na brda las gzhan 'brel pa'i don rtogs pa don med par 'gyur te nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda'i rgyus 'brel pa de dag gsal bar bya ba yin na brda las gzhan 'brel pa'i don rtogs pa don med par 'gyur te nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the relation is clarified by the cause of a convention, then it is pointless to understand the meaning of a relation that is different from the convention, because it would be powerless.

original: 'brel pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with “Even if there is a relation,” and so on.

original: 'brel pa yod na yang gsal bar byed pa med na ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na yang gsal bar byed pa med na ste /
translated: Even if there is a relation, if it is not clarified,

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa med na rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa med na rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: if it is not made very clear, it is not the cause of understanding.

original: brdas 'brel pa 'dis gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: brdas 'brel pa 'dis gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This relation is clarified by a convention.

original: 'on te 'brel pa de brda las don rtogs pa grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa de brda las don rtogs pa grub pa yin la /
translated: Or, is the relation established by the understanding of the meaning from the sign?

original: grub pa yod na de la nye bar gnas pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: grub pa yod na de la nye bar gnas pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: If it is established, then what is the point of maintaining a relation that exists in the presence of that which is established?

original: grub pa nye bar gnas pa can rgyu ma yin pa 'bras bu med pa can gso zhing yongs su skyong bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: grub pa nye bar gnas pa can rgyu ma yin pa 'bras bu med pa can gso zhing yongs su skyong bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of maintaining a relation that is not a cause, that is, that does not have an effect?

original: 'bras bu med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is without effect, he says,

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The so-called relation,” etc.

original: 'brel pa'i bya ba ni don rtogs pa skyed @256b par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i bya ba ni don rtogs pa skyed @256b par byed pa ste /
translated: The activity of the relation is the production of the understanding of the meaning.

original: shes pa skyed par byed pa de tsam mo //
analyzed: shes pa skyed par byed pa de tsam mo //
translated: That is all that the production of the cognition does.

original: rtogs pa skyed par byed pa de ni brda kho nas byas zin pa'i phyir 'brel pa ni 'bras bu med pa can yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa skyed par byed pa de ni brda kho nas byas zin pa'i phyir 'brel pa ni 'bras bu med pa can yin no //
translated: Since the production of the understanding is already accomplished by the sign alone, the relation is without effect.

original: gal te rtogs pa la rung ba ma yin pa ste /🔽sgra nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa la rung ba ma yin pa ste / sgra nus pa med pa'o //
translated: If you say that the relation is the fitness for the understanding,

original: brda ste tha snyad kyi nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i rung ba nyid 'brel pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: brda ste tha snyad kyi nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i rung ba nyid 'brel pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: then the fitness of the word is the relation, because it is not the fitness of the sign, i.e., the conventional.

original: de bas na ci sgra 'brel pa yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: de bas na ci sgra 'brel pa yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: Therefore, it is better to say that the connection is with the word.

original: de nyid 'brel pa can yin zhing de nyid 'brel pa yin pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'brel pa can yin zhing de nyid 'brel pa yin pa ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable to say that the connection is with that very thing and that that very thing is the connection.

original: gal te rung ba nyid 'brel pa ma yin par khas blangs nas ci'i phyir sgra'i rang bzhin nyid 'brel par khas len par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rung ba nyid 'brel pa ma yin par khas blangs nas ci'i phyir sgra'i rang bzhin nyid 'brel par khas len par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you accept that fitness is not the connection, why do you accept that the nature of the word is the connection?

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The cause, etc.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rung ba nyid dang 'dra bar sgra'i nus pa'i ngo bo kho na rung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rung ba nyid dang 'dra bar sgra'i nus pa'i ngo bo kho na rung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Just as fitness is the cause and effect, so too fitness is the nature of the word’s power.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything other than that.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu'i rung ba nyid gang yin pa de ni dper na rgyu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar sgra'i rung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu'i rung ba nyid gang yin pa de ni dper na rgyu'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar sgra'i rung ba nyid dam /
translated: That fitness of a cause that has no effect is like that which becomes the nature of the cause. The fitness of the word is like that.

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rung ba nyid ces blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rung ba nyid ces blta bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, fitness should be viewed as that of the cause and effect.

original: 'di nyid kyis 'di ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rung ba nyid do /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis 'di ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i rung ba nyid do /
translated: This is the fitness of the effect, “This is the effect.”

original: 'di'i 'di nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i rgyu'i rung ba nyid de'i de yang de dag gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di nyid rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i rgyu'i rung ba nyid de'i de yang de dag gi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: This is the fitness of the cause, “This is the cause of that.” And that fitness is just their nature.

original: ci ste 'brel pa can nyid 'brel pa'i rang bzhin thob par ma gyur cig snyam pas gal te rung ba nyid de sgra de las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste 'brel pa can nyid 'brel pa'i rang bzhin thob par ma gyur cig snyam pas gal te rung ba nyid de sgra de las don gzhan yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you think, “Let the fitness not obtain the nature of the relation,” then if that fitness is different from the word,

original: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rung ba nyid 'di'i sgra'i zhes bya ba'i sgra dang rung ba dag gi 'brel pa brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rung ba nyid 'di'i sgra'i zhes bya ba'i sgra dang rung ba dag gi 'brel pa brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of stating the relation of this fitness, which is different, with the word “this” and the word “fitness”?

original: gzhan du na sgra'i rung ba nyid 'di zhes bya ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sgra'i rung ba nyid 'di zhes bya ba grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the fitness of the word “this” would not be established.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i rung ba nyid dang gang yin pa de la sgras phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i rung ba nyid dang gang yin pa de la sgras phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te ;
translated: If the fitness is different, then the word helps that.

original: sgras rung ba nyid la phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgras rung ba nyid la phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the word helps the fitness.

original: sgras bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir sgra'i rung ba nyid ces brjod par rung ba yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sgras bskyed par bya ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir sgra'i rung ba nyid ces brjod par rung ba yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is that which is to be produced by the sound, therefore it is proper to say that it is the fitness of the sound.

original: sgras rung ba nyid la phan btags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgras rung ba nyid la phan btags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the sound helps the fitness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa nyid de rung ba nyid ni phul du byung du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: rtag pa nyid de rung ba nyid ni phul du byung du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Because the fitness, being permanent, cannot be improved.

original: / ci ste rung ba nyid la yang sgras tha dad pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: / ci ste rung ba nyid la yang sgras tha dad pa nyid kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if the sound helps the fitness by its mere presence,

original: sgras byas pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa dang rung ba nyid kyis 'brel pa gang yin pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgras byas pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa dang rung ba nyid kyis 'brel pa gang yin pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then it should be said that the sound helps by a connection with the fitness that is produced by the sound.

original: ci ste phan 'dogs pa dang rung ba de dag la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa gzhan yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste phan 'dogs pa dang rung ba de dag la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa gzhan yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if there is another help for those two, the help and the fitness,

original: de la @257a * //
analyzed: de la @257a * //
translated: then in that case,

original: yang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas phan 'dogs par byed pa gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa na /
analyzed: yang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas phan 'dogs par byed pa gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa na /
translated: since the other and other helps are understood in the manner explained,

original: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: there is the fault of infinite regress.

original: thug pa med pa des na tha dad pa la phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thug pa med pa des na tha dad pa la phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no infinite regress, there is no assistance to that which is different.

original: de ltar phan 'dogs par ma grub pa nyid ni rung ba nyid dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phan 'dogs par ma grub pa nyid ni rung ba nyid dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is not established that there is assistance, it is not established that there is a relation of inherence with inherence.

original: 'on kyang rung ba nyid tha dad pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rung ba nyid tha dad pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa na /
translated: But when inherence assists that which is different,

original: sgra dang rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par byed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang rang gi ngo bos phan 'dogs par byed kyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
