translated: it assists by means of its own nature, not by means of another nature,

original: sgra ni phan 'dogs pa'i byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni phan 'dogs pa'i byed pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise it would follow, absurdly, that sound does not assist.

original: de'i tshe rung ba nyid la yang sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi rung ba nyid de ;
analyzed: de'i tshe rung ba nyid la yang sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi rung ba nyid de ;
translated: At that time, inherence in the object is also inherence by means of the nature of sound.

original: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid kyis don la rtogs pa bskyed par rung bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin nyid kyis don la rtogs pa bskyed par rung bar ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the object is capable of producing the understanding of the meaning by means of the nature of sound?

original: ji ltar rung ba nyid la phan 'dogs par byed par 'dod pa de ltar rung ba bdag nyid gyur pas don rtogs pa kho na byed pa yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba nyid la phan 'dogs par byed par 'dod pa de ltar rung ba bdag nyid gyur pas don rtogs pa kho na byed pa yin no zhes 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Just as one wishes to benefit the suitable, so too one should accept that the meaning is understood only by becoming suitable oneself.

original: brgyud pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brgyud pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the use of an intermediary?

original: de bas na rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i 'brel pa tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i 'brel pa tha dad pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no connection called “suitability” at all.

original: de ni don rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi brda kho na las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi brda kho na las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not the cause of understanding the meaning, because the meaning is understood from the expression alone.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas pa khyed kyi yang brda ni ji ltar sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas pa khyed kyi yang brda ni ji ltar sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yin /
translated: Well then, how is the expression a connection between the word and the meaning in your Buddhist system?

original: ci ltar na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar na mi 'gyur te /
translated: How is it not?

original: skyes bu rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it engages with persons.

original: don 'di'i sgra rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa rjod par byed pa ni brda yin la /
analyzed: don 'di'i sgra rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pa rjod par byed pa ni brda yin la /
translated: The expression is the statement of the intention “This is the word for this meaning.”

original: de yang skyes bu rnams la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu rnams la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And that engages with persons,

original: sgra dang don dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not with the word and the meaning.

original: chos ni gzhan gyi 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni gzhan gyi 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of a word is not related to something else,

original: rta'i chos pa lang dag ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rta'i chos pa lang dag ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the meaning of the word “horse” is not related to the word “cow.”

original: slob dpon gyis brda 'ba' zhig 'brel pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis brda 'ba' zhig 'brel pa ma yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: The master [Nāgārjuna] states the following to demonstrate that not only is the relationship of mere convention not tenable,

original: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa gzhan don dam pa pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa gzhan don dam pa pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: but also the relationship between words and their meanings that is ultimate in the sense of being ultimate in reference to the referent is not tenable:

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dres pa'am /🔽gzhan gyi dbang ngam phan tshun ltos pa'i 'brel par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo 'dres pa'am / gzhan gyi dbang ngam phan tshun ltos pa'i 'brel par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Inasmuch as things are not mixed,🔽There is no relationship.

original: ma 'dres pa phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la de'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la de'i ngo bo ma 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no relationship that has the nature of nonmixing between things that are not mixed, that is, that are mutually distinct.

original: de dag tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag tha dad pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it follows that they would not be distinct,

original: gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be identical.

original: de bzhin du grub pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du grub pa rnams te /
translated: Likewise, in the case of established things,

original: rang gi ngo bo mthar phyin pa rnams la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel @257b pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mthar phyin pa rnams la gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel @257b pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor do those that have perfected their own nature have any relationship that is characterized by dependence on another,

original: grub pa la gzhan gyi dbang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa la gzhan gyi dbang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for that which is established to be dependent on another.

original: phan tshun ltos pa can gyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa can gyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Nor do they have a relationship that is mutually dependent,

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because they are not dependent,

original: grub pa ni gzhan thams cad la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni gzhan thams cad la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is established is not dependent on anything else.

original: de yang 'brel pa rtag pa las rgyas par bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma spros so //
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa rtag pa las rgyas par bshad zin pa'i phyir 'dir ma spros so //
translated: Moreover, this has been extensively explained in the chapter on the permanent relationship, so it is not elaborated here.

original: 'o na gal te sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the relationship between words and their referents does not exist,

original: ji ltar sgra byung ba rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra byung ba rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: how can the arising of words be subsumed within inference?

original: de'i tshe brda la yang dgos pa ci zhig yod par byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i tshe brda la yang dgos pa ci zhig yod par byed ce na /
translated: And at that time, what purpose does a convention serve?

original: de'i phyir don gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The specific object . . .”

original: don gyi khyad par ni smra ba po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa de ston par byed cing brjod par 'dod pa des 'phangs shing bskyed pa'i ngag gis rang gi rgyud la snang ba'i don te /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par ni smra ba po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa de ston par byed cing brjod par 'dod pa des 'phangs shing bskyed pa'i ngag gis rang gi rgyud la snang ba'i don te /
translated: The specific meaning is the meaning that appears in the continuum of the speaker, that is, the meaning that is indicated and expressed by the speech projected and generated by the desire to speak.

original: tshig rang gi rgyu brjod par 'dod pa de la snang ba ston cing gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: tshig rang gi rgyu brjod par 'dod pa de la snang ba ston cing gsal bar byed do //
translated: The words appear to the one who desires to speak and they indicate and clarify that meaning.

original: rtogs pa po gang la ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: rtogs pa po gang la ston par byed ce na /
translated: To whom is it indicated?

original: 'di las 'di'i zhes shes pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'di las 'di'i zhes shes pa'i ste /
translated: To the one who knows this from that.

original: brjod par 'dod pa 'di las tshig 'di 'ongs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de la'o //🔽phyir ni de ltar te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa 'di las tshig 'di 'ongs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de la'o // phyir ni de ltar te /
translated: To the one who understands that this word comes from that desire to speak.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dag ni skyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dag ni skyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that the nature of the desire to speak and the verbal informative form are related as that which is generated and that which generates it,

original: blo skyed par byed pa dang sgra bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo skyed par byed pa dang sgra bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind generates the desire to speak and the word is generated by the desire to speak.

original: de bas na sgra las rtogs pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na sgra las rtogs pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is understood from the word because the word is not uttered unless the meaning is present.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa de bas na /
translated: The word is the nature of that which is to be produced and that which produces.

original: blo la yod pa'i don med na sgra mi 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: blo la yod pa'i don med na sgra mi 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the word is not uttered unless the meaning is present in the mind.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir sgra las don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir sgra las don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is understood from the word because the word is the cause of the presence of the meaning.

original: de bas na ji ltar na sgra las don rtogs pa dang / ji ltar sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar na sgra las don rtogs pa dang / ji ltar sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de lan btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, we have answered the question, “How is the meaning understood from the word? How is the cognition that arises from the word included in inference?”

original: de'i tshe brda la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang de gsal bar byed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe brda la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na zhes smras pa gang yin pa de la yang de gsal bar byed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: We have also answered the question, “What is the purpose of the convention?” The response is, “It clarifies that.”

original: de gsal bar byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba gsal bar byed pa brda yin te /
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa ni med na mi 'byung ba gsal bar byed pa brda yin te /
translated: It clarifies that, i.e., it clarifies the invariable relation. The convention is that which clarifies.

original: 'dis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it clarifies that.

original: ji skad du rjod par byed de /
analyzed: ji skad du rjod par byed de /
translated: How does it express that?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgra dang don dag gis 'brel ba ni ldog par mi byed de /🔽de med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa @258a * //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sgra dang don dag gis 'brel ba ni ldog par mi byed de / de med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa @258a * //
translated: The connection between the word and the object as explained is not rejected,

original: khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a connection characterized by the absence of one of the two is accepted.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig don dam pa'i 'brel pa don gzhan 'dod pa de bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig don dam pa'i 'brel pa don gzhan 'dod pa de bkag pa yin no //
translated: However, the connection of a different nature in the ultimate sense is rejected.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni brda las shes par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni brda las shes par byed pa ste /
translated: From that means from the convention.

original: don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag ni med na mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The part that causes understanding of the object is established as a connection characterized by the absence of one of the two.

original: 'brel pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir brda la nye bar btags nas 'brel pa'i tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir brda la nye bar btags nas 'brel pa'i tha snyad du byas pa yin te /
translated: The convention of connection is made by metaphorically designating the convention in order to clarify the connection.

original: phyogs la lar 'brel pa'i tha snyad du byas pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs la lar 'brel pa'i tha snyad du byas pa la 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: In some places, the convention of connection is made without contradiction. This is implied.

original: brda de nyid kyang yongs su 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brda de nyid kyang yongs su 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That convention itself is not a complete connection.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa las gzhan nyid sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa rtag pa nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa las gzhan nyid sgra dang don dag gis 'brel pa rtag pa nyid yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the relation of word and meaning is permanent, but different from the relation that has the characteristics explained above.

original: des ni tshig ste sgra rnams don gcig la nges pa yod na brda'i dbang las kyang gang la sgra'i 'di ma nges pa de la don gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni tshig ste sgra rnams don gcig la nges pa yod na brda'i dbang las kyang gang la sgra'i 'di ma nges pa de la don gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a restriction of words to a single meaning, then one would understand the other meaning from the power of convention.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir don gcig la so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa des 'brel pa med pa'i don rtogs par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gcig la so sor nges pa'i 'brel pa des 'brel pa med pa'i don rtogs par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to understand a meaning that is not related by a relation that restricts each to a single meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa de ni don med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa de ni don med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the relation would be meaningless.

original: 'dod par mi 'gyur na 'brel pa des 'brel pa med pa'i don rtogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod par mi 'gyur na 'brel pa des 'brel pa med pa'i don rtogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept that, then it is not the case that one understands a meaning that is not related by that relation.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: skyes bu 'dod pa'i dbang gis brdar byas pa can gyi sgra thams cad kyis don thams cad gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod pa'i dbang gis brdar byas pa can gyi sgra thams cad kyis don thams cad gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: All words that are created by the power of desire of beings clarify all objects.

original: rab tu gsal bar byed par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed par mthong ngo //
translated: We see that they are very clear.

original: gal te don gcig la sgra ni dngos su 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te don gcig la sgra ni dngos su 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If one says that a word is not directly related to a single object,

original: 'on kyang don du ma la sgra 'ba' zhig gis don de dang de la gnas pa tsam byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang don du ma la sgra 'ba' zhig gis don de dang de la gnas pa tsam byed do zhe na /
translated: but rather that a word alone merely abides in this and that object,

original: don du ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don du ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If you accept that a word is related to many objects,

original: don du ma dang mngon par 'brel par sgras khas len na don du ma la so sor nges pa'i rig byed pa'i sgra gang gi tshe don gcig la nges pas brda byed pas mngon par gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i don kho na byed
analyzed: don du ma dang mngon par 'brel par sgras khas len na don du ma la so sor nges pa'i rig byed pa'i sgra gang gi tshe don gcig la nges pas brda byed pas mngon par gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i don kho na byed
translated: then when a word that is related to many objects is used to clarify a single object,

original: kyi / gzhan 'gal ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: kyi / gzhan 'gal ba nyid ni ma yin no zhes nges pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: at that time there is no certainty that it will clarify only the intended object,

original: 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid de /
analyzed: 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid de /
translated: because it is possible that it will clarify an object that is incompatible with it.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don las 'gal ba'i don @258b gsal bar byed pa srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don las 'gal ba'i don @258b gsal bar byed pa srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is possible that the meaning that is the opposite of the desired meaning will be clarified.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: If one says “but,” etc., it explains:

original: don gcig la so sor nges pa yin na brda'i dbang gis don du ma ston par byed pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba de bas na mthong ba de dang 'gal bar ma gyur cig snyam pas sgra thams cad don thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin no
analyzed: don gcig la so sor nges pa yin na brda'i dbang gis don du ma ston par byed pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba de bas na mthong ba de dang 'gal bar ma gyur cig snyam pas sgra thams cad don thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin no
translated: If the meaning is ascertained individually, it is seen that the power of the convention indicates many meanings. That contradicts what is seen. Therefore, thinking “may it not contradict that which is seen,” all words express all meanings.

original: // de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: // de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid pa ston par byed de /
translated: Thus, if one says “in that case,” etc., it shows that it is possible to clarify the contradiction.

original: ji ltar thams cad thams cad kyi rjod par byed par 'dod pa de ltar 'di la yang 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad thams cad kyi rjod par byed par 'dod pa de ltar 'di la yang 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Just as one asserts that everything expresses everything, in that case, one should assert that

original: don thams cad ni 'bras bu thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs la thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don thams cad ni 'bras bu thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs la thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: all meanings are not the establishers of all results, because it is reasonable to obtain just that.

original: rigs la ni rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs la ni rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The reason is that the cause and effect are ascertained individually.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the cause and effect are ascertained individually.

original: de las te rigs pa de yod na so so'i nges pa khyad par can gyi dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mngon par 'dod pa'i don mtho ris la sogs pa gang la yod pa de'i yul du gyur pa la /
analyzed: de las te rigs pa de yod na so so'i nges pa khyad par can gyi dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu mngon par 'dod pa'i don mtho ris la sogs pa gang la yod pa de'i yul du gyur pa la /
translated: If that reason exists, then the object that is the cause of establishing the specific individual ascertainment of the object that has the desired end, such as heaven, is the object of that.🔽The word is the one that makes the desired end clear. It is made by the one who makes the sign that makes the desired end clear.

original: sgra ni 'dod pa'i don mngon par gsal bar byed pa nyid de mngon par 'dod pa'i don nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa brda byed pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin /
analyzed: sgra ni 'dod pa'i don mngon par gsal bar byed pa nyid de mngon par 'dod pa'i don nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pa brda byed pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de gang las yin /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: sgra khyad par lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: sgra khyad par lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: It is like a specific word.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa thams cad kyi thun mong ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa thams cad kyi thun mong ste /
translated: It is common to all that is to be established and that which establishes it.

original: bsgrub par bya ba 'bras bu thams cad dang / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag ni rjod par byed pa nyid du thun mong du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba 'bras bu thams cad dang / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag ni rjod par byed pa nyid du thun mong du gyur ba'o //
translated: All results to be accomplished and the intrinsic identity of the cause that accomplishes them just as they are are common denominators in the expression.

original: 'di skad du me la sbyin sreg par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni don thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'di skad du me la sbyin sreg par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni don thams cad kyi rjod par byed pa yin na yang /
translated: Although the words “one should make an oblation into fire” and so on express all meanings,

original: gang me la spyin sreg gi sgras bstan pa'i don 'ga' zhig po de nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang me la spyin sreg gi sgras bstan pa'i don 'ga' zhig po de nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: the meaning indicated by the word “oblation into fire” is not the means of accomplishing any of those,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is refuted that “all is the means of accomplishing all” and so on.

original: de la khyad par can gyi don 'ga' zhig ni mtho ris sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la khyad par can gyi don 'ga' zhig ni mtho ris sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, some specific meaning is the means of accomplishing the higher realms,

original: rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the intrinsic nature itself.

original: de la don 'ga' zhig dngos po'i gnas thams cad kyis mtho ris grub par byed pa nyid la brda'i rnam pa 'dis /
analyzed: de la don 'ga' zhig dngos po'i gnas thams cad kyis mtho ris grub par byed pa nyid la brda'i rnam pa 'dis /
translated: In this regard, some object that the meaning of the word is not established by all the facts, and that the word “fire sacrifice” is used figuratively.

original: me la sbyin sreg gi sgra gsal bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg gi sgra gsal bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that the word “fire sacrifice” is used figuratively to mean “heaven”?

original: ci mtho ris dang 'gal ba'i don gzhan la @259a * //
analyzed: ci mtho ris dang 'gal ba'i don gzhan la @259a * //
translated: Or is it that the word “fire sacrifice” is used figuratively to mean something else that is incompatible with “heaven”?

original: yin zhes blo dman pa the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin zhes blo dman pa the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the word is not established by all the facts, and so the word is used figuratively.

original: me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the sentence “One should offer a fire sacrifice,”

original: me la mar la sogs pa 'dzud pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam gyi ngag gi don de ni mtho ris grub par byed pa nyid tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: me la mar la sogs pa 'dzud pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam gyi ngag gi don de ni mtho ris grub par byed pa nyid tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: the meaning of the word “fire sacrifice” is not established by a valid cognition to mean “heaven.”

original: lung las grub pa yin na yang de ni du ma can nyid yin pa'i phyir yid ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung las grub pa yin na yang de ni du ma can nyid yin pa'i phyir yid ches pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it were established by scripture, it would not be credible because it would be figurative.

original: de skad du me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris thob pa 'gal du zin kyang blo dman pa'i phyir 'dis shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris thob pa 'gal du zin kyang blo dman pa'i phyir 'dis shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though it is contradictory that one attains heaven from a fire sacrifice, because the intellect is weak, one does not understand this.

original: sgra de brjod par bya ba thams cad la ma nges par 'gyur ba don 'ga' zhig la nges pa skyes bu ste skyes bu'i brda las thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra de brjod par bya ba thams cad la ma nges par 'gyur ba don 'ga' zhig la nges pa skyes bu ste skyes bu'i brda las thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound would not be definite with regard to all the things that are expressed, and the definite arising of some meaning would be due to the convention of a person.

original: skyes bu des kyang mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu des kyang mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: And because that person does not know,

original: don 'gal ba yang brda byed par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: don 'gal ba yang brda byed par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: it has been explained that the convention of a meaning that is contradictory would occur.

original: 'di ltar 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not only that which is contradictory that is clarified.

original: rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: And that which is asserted, that the Veda is not made by a person,

original: kun du rtog pa yang don med par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa yang don med par 'gyur /
translated: that also is meaningless.

original: ci ltar yang zhes bya ba'i tshogs pa 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sems pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar yang zhes bya ba'i tshogs pa 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sems pa'o //
translated: The collection of words “in any way” is the thought of the desired meaning.

original: don ma tshol ba ste mi 'dod pa dang ma 'dres pa'i 'dod pa'i don kho na skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgra dag la rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'dres mar byed ba skyes bus rgyur 'chol ba gsal ba ste //
analyzed: don ma tshol ba ste mi 'dod pa dang ma 'dres pa'i 'dod pa'i don kho na skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgra dag la rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'dres mar byed ba skyes bus rgyur 'chol ba gsal ba ste //
translated: Because the desired meaning, which is not sought, which is not mixed with the undesired, is understood from the sounds that are not made by a person, the mixing of the desired and the undesired is clarified as being the cause of a person.

original: rig byed pa dag las phyi rol du byas pa yin no //🔽de ltar gnas pa de las skyes bu rnams kyis ci 'dra bas te /
analyzed: rig byed pa dag las phyi rol du byas pa yin no // de ltar gnas pa de las skyes bu rnams kyis ci 'dra bas te /
translated: The grammarians are outside the pale.

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra rnams rjod par byed pa'i sgra 'ga' zhig la rab tu sbyar ba 'chol bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra rnams rjod par byed pa'i sgra 'ga' zhig la rab tu sbyar ba 'chol bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In this way, the sounds that people desire to be meaningful are applied to some sounds that are not created by people,🔽and they are confused, they are mixed up.

original: 'khrul par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba nyid skyes bu ma byas par mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'khrul par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba nyid skyes bu ma byas par mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra rnams kyang /
translated: The sounds that people desire to be not created by people

original: don thams cad dang thun mong 'gyur ba yod na 'ga' zhig la skyes bu de rnams kyi 'dod pa'i rgyu can gyi brda 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: don thams cad dang thun mong 'gyur ba yod na 'ga' zhig la skyes bu de rnams kyi 'dod pa'i rgyu can gyi brda 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges pas byas pa yin no //
translated: are also common to all meanings. If they were, then the sounds that people desire would be created by the convention that is the cause of the desire of those people.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu de rnams la de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de rnams la de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those people do not know reality.

original: gal te rig byed pa'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don la nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na skyes bus legs par byas pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed pa'i sgra ni ngo bo nyid de rang bzhin gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don la nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na skyes bus legs par byas pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sound of the Vedas is by nature, by its very essence, the ascertainment of the meaning that is intended, then it is not the case that there is a fault in the good work of a person.

original: de lta yin na rigs pa'i sgra ni don @259b gsal bar byed pa na bstan pa la rag las pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin na rigs pa'i sgra ni don @259b gsal bar byed pa na bstan pa la rag las pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then when the sound of a reason makes its meaning clear, it would not depend on a teacher.

original: rag las par yang 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rag las par yang 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: But it does depend on a teacher,

original: ngo bo nyid de dag las don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de dag las don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without those, the meaning is not understood.

original: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis so sor nges par 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe gang du don 'ga' zhig dus gcig gi tsher rdar byas pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de las brda rnam pa gzhan gyis don gzhan ston par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyis so sor nges par 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe gang du don 'ga' zhig dus gcig gi tsher rdar byas pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis de las brda rnam pa gzhan gyis don gzhan ston par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if it were by nature ascertained individually, then when a certain meaning is made known at a certain time by a certain sound, it would not be the case that another meaning would be taught by another sound in some other way.

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa yang yin pa de bas na ngo bo nyid kyi don gcig la nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa yang yin pa de bas na ngo bo nyid kyi don gcig la nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is made clear, and therefore the meaning is not ascertained by nature in one way.

original: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyi don gcig la nges pa yin na ni don gcig la sos sor nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang ngo bo nyid kyi don gcig la nges pa yin na ni don gcig la sos sor nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the meaning of the word is ascertained in one way, then the meaning of the word is not ascertained in another way.

original: rig byed pa'i ngag rnams la 'chad pa po rnams kyi 'chad pa po'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i ngag rnams la 'chad pa po rnams kyi 'chad pa po'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The words of the Vedas are the conceptual thoughts of the expounders.

original: 'chad pa'i khyad par gzhan dang gzhan gang yin pa 'dir yang mi 'gyur na /🔽'gyur ba gang yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'chad pa'i khyad par gzhan dang gzhan gang yin pa 'dir yang mi 'gyur na / 'gyur ba gang yin pa de bas na /
translated: If the words of the Vedas are not different from other words,🔽then they are just like the words of other people.

original: de bas gzhan pa'i skyes bus byas pa'i ngag dang 'dra bar byed pa'i sgra rnams ni don gcig la nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas gzhan pa'i skyes bus byas pa'i ngag dang 'dra bar byed pa'i sgra rnams ni don gcig la nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the words of the Vedas are not ascertained in one way.

original: 'chad pa'i khyad par yang yod pa yin te /🔽rig byed pa'i ngag rnam par rtog par nus pa can yin te /🔽don sna tshogs pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa nus pa yod pa 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad pa'i khyad par yang yod pa yin te / rig byed pa'i ngag rnam par rtog par nus pa can yin te / don sna tshogs pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa nus pa yod pa 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of the Vedas are different from other words.🔽The words of the Vedas are capable of expressing various meanings.🔽The words of the Vedas are capable of expressing various meanings because they have the ability to express various meanings.

original: rnam par rtog pa nus pa can rig byed pa'i ngag de la ston pa ste ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nus pa can rig byed pa'i ngag de la ston pa ste ;
translated: The words of the Vedas are capable of expressing various meanings because they have the ability to express various meanings.

original: 'chad pa gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chad pa gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa la mi slu ba med pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is explained is not deceptive with regard to the desire of that person,

original: 'di yang 'ga' zhig tu'am gzhan dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyir te gtan tshigs kyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni don med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'ga' zhig tu'am gzhan dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // phyir te gtan tshigs kyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni don med pa can nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: because there is no certainty that this will be so in some cases and not in others.

original: de brtags su zin kyang 'khrul pa'i dogs pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brtags su zin kyang 'khrul pa'i dogs pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is meaningless, because even if it is imagined, the suspicion of error is not removed.

original: rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel par 'dod pa gang yin pa des kyang /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i sgra rnams don dang lhan cig 'brel par 'dod pa gang yin pa des kyang /
translated: Whoever asserts that the words of the Vedas are related to the meaning

original: 'brel pa yang rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs brjod par bya'o //
translated: must state a reason for positing that relation.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: To what?

original: tha dad pa rnams kyi ste sgra dang don dag gi rang bzhin rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams kyi ste sgra dang don dag gi rang bzhin rnams kyi'o //
translated: To the different natures of words and meanings.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no relation that has the nature of identity because they have different natures, he says, “External objects, such as pots and cloth, are not the nature of sound, nor are they the nature of sound.”

original: phyi rol gyi don bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ni sgra'i ngo bo ma yin zhing rang bzhin ma yin te /🔽sgra ni bum pa dang snam bu @260a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa ni sgra'i ngo bo ma yin zhing rang bzhin ma yin te / sgra ni bum pa dang snam bu @260a * //
translated: External objects, such as pots and cloth, are not the nature of sound, nor are they the nature of sound.

original: la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na sgra'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na sgra'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If sound were the nature of pots and cloth, it would follow that the nature of sound would be destroyed.

original: sgra ni don rnams ni ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni don rnams ni ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not the nature of objects,

original: don rnams ni sgra'i rang bzhin du gyur pas bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnams ni sgra'i rang bzhin du gyur pas bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if objects were the nature of sound, it would follow that the nature of pots and so on would be destroyed.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can gang gis med na mi 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can gang gis med na mi 'byung ba nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: That which has the nature of nondifference is that without which something would not occur.

original: med na med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med na med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without it, it would not occur.

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i bye brag la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i bye brag la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yang ngo //
translated: “Even though they are different in terms of their states” means that even though the probandum and the proof are different in terms of their specific negations.

original: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ni ldog pas tha dad pa yin na yang bdag nyid gcig nyid kyis med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ni ldog pas tha dad pa yin na yang bdag nyid gcig nyid kyis med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even though producedness and impermanence are different in terms of their negations, they are still invariably related, because they are the same in nature.

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no relationship that has the characteristic of arising from it,

original: sgra de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgra de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Those sounds . . .” and so on.

original: de nyid ni sgra rnams kyi de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par gyur nas brjod par 'dod pa la brten pa'i don nam phyi rol gyi don las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de nyid ni sgra rnams kyi de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel par gyur nas brjod par 'dod pa la brten pa'i don nam phyi rol gyi don las 'gyur grang na /
translated: If those sounds were to become the relationship that has the characteristic of arising from it, then the meaning that is the basis of the desire to speak would be from the external object.

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, that is not the case.

original: 'di ltar rig byed pa dag gi sgra de brjod par 'dod pa las skye ba can du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed pa dag gi sgra de brjod par 'dod pa las skye ba can du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the sounds of the Grammarians are not accepted as arising from the desire to express.

original: brjod par 'dod pa las skyes shing 'byung ba gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa las skyes shing 'byung ba gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that which has arising and occurrence from the desire to express” is to be applied to the above.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they accept that sound is permanent.

original: skye ba med pa can te 'byung ba med pa can yin na yang brjod du 'dod pas gsal bar bya ba dag ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa can te 'byung ba med pa can yin na yang brjod du 'dod pas gsal bar bya ba dag ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is without arising and without occurrence, it is not something that is made manifest by the desire to express.

original: rtag pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would undermine its permanence.

original: gsal bar bya ba ma yin na yang /
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba ma yin na yang /
translated: Even if it is not made manifest,🔽it would still be something that is produced.

original: bskyed par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhes gong du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The second position is also not correct.

original: don la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “It is not dependent on an object.”

original: phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la rag las pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on an external object.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent.

original: gzhan dag gis ni gzhung gcig tu byas nas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni gzhung gcig tu byas nas 'chad par byed de /
translated: Others, however, explain that the two are to be taken as a single treatise.

original: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa las skye ba can yang ma can yang ma yin zhing /🔽des gsal bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa las skye ba can yang ma can yang ma yin zhing / des gsal bar bya ba yang ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning is not produced from the desire to speak, nor is it the mother of that desire to speak,🔽nor is it that which is manifested by the desire to speak,

original: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na don la rag las pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na don la rag las pa ma yin te /
translated: therefore, in both cases, the meaning is not dependent on the word,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not dependent on external things.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas don rnams la sgra sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas don rnams la sgra sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the word is applied to the meaning through the desire to speak,

original: don @260b yang na de bstan par 'dod pa de las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don @260b yang na de bstan par 'dod pa de las sgra 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or because the word arises from that desire to speak which is the indicator of the meaning.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'am de'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni ngag nye bar dgod pa'am de'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: Therefore means: it is a particle indicating a reason or it has the sense of because.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'o //
translated: That means: it is not related.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba sgra de dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba yod par 'gyur ba sgra de dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par 'gyur /
translated: How can those words establish the existence of the meaning which is related to that?

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of how?

original: de la so sor nges pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de la so sor nges pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should establish the ascertainment of that.

original: don de la sgra rnams kyi de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba dag gi 'brel pa so sor nges pa gang yin pa des bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: don de la sgra rnams kyi de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba dag gi 'brel pa so sor nges pa gang yin pa des bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the connection of those words with that nature which arises from it should be established.

original: don gang la rag las pa med pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa ma yin no //🔽// bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: don gang la rag las pa med pa de ni sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa ma yin no // // bam po nyi shu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: That which does not depend on an object is not a logical proof.

original: don bshad zin pa tshigs su bcad pas sdud par byed de /
analyzed: don bshad zin pa tshigs su bcad pas sdud par byed de /
translated: The author summarizes the meaning that has been explained in verse:

original: skyes bus legs par byas pa la ltos pa'i sgra rnams ni bden pa'i don can nam log pa'i don dag yin la /
analyzed: skyes bus legs par byas pa la ltos pa'i sgra rnams ni bden pa'i don can nam log pa'i don dag yin la /
translated: Words that depend on the good actions of a person have a true meaning or a false meaning.🔽Those people accept that the words of the Vedas are not well made.

original: skye sbu de dag gis rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni legs par ma byas par khas len pa de bas na /🔽skye sbus legs par ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: skye sbu de dag gis rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni legs par ma byas par khas len pa de bas na / skye sbus legs par ma byas pa ste /
translated: Therefore,🔽the words of the Vedas, which are not well made by a person,

original: gtan tshigs su gyur pas rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni bden pa'i don can nam brdzun pa'i don can nyid de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su gyur pas rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni bden pa'i don can nam brdzun pa'i don can nyid de /
translated: are either true or false in meaning,🔽because they are a logical proof.

original: rnam pa kun du don med par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du don med par 'gyur /
translated: In every way, they are meaningless.

original: don med par gsal ba'i phyir skyes bus log par byas pa khas len par byed na /
analyzed: don med par gsal ba'i phyir skyes bus log par byas pa khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that it is a false convention because it is a clear non-entity,🔽then you must accept that the meaning of a word is false because it is created by a person.🔽And if you accept that, then you must accept that the meaning of a word is not false because it is created by a person.

original: skyes bu spong bas log pa'i don can ldog pas sems la dri ma med par byas nas /🔽yang legs par byas pa 'dod pas dri ma de nyid phyir 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu spong bas log pa'i don can ldog pas sems la dri ma med par byas nas / yang legs par byas pa 'dod pas dri ma de nyid phyir 'jog par byed pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dngos su glang po khrus 'drar 'gyur te / glang po che ni dri ma bsal bar bya ba'i phyir khrus byas nas yang 'dam gyis bdag nyid la gos par byed do //

original: gzhan yang sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yod par 'gyur na /🔽rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa yod par 'gyur na / rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur te /

original: dngos po la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa yin na de la yang brtag pa gnyis bya ste /🔽skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa can yin te /
translated: But if you accept that, then you must accept that the meaning of a word is not false because it is created by

original: brkyang bskum la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: brkyang bskum la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It arises by the power of the person’s desire, like the stretching and contracting of arms, etc.

original: mi 'jug pa can yin te /
analyzed: mi 'jug pa can yin te /
translated: Or it is not engaged,

original: 'di ni myu gu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni myu gu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: unlike a sprout, etc., which is engaged by the power of the person’s desire.

original: de la mi rtag pa yin la gal te skyes bu la rag las ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa yin la gal te skyes bu la rag las ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is impermanent and not dependent on the person,

original: de ni skyes bu la rag las pa ma yin pa nyid @261a * //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu la rag las pa ma yin pa nyid @261a * //
translated: then it is not dependent on the person.

original: yod na / yul la sogs pa gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yod na / yul la sogs pa gyur pa ste /
translated: If it exists, it is changed by the object, etc.

original: yul la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan nyid du gyur pas so //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan nyid du gyur pas so //
translated: The object, etc., are changed into another aspect.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang gnas skabs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang gnas skabs gzung ngo //
translated: The term “etc.” includes time and condition.

original: skyes bu'i bsam pa ji bzhin du ste skyes bu gang gis ji ltar bstan par 'dod pa de ltar sgra des ston par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i bsam pa ji bzhin du ste skyes bu gang gis ji ltar bstan par 'dod pa de ltar sgra des ston par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The sound does not manifest in accordance with the person’s desire, i.e., in accordance with the way the person desires to hear it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bus ston par 'dod pa yod na yang rag lus pa med pa'i sgra ni 'ga' zhig tu yang mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bus ston par 'dod pa yod na yang rag lus pa med pa'i sgra ni 'ga' zhig tu yang mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even if one wishes to teach by means of a person, a sound that is not dependent is not possible in any way.

original: skyes bus sbyar ba 'ga' zhig tu yang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bus sbyar ba 'ga' zhig tu yang mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible in any way for a person to apply it.

original: ri bo la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is like a mountain, etc.

original: dper na ri bo la sogs pa skyes bu la rag las pa ma yin pa dag ni 'dod pa yin du zin kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor ba nus pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bo la sogs pa skyes bu la rag las pa ma yin pa dag ni 'dod pa yin du zin kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor ba nus pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, even if one wishes, it is not possible to apply a mountain, etc., which are not dependent on a person, in accordance with one’s wishes.

original: yul la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ni mthong ste /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ni mthong ste /
translated: One sees that a transformation of an object, etc., is taught in accordance with one’s thoughts.

original: yul gzhan la sogs pa la don gzhan pa can gyi sgra de nyid ni ;
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs pa la don gzhan pa can gyi sgra de nyid ni ;
translated: That very sound which has a different meaning in another object, etc.,

original: yul la sogs pa don gzhan du ston pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa don gzhan du ston pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is observed to teach a different meaning in another object, etc.

original: de bas na skyes bu rnams la 'brel pa rag las pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu rnams la 'brel pa rag las pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that persons are not dependent on a connection.

original: 'brel pa mi rtag pa skyes bu la rag las pa nyid ma yin pa de'i nyes pa bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'i nyes pa 'di nyid ni 'brel pa rtag pa'i yang skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa mi rtag pa skyes bu la rag las pa nyid ma yin pa de'i nyes pa bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'i nyes pa 'di nyid ni 'brel pa rtag pa'i yang skyon yin no //
translated: The fault just explained, namely, that the connection is impermanent and does not depend on the person, is also a fault of the permanent connection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa de'i rtag pa'i ngo bo ste /🔽rten pa'i rang bzhin yul la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa de'i rtag pa'i ngo bo ste / rten pa'i rang bzhin yul la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The nature of that connection is permanent.🔽It is not tenable that the object, etc., which have the nature of the support, are different because of being transformed.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam gzhan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam gzhan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Like space, they are not tenable as different.

original: gal te don gcig la nges par 'brel par 'gyur na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te don gcig la nges par 'brel par 'gyur na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If the connection were to be ascertained in one object, this fault would occur.

original: 'on te don thams cad la 'brel pa mtshungs par gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don thams cad la 'brel pa mtshungs par gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the connection remains the same in all objects,

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the verse states, “The connection would remain the same in all states.”

original: 'brel pa'i gnas skabs la don rtogs par gyur pa'i don thams cad la mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i gnas skabs la don rtogs par gyur pa'i don thams cad la mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The connection in all states is the same and similar in all objects that are cognized.

original: 'dod pa'i don gang yin pa de la so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don gang yin pa de la so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty in the object that is desired.

original: de nyid la nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid la nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no certainty in that,

original: don thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: there is no ascertainment of the specific object that is desired from that which is common to all objects.

original: don du ma dang 'brel pa can gyi sgras kyang skyes bus legs par byas pa las 'dod pa'i don la so sor @261b nges pa ston pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don du ma dang 'brel pa can gyi sgras kyang skyes bus legs par byas pa las 'dod pa'i don la so sor @261b nges pa ston pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that even a word that is related to many objects indicates a specific object that is desired by a person who has done well.

original: de yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: And that has already been explained, as follows:

original: don du ma dang mngon 'brel na //🔽'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid //
analyzed: don du ma dang mngon 'brel na // 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid //
translated: If it is related to many objects,🔽it is possible that it will clearly express a contradiction.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa des thar par 'gyur ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa des thar par 'gyur ba bshad zin to //
translated: And so on.

original: re zhig de ltar 'brel pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag skyes bu la rag las pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon bshad zin to //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar 'brel pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag skyes bu la rag las pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the error has been explained that a permanent or impermanent relation is not dependent on a person.

original: 'brel pa skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa yin na yang skyes bus byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'jug pa yin na yang skyes bus byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khrul par dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If the relation is based on the desire of a person, then it is the work of a person, and so there is the doubt of error,

original: skyes bu 'khrul pa'i rgyu khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu 'khrul pa'i rgyu khas len pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'brel pa rtag pa nyid kyi skyon gzhan ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa rtag pa nyid kyi skyon gzhan ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: brjod par bya ba'i don 'brel pa can rnams mi rtag phyir /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don 'brel pa can rnams mi rtag phyir /
translated: Because the related objects to be expressed are impermanent,

original: de dag 'jig pa can yin na de la brten pa 'brel pa yang 'jig pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de dag 'jig pa can yin na de la brten pa 'brel pa yang 'jig pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: if they are perishable, then the relation based on them is perishable. Thus,

original: 'brel pa la rtag yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'brel pa la rtag yod ma yin //
translated: the relation is not permanent.

original: gzhan la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed /
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed /
translated: “Based on another, etc.” explains.

original: gzhan la brten pa can 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa can 'brel pa yin te /

original: 'brel pa 'di la gzhan la brten pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'di la gzhan la brten pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this relation has the existence of being based on another.

original: ni'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa can la 'brel pa rag las pa med pa yin na 'brel pa can de dag gi 'brel pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can la 'brel pa rag las pa med pa yin na 'brel pa can de dag gi 'brel pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the related things do not depend on the relation, then the relation of those related things is not tenable.

original: rta ba lang dang 'dra bar ltos pa med pas don 'ga' zhig de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rta ba lang dang 'dra bar ltos pa med pas don 'ga' zhig de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since the horse is not related to the cow, it does not have any relation with it.

original: ; sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa'i rten de yang mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: ; sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa'i rten de yang mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: The basis of the relation between words and their meanings is impermanent,

original: don rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the meanings are impermanent.

original: rten de zhig cing nyams pa dang / 'brel pa brten pa yang zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten de zhig cing nyams pa dang / 'brel pa brten pa yang zhig par 'gyur te /

original: sgron ma 'jig pa na de la brten pa'i 'jig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgron ma 'jig pa na de la brten pa'i 'jig pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as when a lamp is destroyed, the flame that is based on it is also destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ste /

analyzed: gal te rten 'jig pa na yang brten pa mi 'jig pa 'dod pa de'i tshe /

original: rten du mngon par 'dod pa de la 'brel pa brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten du mngon par 'dod pa de la 'brel pa brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the relation that is based on that which is manifestly accepted as the basis would not be based on it.

original: gang zhig gang 'jig pa na mi 'jig pa de ni de la brten par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang 'jig pa na mi 'jig pa de ni de la brten par rigs pa ma yin te /

original: dper na bum pa 'jig pa na snam bu mi 'jig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'jig pa na snam bu mi 'jig pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a pot is destroyed, a cloth is not destroyed.

original: rten 'jig pa na 'jig par 'gyur ba de bas na 'brel ba rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten 'jig pa na 'jig par 'gyur ba de bas na 'brel ba rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: And when the support is destroyed, the supported is destroyed. Therefore, the relation is not permanent.

original: de'i rten gyi don yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa de'i 'brel pa can ci'i rten yin zhes rten brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rten gyi don yang brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa de'i 'brel pa can ci'i rten yin zhes rten brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of support should also be stated. The support of that relation should be stated, i.e., what is the support of the related?

original: rten gyi don ni phan 'dogs pa'i don yin na de la yang 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi don ni phan 'dogs pa'i don yin na de la yang 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of support is the meaning of benefit. But that is not present in this case.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

analyzed: 'brel pa rtag pa la phan gdags su med pa @262a * // nyid kyi phyir te /

original: phul du byung bar byar med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phul du byung bar byar med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i rten du mngon par 'dod pa yang rten ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i rten du mngon par 'dod pa yang rten ma yin par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te ; 'brel pa can rnams mi rtag phyir //
analyzed: gal te ; 'brel pa can rnams mi rtag phyir //
translated: If the related are impermanent,

original: 'brel pa la rtag yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'brel pa la rtag yod ma yin //

original: zhes gang bshad pa gsal bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur na skyon der 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa gsal bar brjod par bya bar 'gyur na skyon der 'gyur te /

original: rigs rtag pa de brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs rtag pa de brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /

translated: The response to that is as follows: If the reason were established as something to be stated, the reason would not be something to be stated.

original: de la rigs don byed rung min //

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa nyid du 'dod pas 'brel pa med pa can gyi sgra de yag /
translated: Then the sound that is asserted to be the means of expression would be without a relation.

original: 'di la 'brel pa med pa de ltar na de'i @263a * //
analyzed: 'di la 'brel pa med pa de ltar na de'i @263a * //
translated: If it is unrelated to it, then it is not a condition.🔽

original: dngos po ste /
analyzed: dngos po ste /
translated: If it is unrelated to it, then it is a non-entity.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is unrelated.

original: 'di ni snga na me dpa'i brjod par bya ba dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni snga na me dpa'i brjod par bya ba dang 'brel pa ma yin no //

original: de ni brjod par bya ba dang sngar ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba dang sngar ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is established as prior to the object of expression and related to it by intrinsic reality,

original: rten zhig pa las zhig par 'gyur la 'brel pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pas na med pa dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten zhig pa las zhig par 'gyur la 'brel pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin pas na med pa dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when its basis is destroyed, it is destroyed. Since there is no other relation, it does not become related to non-existence.

original: gal te brjod par bya bar mngon par 'dod pas gsal bya rnams mtha' yas pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya bar mngon par 'dod pas gsal bya rnams mtha' yas pa can yin pa'i phyir /

original: gsal ba re re zhig na yang gsal ba gzhan srid pas /
analyzed: gsal ba re re zhig na yang gsal ba gzhan srid pas /
translated: then even if each manifestation exists, another manifestation is possible,

original: 'brel pa zhig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa zhig pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: gdon mi za bar 'brel pa zhig par khas blang bar bya'o ;
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'brel pa zhig par khas blang bar bya'o ;

analyzed: ; de lta ma yin na gsal ba 'brel pa'i rten du mi 'gyur te /

original: zhig na yang 'brel pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig na yang 'brel pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and when they are destroyed, the connection is not destroyed.

original: skyes shing 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sngar ma byung ba yin te /
analyzed: skyes shing 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sngar ma byung ba yin te /
translated: “Arisen and occurred” means not previously arisen.

original: gang dang gang dag skyes pa de rnams la re zhig skyes pa las sngar 'brel pa gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dag skyes pa de rnams la re zhig skyes pa las sngar 'brel pa gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Those that have arisen do not have a connection that exists prior to their arising.

original: gnyi ga la gnas pa ni 'bral ba can med par gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la gnas pa ni 'bral ba can med par gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for that which exists in both to exist without the possessor of the connection.

original: 'brel pa gnas pa med pa de'i phyir de dag ni 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur ba de bas na brjod par bya ba ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa gnas pa med pa de'i phyir de dag ni 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur ba de bas na brjod par bya ba ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the connection does not exist, they would not be connected, and therefore they would not be objects of expression.

original: gal te yang de la 'brel pa gnas pa med pa de ltar na yang don de rnams dang lhan cig 'brel pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang de la 'brel pa gnas pa med pa de ltar na yang don de rnams dang lhan cig 'brel pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bas na skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But if the connection does not exist in them, then the connection would arise simultaneously with those objects. Therefore this error does not exist.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, “In that case, etc.”

original: skyes shing byung ba'i dngos po de yang 'brel pa don dang lhan cig skyes pa na ste rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes shing byung ba'i dngos po de yang 'brel pa don dang lhan cig skyes pa na ste rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: And that entity which has arisen and occurred is related to the object at the time of its arising.🔽It is not tenable that sounds have a nature

original: sgra rnams la ni rang bzhin dag / rnam par ldog par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgra rnams la ni rang bzhin dag / rnam par ldog par mi rigs so //
translated: that is eliminated.

original: gang 'di phyis don dang lhan cig 'brel pa skyes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang 'di phyis don dang lhan cig 'brel pa skyes par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is the case that later it is related to the object,

original: sgra la sngar de dag 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra la sngar de dag 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then previously the sound does not have the nature of being related to it,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related.

original: phyis 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyis 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is related later,

original: sgra rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par bzlog par gyur na de yang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par bzlog par gyur na de yang rtag pa nyid kyi phyir mi rigs so //
translated: then it is not tenable that the nature of sounds is eliminated, because it is permanent.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: If you ask, “Why?”🔽he explains it with “If a sound that previously had a relation . . . ”

original: sngar 'brel pa can zhig nas sgra gang la 'brel pa zhig yod pa de la don gzhan te phyir 'byung ba la 'brel pa med cing bral ba'am /
analyzed: sngar 'brel pa can zhig nas sgra gang la 'brel pa zhig yod pa de la don gzhan te phyir 'byung ba la 'brel pa med cing bral ba'am /
translated: If a sound that previously had a relation with a certain object were to later become unrelated to another object, that is, to become separated from it,

original: de bzhin du don rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don rnams te /
translated: then in the same way,

original: phyis 'byung ba rnams brjod par bya ba yin par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes shing 'byung ba'i @263b don 'brel pa dang ldan pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe /🔽'brel pa skyes bus zin kyang sgra la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba rnams brjod par bya ba yin par ma gyur cig snyam pas skyes shing 'byung ba'i @263b don 'brel pa dang ldan pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe / 'brel pa skyes bus zin kyang sgra la mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the meaning of the word arises in dependence on the person.🔽If you think that the meaning of the word arises in dependence on the word, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the person, then the word would not arise in dependence on the meaning.

original: 'brel pa de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽phyis skyes pa de dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi sgra de ni ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na / phyis skyes pa de dang 'brel pa med pa can gyi rang bzhin gyi sgra de ni ste /
translated: If you think that the word arises in dependence on the meaning, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the meaning, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the person, then the word would not arise in dependence on the meaning.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the meaning, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.

original: sgra la sngar yang 'brel pa med pas de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yod pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: sgra la sngar yang 'brel pa med pas de dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yod pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: If you think that the word arises in dependence on the person, then the word would not arise in dependence on the meaning.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the meaning, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.

original: sgra ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa med pa can gyi rang bzhin ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /🔽rang bzhin bzlog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa med pa can gyi rang bzhin ldog pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na / rang bzhin bzlog pa med pa ste /
translated: If you think that the word arises in dependence on the person, then the word would not arise in dependence on the meaning.🔽If you think that the word arises in dependence on the meaning, then the word would not arise in dependence on the person.

original: sngar 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dor ba med pa'i de'i ngo bo mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar 'brel pa med pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa dor ba med pa'i de'i ngo bo mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: If you think that the word arises in dependence on the person, then the word would not arise in dependence on the meaning.

original: 'brel pa de dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa de dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for the nature of the related object to be related to that relation.

original: de bas na sgra 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sgra 'brel pa can ma yin par 'gyur zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the word would not be related.

original: ci ste sgra phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang 'brel pa'i rten du 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang 'brel pa'i rten du 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: But if the word, even though not a benefactor, were the basis of the relation, then,

original: 'dir don dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: 'dir don dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: in this regard, he says “the object together with . . . ” and so on.

analyzed: gzhan las grub pa zhes bya ba ni sgra las gzhan pa'i don las grub pa sgra phan 'dogs pa med pa la de mi rten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Established from another” means established from the object, which is other than the word. Because the word, which is not a benefactor, is not its basis.

original: ci ste sgra ni 'brel pa skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste sgra ni 'brel pa skyed pa la lhan cig byed pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if the word is asserted to be a co-operating cause in the production of the relation,

original: sgra de yang de skyed par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgra de yang de skyed par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa nyid de /
translated: then that word is a co-operating cause in the production of that relation.

original: 'brel pa skyed par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na sgra'i nus pa nyid rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa skyed par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa nyid yin na sgra'i nus pa nyid rtag tu skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /

original: dus thams cad du 'brel pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'brel pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the relation would be produced at all times.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci ltar gzhan la lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: phyis kyang 'brel pa'i dus su yang nus pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sngar gyi nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
