original: yi ge rnams rjod par byed pa ma yin na yang tshig la sogs pa rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: yi ge rnams rjod par byed pa ma yin na yang tshig la sogs pa rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If the letters are not the expressors, then the words, etc., will be the expressors.

original: tshig la sogs pa de ni ci yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa de ni ci yang mi rung ngo //
translated: But that is not possible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: yi ge rnams las tshig la sogs pa de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams las tshig la sogs pa de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for the words, etc., to be different or non-different from the letters.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni snang ba tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni snang ba tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: If they are different, they will be perceived as different.

original: mi snang ba nyid yin na yang rjod par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid yin na yang rjod par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even if they were not manifest, they would not be expressive,

original: ma bzung bar shes par bya ba nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bzung bar shes par bya ba nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for something to be known without being apprehended.

original: tha dad pa med pa yin na yang yi ge nyid dang 'dra bar rjod pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa yin na yang yi ge nyid dang 'dra bar rjod pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they were not distinct, it would follow, absurdly, that they would not be expressive, just like the letters themselves.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yi ge rnams las tshig la sogs pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'gal ba de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yi ge rnams las tshig la sogs pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'gal ba de bas na /
translated: Therefore, since it is contradictory for a word, etc. to be distinct from or identical to the letters,

original: tshig la sogs pa dngos por gyur ba ma yin no //🔽dbang po'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can te /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa dngos por gyur ba ma yin no // dbang po'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can te /
translated: words, etc. are not real entities.🔽The special sense consciousness is the ear consciousness that is clear with regard to the apprehension of the arrangement of the letters.

original: yi ge bkod pa 'dzin pa la gsal ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba des nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa /
analyzed: yi ge bkod pa 'dzin pa la gsal ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba des nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa /
translated: The subsequent consciousness is that which comes about through the experience of that consciousness.

original: rigs mthun pa'i bag chags rigs gcig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa nye bar len pa rnam par rtog pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i bag chags rigs gcig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa nye bar len pa rnam par rtog pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The potentiality of a homogeneous latent impression of the same type is the potentiality of a conception. That which has that is called a conception.

original: rigs mthun pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar len pa can yang de yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar len pa can yang de yin la rnam par rtog pa yang yin pa de bas na zhes bya ba khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is also the appropriator of homogeneous latent impressions and is also a conceptualization.

original: da la snang ba'i tshig dang ngag la gcig tu snang bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: da la snang ba'i tshig dang ngag la gcig tu snang bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: When the word and speech that appear as one appear,

original: gcig tu 'khrul cing rnam par 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu 'khrul cing rnam par 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: they are one and are mistaken and confused.

original: 'di skad du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can gyi phyis 'byung ba'i yid rnam par shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'di skad du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa khyad par can gyi phyis 'byung ba'i yid rnam par shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: This is what is taught: The conceptual mental consciousness that arises after the special auditory consciousness

original: tshig dang ngag la gcig tu sgro 'dogs par byed do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig dang ngag la gcig tu sgro 'dogs par byed do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: superimposes the word and speech as one.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgro 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgro 'dogs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the power of error, that very superimposition

original: tshig la sogs pa gcig tu snang ba can de yang log pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa gcig tu snang ba can de yang log pa kho na yin no //
translated: the appearance of the word and so on as one is also just false.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar snang ba can gyi tshig la sogs pa don dam par gcig dang du ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba can gyi tshig la sogs pa don dam par gcig dang du ma nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word and so on that appear in that way are ultimately not suitable as one or many.

original: re zhig tshig la sogs pa gcig ma yin no /
analyzed: re zhig tshig la sogs pa gcig ma yin no /
translated: First, a word and so on is not one.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blos yi ge bkod pa du ma rim par 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blos yi ge bkod pa du ma rim par 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable for the mind to apprehend many letters arranged in sequence.

original: gcig nyid @270b yin na ni blo gcig nyid kyis thams cad du gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid @270b yin na ni blo gcig nyid kyis thams cad du gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were one, then the mind itself would apprehend everything.

original: gcig la bzung ba ma bzung ba'i rang bzhin mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la bzung ba ma bzung ba'i rang bzhin mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable for the nature of one to be apprehended and not apprehended.

original: gal te blo gcig gis tshig la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo gcig gis tshig la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the mind apprehends words and so on,

original: de ni ci zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni ci zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it is said, “What is that?” and so on.

original: tshig la sogs pa de ni blo gcig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa de ni blo gcig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Those words and so on are not to be apprehended by a single mind,

original: yi ge'i tshogs go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs go rims ji lta ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa drug pa /
translated: because the collection of letters is apprehended in sequence.

original: re zhig yi ge gcig rdzogs pa'i dus na blo du ma 'das pa yin na /
analyzed: re zhig yi ge gcig rdzogs pa'i dus na blo du ma 'das pa yin na /
translated: If a single letter is completed, many minds have passed.

original: yi ge mang po rnams la lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir yi ge gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yi ge mang po rnams la lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir yi ge gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show that there is no need to mention many letters, he says, “When one letter is apprehended,” and so on.

original: yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i dus na blo du ma 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gcig 'dzin pa'i dus na blo du ma 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one letter is apprehended, many cognitions are blocked.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cognitions are momentary.

original: de lta ni bden na /
analyzed: de lta ni bden na /
translated: If that is so,

original: dus ji srid la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i dus de srid ni skad cig yin pa de bas na /🔽blo gcig kho nas tshig la sogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa'i dus de srid ni skad cig yin pa de bas na / blo gcig kho nas tshig la sogs pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then for as long as the apprehension of the letter lasts, for that long it is momentary.

original: skad cig ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽skad cig ma nu dus ji srid kyi rdul phra rab gzhan las 'das pa dus de srid pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /🔽skad cig ma ni cha dang bral ba'i dus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / skad cig ma nu dus ji srid kyi rdul phra rab gzhan las 'das pa dus de srid pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te / skad cig ma ni cha dang bral ba'i dus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he says, “A single cognition does not apprehend a word and so on,”🔽because the time of the moment is the time of the duration of the atom that passes beyond other atoms.🔽Because the moment has a time that is free from parts.

original: skad cig ma ni cha dang bral ba'i dus can gyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni cha dang bral ba'i dus can gyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The moment is the ultimate of that which has a time that is free from parts.

original: de yang rdul phra rab gcig las 'das pa'i dus can kho na yin par rigs so //
analyzed: de yang rdul phra rab gcig las 'das pa'i dus can kho na yin par rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that it has a time that is beyond a single atom.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i dus las skad cig ma lhag pa yin par khas len na ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i dus las skad cig ma lhag pa yin par khas len na ni /
translated: If one accepts that there is a moment that is beyond the time that has been explained,

original: cha can te skad cig ma char che ba la dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha can te skad cig ma char che ba la dus kyi mtha' mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not possible to have a limit of time for a whole, that is, for a moment that is greater than an atom.

original: yi ge shin tu tshad chung ba gcig kyang skad cig ma du mas rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge shin tu tshad chung ba gcig kyang skad cig ma du mas rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that even a single letter, which is extremely small in size, is completed by many moments,🔽it is said that the opening of the eye that is not beyond a single atom is simultaneous with the opening of the eye that is beyond many atoms,

original: rdul phra rab tu ma 'das pa can de 'das pa'i mig 'byed pa gang la yod pa de ni rdul phra rab du ma 'das pa can gyi mig 'byed pa de dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu ma 'das pa can de 'das pa'i mig 'byed pa gang la yod pa de ni rdul phra rab du ma 'das pa can gyi mig 'byed pa de dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has the nature of being beyond many atoms.

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge zung du ste shin tu tshad chung ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge zung du ste shin tu tshad chung ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the completion of a letter such as a, which is extremely small in size, is a pair.

original: gal te ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yi ge bkod pa'i tshig la sogs pa la 'jug pa de lta na yang yi ge'i go rims nyams su myong ba'i stobs las dran pa gang yin pa de ni tshig la sogs @271a * //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i shes pa yi ge bkod pa'i tshig la sogs pa la 'jug pa de lta na yang yi ge'i go rims nyams su myong ba'i stobs las dran pa gang yin pa de ni tshig la sogs @271a * //
translated: Even if one does engage in the words, etc., of the written letters as one experiences the consciousness, still, the memory that arises from the power of experiencing the order of the letters apprehends the words, etc., without the order of the letters being written.

original: pa bkod pa med pa 'dzin to zhe na ma yin no //
analyzed: pa bkod pa med pa 'dzin to zhe na ma yin no //
translated: No, it does not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why not?

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the memory is in accordance with the experience.

original: ji ltar sgra'i go rims bzhin du nyams su myong ba ji ltar dran pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i go rims bzhin du nyams su myong ba ji ltar dran pas kyang yin te /
translated: The order of the letters is experienced in accordance with the order of the sound, and the memory is in accordance with the experience.

original: de ltar dran pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba can yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba can yin pa de lta na /
translated: If the memory arises in a sequence,

original: de'i dus can te nyams su myong ba'i dus can kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus can te nyams su myong ba'i dus can kho na yin no //
translated: then it has the same time as the experience.🔽Just as the order of the letters is in accordance with the experience, so the order of the memory of the sound is in accordance with the order of the experience.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i go rims bzhin du yin pa de ltar sgra rjes su dran pa'i go rims kyang srog chags thams cad kyi rang rig pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i go rims bzhin du yin pa de ltar sgra rjes su dran pa'i go rims kyang srog chags thams cad kyi rang rig pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If the memory has the same nature as the self-awareness of all living beings,

original: nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i go rims 'di la khyad par brtags pa med do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba'i go rims 'di la khyad par brtags pa med do //
translated: There is no difference in the order of experience.

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i go rims dag gi khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i dran pa'i go rims dag gi khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference in the order of memory of experience, there is no difference in the order of words and sentences.

original: dran pa gcig gis tshig dang ngag 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa gcig gis tshig dang ngag 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: One memory does not hold words and sentences.

original: tshig la sogs pa du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are there many words and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo la tha dad pa med par blo la tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo la tha dad pa med par blo la tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no difference in the cognition, and because the difference does not appear in the cognition.

original: tshig dang ngag gi rnam pa can gyi blo la tha dad pa med par gcig nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang ngag gi rnam pa can gyi blo la tha dad pa med par gcig nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that has the form of words and sentences appears as one without difference.

original: blo la snang ba'i dbang gis gcig nyid dang du ma nyid rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i dbang gis gcig nyid dang du ma nyid rnam par 'jog par 'gyur te /
translated: Singularity and multiplicity are posited by the power of appearance to cognition.

original: blo la tshig la sogs pa snang ba gcig gi ngo bo can nyid yin pas tshig dang ngag gcig go zhes gcig nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la tshig la sogs pa snang ba gcig gi ngo bo can nyid yin pas tshig dang ngag gcig go zhes gcig nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conception that superimposes singularity arises, thinking One word, one sentence, due to words and so on appearing to cognition as having the nature of one.

original: re zhig yi ge rnams kyi bkod pa'i sgo nas nyams su myong ba'i blo skye zhing /
analyzed: re zhig yi ge rnams kyi bkod pa'i sgo nas nyams su myong ba'i blo skye zhing /
translated: For a while, the experience of letters arises from the perspective of their arrangement.

original: de la gcig tu snang ba yod pa ma yin la dran pa yang ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin skye bar 'gyur zhing de yang gcig par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam de la gang la tshig dang ngag tha dad pa med
analyzed: de la gcig tu snang ba yod pa ma yin la dran pa yang ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin skye bar 'gyur zhing de yang gcig par 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ma yin nam de la gang la tshig dang ngag tha dad pa med
translated: And isn’t it explained that “there is no appearance of unity in that, and memory arises just as it is experienced, and that is not the apprehension of unity”?

original: par snang ba'i blo gzhan ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: par snang ba'i blo gzhan ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What other mind is there that appears without a difference in words and speech?

original: de la kha cig ni nyams su myong ba dang dran pa go rims bzhin du skyes nas phyis 'byung ba can gcig tu zhen pa'i blo skye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bshad par 'dod do //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni nyams su myong ba dang dran pa go rims bzhin du skyes nas phyis 'byung ba can gcig tu zhen pa'i blo skye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du bshad par 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that this is explained from the perspective of the arising of experience and memory in sequence, and later the arising of the mind that conceives them as one.🔽For example, it is like the following:

original: dper na / gzhan dag sgra yis bsgos pa'i sa bon can ;
analyzed: dper na / gzhan dag sgra yis bsgos pa'i sa bon can ;
translated: Others, with seeds imbued by sound,

original: / tha ma'i sgra dang bcas par ni //
analyzed: / tha ma'i sgra dang bcas par ni //
translated: At the end, together with sound,

original: yongs smin skye ba can gyis ni //
analyzed: yongs smin skye ba can gyis ni //
translated: With the arising of complete ripening,

original: blo la ming dag nges par byed //🔽ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: blo la ming dag nges par byed //🔽ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The mind ascertains the names.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i blo'i dbang gis kyang phyi rol la tshig dang ngag gi gcig pa nyid khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i blo'i dbang gis kyang phyi rol la tshig dang ngag gi gcig pa nyid khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to accept that external things are the same as words and speech, even by the power of such a mind.

original: gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i blo de ni @271b 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu sgro 'dogs pa'i blo de ni @271b 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that mind which superimposes oneness is itself mistaken.

original: gzhan dag ni blo las zhes lnga pa brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni blo las zhes lnga pa brjod do //
translated: Others say “from the mind,” adding the fifth case ending.

original: tshig dang ngag gi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo la tshig dang ngag dag tha dad pa med par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig dang ngag gi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo la tshig dang ngag dag tha dad pa med par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because words and speech appear to the conceptual mind that has the aspect of words and speech as undifferentiated.

original: blo gcig las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo gcig las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not different from a single mind.

original: blo gcig las tha dad pa med pa yin na ni ji ltar na du mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: blo gcig las tha dad pa med pa yin na ni ji ltar na du mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are not different from a single mind, how can they be many?

original: de'i du ma nyid de tshig la sogs pa'i du ma nyid ni 'og nas 'gegs par 'gyur ba nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i du ma nyid de tshig la sogs pa'i du ma nyid ni 'og nas 'gegs par 'gyur ba nyid phyir ro //
translated: Because their multiplicity, the multiplicity of words and so on, will be refuted later.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma nyid du mi rung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma nyid du mi rung ba de'i phyir /
translated: That is, because it is not tenable that they are one or many.

original: tshig la sogs pa dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore words and so on are not things.

original: yang na de ni zhes bya ba ni tshig la sogs pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na de ni zhes bya ba ni tshig la sogs pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Or else, “that” is connected with the words, etc.

original: tshig la sogs pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Words, etc. are not entities,

original: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because singularity and plurality are not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po de'i rnam par rtog pa de las ma 'das pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po de'i rnam par rtog pa de las ma 'das pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the conception of an entity does not go beyond that.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conception of singularity and plurality does not go beyond that.

original: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa dngos po yin na yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa dngos po yin na yang /
translated: Even if the relationship between words and referents as asserted by others is an entity,

original: de ji ltar de'i rten can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i rten can du 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be the basis of those?

original: tshig dang ngag dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i rten can du 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig dang ngag dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i rten can du 'gyur /
translated: Words and speech are not entities, so how could they be its basis?

original: gang la tshig dang dag de'i rten yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la tshig dang dag de'i rten yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that which is the basis of words and speech” should be analyzed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshig la sogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rten du bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rten du bya bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because words, etc. are not entities, they are not suitable to be a basis.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rten du gyur par bya ba med pa yin na 'brel pa brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rten du gyur par bya ba med pa yin na 'brel pa brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if there is no basis, then the relation is not based.

original: de ltar rten med pa can nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rten med pa can nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is thus without a basis, therefore it is not a relation.

original: 'brel pa ni rtag tu gzhan dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rtag tu gzhan dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For a relation is always dependent on something else.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni rang bzhin can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni rang bzhin can nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since this is so, therefore the relation of word and meaning is not natural.

original: de'i bsam pa can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ci 'dra bar rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa can gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ci 'dra bar rigs pa dang ldan pa yin pa de ston par byed do //
translated: He shows what kind of relation of word and meaning is reasonable, with the words “the intention of that . . . ” and so on.

original: de'i bsam pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni don ston par byed pa'i bsam pa can gyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni don ston par byed pa'i bsam pa can gyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The intention of that is the application of the intention to reveal the meaning.

original: nang gi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: nang gi g-yo 'gul la sogs pa gang yin pa de las byung ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound arises from the internal movement and so on.

original: de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i stobs kyis bshad do //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i stobs kyis bshad do //
translated: That is explained by the power of reason.

original: mngon par gsal ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i sgo nas de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i sgo nas de skad du bshad do //
translated: The term “manifestation” is explained from the perspective of the intention of others.

original: der 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni don bstan pa'i bsam pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni don bstan pa'i bsam pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Non-erroneous” means that there is no error in the intention to teach the meaning.

original: sgra'i 'brel pa 'di ni de kho na nyid de @272a * //
analyzed: sgra'i 'brel pa 'di ni de kho na nyid de @272a * //
translated: This connection of the word is reality.

original: don bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is non-erroneous in teaching the meaning.

original: don bstan pa'i bsam pas sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bstan pa'i bsam pas sgra sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word is employed with the intention to teach the meaning.

original: sgra'i 'byung ba dang mngon par gsal ba de yang don bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i 'byung ba dang mngon par gsal ba de yang don bstan pa la 'khrul pa med pa la brten pa ste /
translated: That manifestation and origination of the word is also based on non-erroneous teaching of the meaning.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan de yang skyes bu'i sbyor bas byas pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bus byas pa yin pas na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i rgyu mtshan de yang skyes bu'i sbyor bas byas pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bus byas pa yin pas na /
translated: And that reason for non-erroneousness is also produced by the application of a person, thus it is produced by a person.

original: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi 'brel pa ni skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection between the word and the meaning is produced by a person.

original: de'i sgo nas te ji skad du bshad pa'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ni /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas te ji skad du bshad pa'i 'brel pa'i sgo nas ni /
translated: Through that, i.e., through the connection as explained,

original: don rtogs pa la nges pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: don rtogs pa la nges pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: there is certainty in understanding the meaning.

original: sgra rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin par brjod par 'gyur ba na yang de nyid 'khrul pa ste bla ba yin te ;
analyzed: sgra rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin par brjod par 'gyur ba na yang de nyid 'khrul pa ste bla ba yin te ;
translated: Even if one were to say that sounds are not produced by persons, that is just a delusion, a lie.

original: skyes bus byas pa'i 'brel pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i 'brel pa ni 'khrul pa'i rgyur khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is mistaken, because we accept that a relationship created by a person is a cause of error.

original: de ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtog pa ni don med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtog pa ni don med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, the idea that the words are not created by a person is pointless.

original: dpyod pa pa rnams kyis rig byed kyi ngag rnams skyes bus ma byas kyang 'dod lo //
analyzed: dpyod pa pa rnams kyis rig byed kyi ngag rnams skyes bus ma byas kyang 'dod lo //
translated: The Mīmāṃsakas assert that the words of the Vedas are not created by a person,

original: rig byed kyi rtsom pa po rnams byed pa po rnams mi dran phyir te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi rtsom pa po rnams byed pa po rnams mi dran phyir te /
translated: but they do not remember the authors of the Vedas.

original: rtags kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the evidence.

original: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: They explain this with “Because of the absence of memory, etc.”

original: don mang po dag gis byed pa po mi dran pa de tsam gyis ma byas pa dag ma yin te /
analyzed: don mang po dag gis byed pa po mi dran pa de tsam gyis ma byas pa dag ma yin te /
translated: The mere absence of memory of the author by many people does not prove that the Vedas are not created,

original: dper na khron pa rnying pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khron pa rnying pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as, for example, an old well, etc., is not.

original: de ltar na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the reason is mistaken,

original: rig byed pa'i ngag rnams byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul can ma yin pa rgyal dpog pas rjod par byed do //
analyzed: rig byed pa'i ngag rnams byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa 'di ni rigs pa'i tshul can ma yin pa rgyal dpog pas rjod par byed do //
translated: The Mīmāṃsakas, who are skilled in reasoning, say that the Vedas are not composed by a person because they do not remember the author.

original: de ltar yang de lta bu'i rnam pa'i dngos po 'di la yang rjes su brjod pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar yang de lta bu'i rnam pa'i dngos po 'di la yang rjes su brjod pa yod do //
translated: But in this case, too, there is a response.

original: 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: What is that?

original: gcig tu de ltar ngan pa mun khyab byed /
analyzed: gcig tu de ltar ngan pa mun khyab byed /
translated: The darkness of such evil is all-pervasive.

original: de ltar na re zhig byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du smra ba'i rgyal dpog gang yin pa de nyid shes rab 'tshal ba de 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du smra ba'i rgyal dpog gang yin pa de nyid shes rab 'tshal ba de 'dra ba ste /
translated: Thus, the Mīmāṃsakas, who say that the Vedas are not composed by a person because they do not remember the author, are indeed wise.

original: shin tu rmongs pa ji ltar skye zhing 'byung snyam pas /🔽kho bo cag gi sems ngo mtshar dang rjes su brtse ba dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa ji ltar skye zhing 'byung snyam pas / kho bo cag gi sems ngo mtshar dang rjes su brtse ba dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could such a great fool arise?🔽Because our minds are engaged with amazement and compassion.

original: sems ngo mtshar dang rjes su brtse ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sems ngo mtshar dang rjes su brtse ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Our minds are amazed and compassionate.

original: thob pa can yin du zin kyang de dang 'dra ba'i ma rig pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa can yin du zin kyang de dang 'dra ba'i ma rig pas rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they do obtain it, they are still afflicted by ignorance similar to that.

original: ngo mtshar dang bcas pa dang ma rig pa'i 'ching ba brten pos sems can rnams gdung bar byed pa'i phyir rjes su brtse ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang bcas pa dang ma rig pa'i 'ching ba brten pos sems can rnams gdung bar byed pa'i phyir rjes su brtse ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are full of compassion, because they are tormented by the affliction of sentient beings who are bound by the bonds of ignorance and are full of wonder.

original: 'di la 'dir gzhan dag kyang @272b ste ;
analyzed: 'di la 'dir gzhan dag kyang @272b ste ;
translated: Here, others also,

original: da ltar de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba rtog pa dang ldan pa snyam sems pa de ni 'di ltar yin no zhes rjes su rjod par byed pas /
analyzed: da ltar de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba rtog pa dang ldan pa snyam sems pa de ni 'di ltar yin no zhes rjes su rjod par byed pas /
translated: who are followers of his doctrine in the present, who are endowed with imagination, and who think, “This is the way it is,” repeat after him.

original: srid pa ste 'gro ba brtse ba med cing snying rje med pas gnod pa can du mun pa gang gis gnod pa de ni /
analyzed: srid pa ste 'gro ba brtse ba med cing snying rje med pas gnod pa can du mun pa gang gis gnod pa de ni /
translated: The existence of the world, which is without compassion and is afflicted by the darkness of non-compassion,

original: srid pa brtsab  med pas gnod pa can ngan pa mun pa khyab pa yin no ;
analyzed: srid pa brtsab  med pas gnod pa can ngan pa mun pa khyab pa yin no ;
translated: is pervaded by the darkness of the wicked.

original: /'dir mi shes pa nyid la ngan par brjod par rigs kyi srog chags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: /'dir mi shes pa nyid la ngan par brjod par rigs kyi srog chags ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is proper to call ignorance “the wicked one,” not a living being.

original: 'di ltar srog chags de skad du smra na yang phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog chags de skad du smra na yang phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, even though the animal speaks in this way, it is helpful,

original: phan pa thob par 'dod pa de /
analyzed: phan pa thob par 'dod pa de /
translated: and the one who desires to obtain help

original: des slu bar byed cing 'khrul par byed pa la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: des slu bar byed cing 'khrul par byed pa la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
translated: is deceived and deluded by it. What is the fault?

original: 'on kyang nyes pa 'di ni mi shes pa kho na yin no//
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa 'di ni mi shes pa kho na yin no//
translated: However, this fault is only ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar smra ba de yang shes rab 'tshal ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar smra ba de yang shes rab 'tshal ba yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it that one who speaks in this way is also considered to have wisdom?

original: 'di ltar sgrub par byed pa 'di ni ma grub pa dang ma nges pa can yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub par byed pa 'di ni ma grub pa dang ma nges pa can yin pas so //
translated: Because this proof is unestablished and indefinite.

original: de la ma grub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la ma grub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of the unestablished,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says “thus” and so on.

original: bde bar gshegs pa pa dag gis rig byed kyi byed pa po brgyad la sogs pa dran no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa pa dag gis rig byed kyi byed pa po brgyad la sogs pa dran no //
translated: The followers of the Sugata remember the eight creators of the Vedas and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi thung mi thung lha dang / sna tshogs bshes gnyen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi thung mi thung lha dang / sna tshogs bshes gnyen la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes the dwarf, the dwarf god, the various spiritual friends, and so on.

original: gzigs zan te bye brag dag gis dbyig gi snying po can ni tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: gzigs zan te bye brag dag gis dbyig gi snying po can ni tshangs pa ste /
translated: The one who sees the various is Brahmā, the one who has the essence of wealth.

original: rig byed kyi byed pa por dran par byed do //
analyzed: rig byed kyi byed pa por dran par byed do //
translated: the author of the Veda is remembered.

original: de bas na byed pa po mi dran pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa po mi dran pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-establishment of the author is not established.

original: gal te bde bar gshegs pa pa dag dang gzegs zan de dag rig byed kyi byed pa po dran pa smra ba de log par smra ba yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bde bar gshegs pa pa dag dang gzegs zan de dag rig byed kyi byed pa po dran pa smra ba de log par smra ba yin pa de bas na gtan tshigs grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the followers of the Sugata and the followers of Kanada, who propound the memory of the author of the Veda, are wrong, then the reason is established.

original: da ni rig byed las gzhan pa'i sgra gang skyes bus byas pa yin te /🔽'ga' zhig kyang skyes bus byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni rig byed las gzhan pa'i sgra gang skyes bus byas pa yin te / 'ga' zhig kyang skyes bus byas pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, any sound other than the Veda is produced by a person,🔽because it is a sound, like the sound of a drum.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dran par smra ba log pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dran par smra ba log pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the propounders of the memory of the author are wrong.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that very point,

original: gzhon nu 'byung ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'byung ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The one who has the name of Kumara,” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa'i gzhung nag mo'i 'bangs la sogs pa bdag gam gzhan rtsom pa po yin par ston par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa'i gzhung nag mo'i 'bangs la sogs pa bdag gam gzhan rtsom pa po yin par ston par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When you assert that the texts of Kumarila and so on were composed by others,

original: khyed cag gi log par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: khyed cag gi log par smra ba yin te /
translated: you are speaking falsely.

original: khyed cag ni rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar gzhan dag spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa de la byed pa po spong ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa ste /
analyzed: khyed cag ni rtsom par byed pa ma yin no zhes de ltar gzhan dag spong bar byed par 'gyur ro // gal te gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa de la byed pa po spong ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa ste /
translated: You are not the authors of those texts.

original: gzhon nu 'byung ba can la @273a * //
analyzed: gzhon nu 'byung ba can la @273a * //
translated: If you accept that Kumarila and so on are the authors of those texts, then you are undermined,

original: sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because Kumarila and so on are human authors.

original: byed pa po mi dran pa 'di nyid skyes bus ma byas par khas blangs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa 'di nyid skyes bus ma byas par khas blangs pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The fact that you do not remember the author is a further indication that those texts were not composed by humans.

original: sgrub par byed pa de yang gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pa 'dis ji ltar na gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa skyes bus byas par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa de yang gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa la yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa'i rigs pa 'dis ji ltar na gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa skyes bus byas par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: By this reasoning, how could you not accept that the young brahmin Bhadra and so on are created by a person?

original: gang la gang gis gnod pa yin /
analyzed: gang la gang gis gnod pa yin /
translated: What is the harm in that?

original: ci ste rigs pa mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa spong ba khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste rigs pa mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa spong ba khas blangs pa dang 'gal bar 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the reasoning is the same but still reject the young brahmin Bhadra and so on, you contradict your own assertion.

original: khas blangs pas gnod pa de rig byed smra ba gzhan la yang rig byed kyi ngag rnams kyi rtsom pa po spong bar mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pas gnod pa de rig byed smra ba gzhan la yang rig byed kyi ngag rnams kyi rtsom pa po spong bar mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
translated: The fault of contradicting your own assertion is the same for the proponents of the Vedas, since they also reject the author of the Vedic statements.

original: gal te rig byed smra ba de'i ma byas pa nyid 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rig byed smra ba de'i ma byas pa nyid 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say, “We accept that the Vedas are uncreated,

original: byed pa po skyon yang med pa ste /🔽khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po skyon yang med pa ste /🔽khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: so there is no fault of the creator,”🔽then the fault of contradicting your own assertion still exists.

original: rig byed smra ba 'di'i rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes 'dod cing khas blangs pa 'di tshad ma med pa can te /
analyzed: rig byed smra ba 'di'i rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes 'dod cing khas blangs pa 'di tshad ma med pa can te /
translated: The proponents of the Vedas assert that the Vedas are not created by a person.

original: tshad ma dang bral ba lung mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi brtag pa gang las thog ma nas yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad ma dang bral ba lung mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi brtag pa gang las thog ma nas yod par 'gyur /
translated: But how could they be established as existing from the beginning, since they are devoid of valid knowledge?

original: de ltar rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa na /
translated: In this way, if one accepts that the Vedas are not created by a person,

original: byed pa po mi dran par tshad mar 'chad pa de la skyon bstan ma thag pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran par tshad mar 'chad pa de la skyon bstan ma thag pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then the explanation that they are valid knowledge without remembering the author is immediately shown to be faulty.

original: 'di ni tshad ma med pa can 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma med pa can 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Thus this is an assertion devoid of valid knowledge.

original: ci ste tshad ma med par rig byed smra bas rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe glo bur du 'dzin pa can te /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma med par rig byed smra bas rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe glo bur du 'dzin pa can te /
translated: If the proponents of the Vedas assert that the Vedas are not created by a person without valid knowledge, then this is a sudden grasping.

original: rigs pa med par 'dzin pa can gyi dpyod pa pa 'di yang /
analyzed: rigs pa med par 'dzin pa can gyi dpyod pa pa 'di yang /
translated: This is an analysis that grasps without reason.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: It is a proof of something that is not created by a person and so on.

original: tshad ma la ltos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: tshad ma la ltos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of relying on valid cognition?

original: gang gis skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa dpyod pas zhes bya bas skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod pas bdag nyid dub par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa dpyod pas zhes bya bas skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod pas bdag nyid dub par byed do //
translated: By saying “because of analyzing what is and is not the work of a person,” you are setting forth the proof of what is and is not the work of a person, and you are exhausting yourself.

original: rigs ma yin pa 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du de kho na bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rigs ma yin pa 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du de kho na bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If you grasp what is illogical, then you will engage in everything in just that way.

original: 'ga' zhig la tshad ma 'god pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar byed pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la tshad ma 'god pa'i sgo nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar byed pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: What is the use of exhausting yourself by setting forth valid cognition in some cases? This is the condensed meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du tshad ma med pa can de nyid 'dod pa'i gtan @273b tshigs kyis rig byed smra ba'i rig byed kyi byed pa po spong ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa med par 'dod na de las gzhan
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du tshad ma med pa can de nyid 'dod pa'i gtan @273b tshigs kyis rig byed smra ba'i rig byed kyi byed pa po spong ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa med par 'dod na de las gzhan
translated: Therefore, because you assert that the Vedas are not the work of a person without any valid cognition, you are undermined by your own assertion.

original: pa ste / dpyod pa pa de las gzhan pa'i skyes bu gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'dod pas /🔽de byed pa po spong ba khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa med par mtshungs pa'i phyir klan ka btsal du med do //
analyzed: pa ste / dpyod pa pa de las gzhan pa'i skyes bu gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'dod pas / de byed pa po spong ba khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa med par mtshungs pa'i phyir klan ka btsal du med do //
translated: who assert that the words are created by God, etc.🔽Therefore, the objection that the assertion of the creator is contradicted is not applicable to us.

original: de la spong ba la khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba klan ka 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽phul du byung ba mthong ba med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngag rnams rnam pa de lta bur te /
analyzed: de la spong ba la khas blangs pa la yang gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba klan ka 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // phul du byung ba mthong ba med pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngag rnams rnam pa de lta bur te /
translated: The meaning is that the objection that the assertion of the creator is contradicted does not exist.🔽The words that are accepted as created by God, etc., and as not created by God, etc., are of that kind.

original: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa rnams ni phul du byung ba mthong med can zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa rnams ni phul du byung ba mthong med can zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The proofs that they are not created by God, etc., are “because the creator is not remembered,” etc.

original: de ltar na skyes bus byas pa byed pa du ma byed pa po dus ring por 'das pa can dag kyang byed pa po dran pa med pa yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bus byas pa byed pa du ma byed pa po dus ring por 'das pa can dag kyang byed pa po dran pa med pa yod pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, even though the person is the agent of many actions and has long since passed away, the agent is still remembered.

original: gang las rig byed kyi ngag rnams phul du byung ba mthong ba de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las rig byed kyi ngag rnams phul du byung ba mthong ba de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the person who is seen to be the author of the excellent statements of the Vedas does not exist.

original: gang rig byed la skyes bus ma byas pa rnams la byed par mi nus pa can gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rig byed la skyes bus ma byas pa rnams la byed par mi nus pa can gyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor are there any statements of the Vedas that are not the work of a person, and that are incapable of being produced by anyone.

original: skyes bu'i 'bras bu'i sgra'i chos rnams ni 'bras pu'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'bras bu'i sgra'i chos rnams ni 'bras pu'i chos rnams te /
translated: The properties of the result of a person are the properties of the result.

original: skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can nyid la sogs pa 'bras bu'i chos de rnams las khyad par mthong ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can nyid la sogs pa 'bras bu'i chos de rnams las khyad par mthong ba can ma yin no //
translated: The properties of the result are such things as being concomitant with and dependent on a person. The statements of the Vedas are not seen to have any of these properties of the result.

original: ji ltar skyes bus byas pa skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro pa dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin pa de ltar rig byed pa'i yin na yang de bzhin du phul du byung ba mthong ba can du 'gyur na rig byed kyi sgra 'ga' zhig las phul🔽du byung ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bus byas pa skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro pa dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin pa de ltar rig byed pa'i yin na yang de bzhin du phul du byung ba mthong ba can du 'gyur na rig byed kyi sgra 'ga' zhig las phul du byung ba ste /
translated: but the Vedas do not teach anything excellent.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid can khas len zhing gzhan la ni ma yin pas na /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid can khas len zhing gzhan la ni ma yin pas na /
translated: They assert that the Vedas have the characteristic of not being composed by a person, but other texts do not.

original: khas blangs pa la sgrub par byed pa cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la sgrub par byed pa cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Since there is not the slightest proof for their assertion,

original: rig byed smra ba 'di'i 'jug pa rigs pa med pa ste tshad ma mad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rig byed smra ba 'di'i 'jug pa rigs pa med pa ste tshad ma mad pa kho na yin no //
translated: the engagement of these proponents of the Vedas is illogical, that is, it is completely devoid of valid knowledge.

original: de bas na 'di ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason “because the agent is not remembered” is not established.

original: 'dir ma nges pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽man ngag @274a * //
analyzed: 'dir ma nges pa yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / man ngag @274a * //
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni yang dag pa'i man ngag go //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni yang dag pa'i man ngag go //
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag ste /
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa nya gro la rnam thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra gang dag la yod pa de dag ni byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad na /🔽'dis ni byed pa po nyid mi dran pa can bstan to //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid kyi yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa nya gro la rnam thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra gang dag la yod pa de dag ni byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad na / 'dis ni byed pa po nyid mi dran pa can bstan to //
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: byas pa ni skyes bus byas pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa ni skyes bus byas pa'o //
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: de bas na skyes bus byas pa'i ngag la yang byed pa po mi dran pa gnas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bus byas pa'i ngag la yang byed pa po mi dran pa gnas pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.🔽The words of a creator are the words of a creator who is not remembered.

original: gal te byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa can gyis byas pa de 'bad rtsol dang ldan pa'i skyes bus 'di dag byas pa yin no zhes dmigs pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa can gyis byas pa de 'bad rtsol dang ldan pa'i skyes bus 'di dag byas pa yin no zhes dmigs pa de bas na /
translated: If it is argued that the person who is the agent is inferred from the fact that the action is performed, then the person who is the agent is not the person who is the object of the injunction.

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the person who is the agent is inferred from the fact that the action is performed, then the person who is the agent is not the person who is the object of the injunction.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: 'bad rtsol dang ldan du zin kyang byed pa po dran par mi byed par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol dang ldan du zin kyang byed pa po dran par mi byed par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even if there is effort, the agent is not necessarily remembered.

original: 'bad rtsol yod du zin kyang gdon mi za bar byed pa po dmigs pa med pa'i phyir the tshom kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol yod du zin kyang gdon mi za bar byed pa po dmigs pa med pa'i phyir the tshom kho na yin no //
translated: Even if there is effort, the agent is not necessarily perceived, so it is only doubt.

original: gzhan yang skyes bus ma byas par mngon par 'dod par gzhan la yang sgra'i byed pa po dmigs pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'di'i byed pa po dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa ni tshad ma gang las kyang nges pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bus ma byas par mngon par 'dod par gzhan la yang sgra'i byed pa po dmigs pa med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / 'di'i byed pa po dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa ni tshad ma gang las kyang nges pa med do //
translated: Moreover, in the case of what is held to be not produced by a person, non-perception is not established by any valid cognition, because the operation of sound is not perceived by another, and because the agent of this is perceived.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyis bstan pa las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyis bstan pa las so //
translated: But from the teaching of others.

original: ci lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What kind of teaching?

original: yid ches par bya ba ma yin pa ste /🔽tshad ma can ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: yid ches par bya ba ma yin pa ste / tshad ma can ma yin pa las so //
translated: Not from a teaching that is not credible.🔽Not from a teaching that is not authoritative.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bstan pa las dad par byed pa po dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nges par rigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bstan pa las dad par byed pa po dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nges par rigs pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to accept the testimony of a person who is not credible or authoritative.

original: gal te rig byed kyi ngag rnams ni kho bos byas pa dag yin no zhes de skad du smra ba mi dmigs pa des na rig byed kyi ngag rnams byed pa po med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi ngag rnams ni kho bos byas pa dag yin no zhes de skad du smra ba mi dmigs pa des na rig byed kyi ngag rnams byed pa po med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “We do not see anyone who says, ‘I composed the Vedic statements,’ therefore it is certain that the Vedic statements were composed without an author,”

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: then that is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: sgra rnams bdag nyid kyis byas pa la yang bsnyon pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams bdag nyid kyis byas pa la yang bsnyon pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that people deny that they composed the sounds.

original: sgra'i bdag nyid kyis byas su zin kyang /
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid kyis byas su zin kyang /
translated: Even though the sounds were composed by themselves,

original: kho bos de dag ma byas so zhes de ltar bsnyon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: kho bos de dag ma byas so zhes de ltar bsnyon par byed pa ste /
translated: we see that people deny that they composed them, saying, “I did not compose them.”

original: rjod par byed pa mthong ngo /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa mthong ngo /
translated: We see that they deny the expression.

original: de la ci 'dis de dag byas pa'am spyi gzhan gyis zhes nges pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de la ci 'dis de dag byas pa'am spyi gzhan gyis zhes nges pa la brten pa ste /
translated: In this regard, one should rely on certainty with respect to whether this is done by them or by some other general cause.

original: mtha' la brten pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' la brten pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, it is not possible to rely on the extreme of either of these two, i.e., that it is created by that or by some other general principle.

original: de bas na de @274b ltar byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis ma grub pa dang ma nges pa dag gi sgo nas sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de @274b ltar byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'dis ma grub pa dang ma nges pa dag gi sgo nas sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this argument, “because the creator is not remembered,” is refuted by the fact that it is unestablished and indefinite.

original: da ni rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan gyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang sun dbyung ba'i phyir nye bar dgod par byed de /
analyzed: da ni rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan gyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang sun dbyung ba'i phyir nye bar dgod par byed de /
translated: Now, in order to establish that the Veda is not created by a person, he presents other arguments that were stated by others in order to refute them.

original: ji ltar skyes bu 'di ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu 'di ste /
translated: “Just as this person,

original: rig byed 'don pa de lta bas gzhan las thos pa med par rig byed 'di'i yi ge dang tshig gis bkod pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed 'don pa de lta bas gzhan las thos pa med par rig byed 'di'i yi ge dang tshig gis bkod pa'o //
translated: having heard it from another, arranges the letters and words of this Veda without a teacher,

original: de yang yi ge'i bkod pa ni tshig yin la tshig gi bkod pa ni ngag yin te /
analyzed: de yang yi ge'i bkod pa ni tshig yin la tshig gi bkod pa ni ngag yin te /
translated: and that is the arrangement of letters, words, and sentences,

original: 'don pa'i phyir brjod nus med do //
analyzed: 'don pa'i phyir brjod nus med do //
translated: he is not able to express it by reciting it.”

original: de ltar gzhan la yang ste rig byed kyi byed pa por mthong bar 'dod pa de yang gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang ste rig byed kyi byed pa por mthong bar 'dod pa de yang gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, the one who is seen as the author of the Vedas also depends on the teaching of others.

original: de yang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba thog ma med pa nyid kyi skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba 'ga' smra'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba thog ma med pa nyid kyi skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du grub pa zhes bya ba 'ga' smra'o //
translated: And that also is taught by others, and so on, without beginning.

original: dang po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rig byed 'don pa ni rig byed 'don par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rig byed 'don pa ni rig byed 'don par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The one who recites the Vedas for the first time is the reciter of the Vedas because he is the one who recites the Vedas.

original: rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can yin te /🔽da ltar ba'i rig byed 'don par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can yin te / da ltar ba'i rig byed 'don par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: He must have had a prior reciter of the Vedas.🔽This is the argument.

original: de skad du smra ba de yang gang byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba der bshad pa de nyid lan yin no //
analyzed: de skad du smra ba de yang gang byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba der bshad pa de nyid lan yin no //
translated: The answer to that is the same as the one given above: “Because the author is not remembered.”

original: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas de ni skyes bus ma byas pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pas de ni skyes bus ma byas pa yin na /
translated: If the Vedas are not composed by a person, as has just been explained,

original: gang skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then what is it that is not composed by a person?

original: gzhan gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pas na thog ma med pa can nyid du rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can nyid yin pas na thog ma med pa can nyid du rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the other texts, such as the young man’s origination, are preceded by recitation, they are well established as beginningless.

original: de la gal te rab tu sgrub par byed pa khas blangs pa la gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gal te rab tu sgrub par byed pa khas blangs pa la gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the refutation is accepted in the proof,

original: 'di nyid khas blangs pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa nas klan ka btsal du med do zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid khas blangs pa'i yan lag ces bya ba la sogs pa nas klan ka btsal du med do zhes bya ba'i bar thams cad brjod par bya ste /
translated: then you should say everything from “this is a part of the acceptance” up to “there is no fault to be found.”

original: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgras rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir sogs pa'i sgras rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: In order to include those, the word “etc.” is applied.

original: thal ches pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thal ches pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show the absurdity, he says “thus,” etc.

original: skyes bu gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa'i gzhung du bkod pa gzhan dag tu yang dag pa'i man ngag dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhon nu 'byung ba can la sogs pa'i gzhung du bkod pa gzhan dag tu yang dag pa'i man ngag dang bral ba ste /
translated: In the texts of the young man’s origination, etc., there is no perfect instruction.

original: man ngag med pa gzhan rnams kyis brjod pa ci mthong na ste cung zad kyang mthong ba med par ro //
analyzed: man ngag med pa gzhan rnams kyis brjod pa ci mthong na ste cung zad kyang mthong ba med par ro //
translated: Others, who do not have the oral tradition, say that nothing is seen at all.

original: rgyu gang gis de yang ste rig byed las gzhan pa'i @275a * //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de yang ste rig byed las gzhan pa'i @275a * //
translated: By what reason? By the sound of the Vedas.

original: sgra'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas par ci'i phyir rjes su dpog ste rjes su dpog par mi byed /
analyzed: sgra'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas par ci'i phyir rjes su dpog ste rjes su dpog par mi byed /
translated: Why is it inferred that the Vedas are not made by a person?

original: da ltar ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: da ltar ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that with “the present . . . ” and so on.

original: da ltar ba rnams man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa las gzhan du skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi rten cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba rnams man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa las gzhan du skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi rten cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The present cannot read the Vedas without the oral tradition. Apart from that, there is not the slightest basis for the Vedas not being made by a person.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: This is the reason for proving that the Vedas are not made by a person.

original: gzhan gyi man ngag med par rig byed klog par nus pa med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi man ngag med par rig byed klog par nus pa med pa de ltar na /
translated: Since it is not possible to read the Vedas without the oral tradition of others,

original: rig byed kyi ngag rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: rig byed kyi ngag rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: the words of the Vedas are accepted as not being made by a person.

original: man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa de ni gcig gis te /
analyzed: man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa de ni gcig gis te /
translated: Without the instructions, one cannot read.🔽

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis sbyar ba'i gzhung skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa gzhan la yang 'don par byed pa gzhan gyi dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis sbyar ba'i gzhung skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa gzhan la yang 'don par byed pa gzhan gyi dang mtshungs so //
translated: But if it is not possible to read without instruction, then it is the same as the reading of another, since the text composed by one person is accepted as being the composition of another person.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi rtags kyi sgo nas ngag gi rjes su 'brang bar byed pa des /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni man ngag med par klog par mi nus pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi rtags kyi sgo nas ngag gi rjes su 'brang bar byed pa des /
translated: “Following that” means that, because it is not possible to read without instruction, one follows the words by means of the reason of noncomposition by a person.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sgra thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rjes su dpog cing rjes su dpyod pa'am 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sgra thams cad de ltar zhes bya ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rjes su dpog cing rjes su dpyod pa'am 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “All worldly sounds are like that” means that one infers and analyzes that all worldly sounds are not composed by a person, but that is not so, because there is no distinction.

original: ci ste gzhan gyis 'jig rten pa'i sgra rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyis 'jig rten pa'i sgra rnams skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that worldly sounds are not composed by a person,

original: de la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa na khas blangs pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa na khas blangs pa la sogs pa'i skyon yod do zhe na /
translated: If one infers that it is not made by a person, then there is the fault of accepting the opposite, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That is not so, etc.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i ngag de ni de ltar zhes bya ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ngag de ni de ltar zhes bya ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That worldly statement is not accepted as being not made by a person, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni khas blangs pa la gnod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the fault of accepting the opposite, etc.

original: 'dod pa ni de'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni de'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The reason is because it is the basis of that,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu bshad zin to //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ma thag tu bshad zin to //
translated: because it is the basis of the proof that it is not made by a person, etc., as was just explained.

original: gzhan yang rigs gang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs gang ste /
translated: Moreover, what is the class?

original: rdzas su mtshungs pa'i rigs gang yin pa rgyu gang la rjes su mtshungs pa'i ldog pa grub pas /
analyzed: rdzas su mtshungs pa'i rigs gang yin pa rgyu gang la rjes su mtshungs pa'i ldog pa grub pas /
translated: What is the class that is substantially similar, in which the reversal of the similar cause is established?

original: rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan la gang gi rigs can nyid du bye brag med par rgyu de las grub pa yin no zhes de dag yang dag par shes so //
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan la gang gi rigs can nyid du bye brag med par rgyu de las grub pa yin no zhes de dag yang dag par shes so //
translated: One understands that the other, which is not seen to have a cause, is established from that cause, without distinction of type.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: me shing bzhin te /
analyzed: me shing bzhin te /
translated: Like fire and fuel.

original: dper na shing las me gcig mthong ba de @275b dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin can rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan yang de dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa kho nar yang dag par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing las me gcig mthong ba de @275b dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin can rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan yang de dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pa kho nar yang dag par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one understands that the other, which is not seen to have a cause, is just like the fire seen in the fuel, in that it has a cause of the same type, like the fire seen in the fuel.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with “cause” and so on.

original: rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cause is not seen.

original: de'i rgyu ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That much, “the cause of that is not seen,” is not “without a cause.”

original: dngos po rgyu ma mthong ba can yin na yang ste /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu ma mthong ba can yin na yang ste /
translated: Even though the thing has a cause that is not seen,

original: de dag gi rgyu ma mthong bar yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ma mthong bar yod pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: it is said to exist because the cause of that is not seen.

original: dngos po de lta bur gyur pa yin na yang de las gzhan pa rgyu mthong ba can dag gis rang bzhin tha dad pa nyams su myong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bur gyur pa yin na yang de las gzhan pa rgyu mthong ba can dag gis rang bzhin tha dad pa nyams su myong ba med pa ste /
translated: Although the thing has become such, it is not experienced as having a different nature by those who see the cause.

original: rang bzhin mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin mtshungs pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has a similar nature.

original: de lta bu rnam pa zhes bya ba rgyu mtshungs pa can yang dag par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu rnam pa zhes bya ba rgyu mtshungs pa can yang dag par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: One infers that it is similar to the cause in that way.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i chos can rig byed pa'i sgra rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i chos can rig byed pa'i sgra rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Thus, the words of the Vedas, which have a property in common with worldly words, are like worldly words in being produced by a person.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, they are not produced by anyone at all. This is the summarized meaning.

original: ci ste rgyu'i ngo bo rang bzhin ldog tu zin kyang de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu'i ngo bo rang bzhin ldog tu zin kyang de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: But if the nature of the cause has already ceased, how can the nature of the effect arise from that?

original: rgyu mthong ba can skyes bus byas pa'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rig byed pa'i sgra gang gi tshe ldog pa ma yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rgyu mthong ba can skyes bus byas pa'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rig byed pa'i sgra gang gi tshe ldog pa ma yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When you assert that the sound of a Vedic ritual, which is the nature of a sound produced by a person, is not reversed when its cause is reversed,

original: 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa ste /
translated: then it would be beyond the quality of being a result.

original: 'bras bu'i chos 'di'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang yi pa ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos 'di'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang yi pa ldog pa yin na /
translated: If that which is asserted to be the cause of this result is reversed,

original: gang gi tshe rgyu log tu zin kyang 'bras bu mi ldog pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu log tu zin kyang 'bras bu mi ldog pa de'i tshe /
translated: then when the cause is reversed, the result would not be reversed.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i chos las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i chos las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be beyond the quality of being its result.

original: 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa de'i phyir skyes bu de las ngag cung zad kyang 'gyur ba med pas /
