analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos las 'das pa de'i phyir skyes bu de las ngag cung zad kyang 'gyur ba med pas /
translated: Because it is beyond the quality of being a result, that person would not be the slightest bit changed.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sgra cung zhig kyang de ltar te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sgra cung zhig kyang de ltar te /
translated: Therefore, the sound of the world would not be the slightest bit

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be described as produced by a person.

original: ci ste 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi bye brag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi bye brag yod pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the sound of the world is different from the sound of the Vedic ritual,🔽then the sound of the world would not be produced by a person.

original: khyad par gang gis 'jig rten pa kho na'i skyes bus byas pa yin gyi rig byed pa'i ni ma yin par 'dod do zhen /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis 'jig rten pa kho na'i skyes bus byas pa yin gyi rig byed pa'i ni ma yin par 'dod do zhen /
translated: In particular, they are only created by mundane beings, not by the Vedas.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says “in terms of their nature” and so on.

original: rig byed pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i skyes bus byas pa dag gi ngo bo'i bye brag bstan par bya ba yin na ni ngo bo'i bye brag gang kho nas skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyu de'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro //🔽khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni skyes @276a * //
analyzed: rig byed pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i skyes bus byas pa dag gi ngo bo'i bye brag bstan par bya ba yin na ni ngo bo'i bye brag gang kho nas skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyu de'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro // khyad par 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ni skyes @276a * //
translated: If the nature of those created by a person that is not shared with the Vedas is to be taught, then by what specific nature does a person come to be the cause that is followed?

original: bus byas pa yin la /
analyzed: bus byas pa yin la /
translated: That which possesses such a distinction is created by a person.

original: de dang bral ba yang skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang bral ba yang skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is devoid of that is not created by a person.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that, it says “by which” and so on.

original: khyad par gang gis rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten pa mi 'dod pa ni 'dod pa phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba dag ste /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten pa mi 'dod pa ni 'dod pa phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba dag ste /
translated: In particular, the Vedas are held to be uncreated by persons, but the world does not accept this, and so the desire is a perverse desire.

original: go rims bzhin du skyes bu nyid dang / skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du skyes bu nyid dang / skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If they were not created by persons, then the Vedas would not be different from the world in any way.

original: rig byed pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dag gi las gang yang skyes bus byas par mi nus pa can du khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dag gi las gang yang skyes bus byas par mi nus pa can du khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Vedas are not in the least different from the world in that they are not able to be created by persons.

original: khyad par thams cad ni skyes bu dag gis byas par nus pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad ni skyes bu dag gis byas par nus pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all differences are able to be created by persons.

original: de bas na skyes bu'i ngag rnams kyis sbyar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag can du mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu'i ngag rnams kyis sbyar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag can du mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are similar in being created by the speech of persons,

original: rig byed pa'i sgra dag kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rig byed pa'i sgra dag kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no //
translated: the words of the Vedas are also created by persons.

original: dngos po rnams kyis tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the differences among things are created by the differences of their causes.

original: ci ste ngag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu skyes bu gang yin pa de ni rig byed la log tu zin kyang skyes bus byas pa'i sgra dang rig byed pa dag gi mtshungs pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe /🔽rgyu'i rang bzhin ldog pa las kyang ste /🔽ngag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu skyes bu gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ldog pa las so //🔽'di ni ma gus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i drug pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ngag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu skyes bu gang yin pa de ni rig byed la log tu zin kyang skyes bus byas pa'i sgra dang rig byed pa dag gi mtshungs pa nyid du khas len par byed pa de'i tshe / rgyu'i rang bzhin ldog pa las kyang ste / ngag rnams tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu skyes bu gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ldog pa las so // 'di ni ma gus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i drug pa yin te /
translated: But if you accept that the person who is the cause of the nondifference of the statements is the same as the person who is the cause of the statements, then the person who is the cause of the nondifference of the statements is the same as the person who is the cause of the statements, even when the person who is the cause of the statements is refuted.🔽Then, even when the nature of the cause is refuted,🔽the person who is the cause of the nondifference of the statements is the same as the person who is the cause of the statements.🔽This is the sixth verse, which states that you are expressing disrespect.🔽🔽

original: tha dad pa med pa nges pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin ldog pa ma gtogs par yang rig byed pa'i dngos po rnams skyes bus byas pa'i ngag rnams dang tha dad pa med par mtshungs pa nyid du khas len pa na 'jig rten pa de dag gi tha dad pa🔽skyes bus byas pa'i khyad par de ni go bar 'gyur te /

original: skyes bu med par yang rig byed pa rnams la yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu med par yang rig byed pa rnams la yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Vedas have differences even when there is no person.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig tu yang ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig tu yang ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that there is no difference at all.

original: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe bdag nyid thams cad 'gyur na de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: If everything were to be from everything, then it would be so, but it is not.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gang las skyes pa can te /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gang las skyes pa can te /
translated: Therefore, it is from a nature that it arises.

original: gang la gang las skyes pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang la gang las skyes pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The word order is: “from which there is an arising of that.”

original: gang las 'byung ba mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang las 'byung ba mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “from which an effect is seen to arise.”

original: de'i rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan la yang tha dad par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma mthong ba can gzhan la yang tha dad par mi byed pa ste /
translated: It is not the case that there is a difference in another that does not have a seen cause.

original: rgyu mthong ba can gyi 'bras bu dang tha dad par nyams su myong ba med par rang gi @276b bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu mthong ba can gyi 'bras bu dang tha dad par nyams su myong ba med par rang gi @276b bdag nyid de /
translated: The effect that has a seen cause is not experienced as different from itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: That is, by its own nature, it is the effect of that.

original: gang las byung ba mthong ba de'i 'bras bu nyid las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las byung ba mthong ba de'i 'bras bu nyid las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: From which an arising is seen, it is not beyond being its effect.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: shing dang me bzhin shing dang me ni shing dang me ste /
analyzed: shing dang me bzhin shing dang me ni shing dang me ste /
translated: Like wood and fire, wood and fire are wood and fire.

original: de dang mtshungs shing de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs shing de dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are similar to that, they are like that.

original: dper na rgyu ma mthong ba can gyi me yang rgyu shing mthong ba can gyi me dang tha dad pa med par nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na rgyu ma mthong ba can gyi me yang rgyu shing mthong ba can gyi me dang tha dad pa med par nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: For example, fire that has no visible cause is experienced as not different from fire that has visible wood as its cause.

original: shing gi 'bras bu nyid las ma 'das pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing gi 'bras bu nyid las ma 'das pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not go beyond being the effect of wood.

original: rigs de las 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag gang dag gi khyad par ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rigs de las 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag gang dag gi khyad par ma bstan pa ste /
translated: From that, the speech of worldly people and Vedic people is not taught to be different.

original: khyad par bstan par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: khyad par bstan par yang mi nus so //
translated: It is also not possible to teach a difference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las 'bras bu mtshungs pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu mtshungs pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect is seen to be the same.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect is seen to be the same as and similar to the worldly.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pa dag gi 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de dag rig byed pa dag la yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pa dag gi 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de dag rig byed pa dag la yang mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, whatever effects are seen in worldly people are also seen in Vedic people.

original: de bas na khyad par de ltar ma bstan par 'jig rten pa dag las tha dad par rig byed pa dag gi skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na khyad par de ltar ma bstan par 'jig rten pa dag las tha dad par rig byed pa dag gi skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, without teaching such a distinction, in order to prove that the Vedas are not the work of a person, they are different from worldly things.

original: gtan tshigs rab tu spros pa gang de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin te ma nges pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rab tu spros pa gang de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin te ma nges pa dag yin no //
translated: All those extensive arguments are mistaken, they are inconclusive.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For example, etc.

original: yang de la 'bras bu mtshungs pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don 'di rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: yang de la 'bras bu mtshungs pa mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don 'di rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par byed de /
translated: Moreover, he explains the meaning of “because a similar effect is seen” in another way:

original: ji ltar da ltar rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin pa de ltar thog ma nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa rig byed 'don par byed pa yang rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can yin
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin pa de ltar thog ma nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa rig byed 'don par byed pa yang rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can yin
translated: Just as the present recitation of the Vedas is preceded by recitation, so too the recitation of the Vedas such as the Purāṇa, etc. at the very beginning is preceded by recitation.

original: pa de ltar na rig byed 'don par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu mtshungs par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa de ltar na rig byed 'don par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu mtshungs par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the result of the recitation of the Vedas is seen to be the same,

original: gtan tshigs rab tu spro ba gang ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs rab tu spro ba gang ste /
translated: the reason is not fully extended.

original: rgyas par bstan pa de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin /🔽dper na thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me bskyed pa'i bye brag ma mthong ba can yang me gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin / dper na thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me bskyed pa'i bye brag ma mthong ba can yang me gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
translated: All of the extensive explanations are mistaken.🔽For example, the fire that is initially sent by a traveler is the cause of another fire, but it is not preceded by the rubbing of sticks.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'gron pos btang ba'i me nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gron pos btang ba'i me nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the fire that is sent by the traveler.

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na de ma thag pa'i me bzhin te /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na de ma thag pa'i me bzhin te /
translated: What is it like? It is like the fire that immediately precedes it.

original: me gzhan las kun 'byung bar 'byung ba'i gyur ba'i me lta bu'o //🔽'khrul pa nyid @277a * //
analyzed: me gzhan las kun 'byung bar 'byung ba'i gyur ba'i me lta bu'o // 'khrul pa nyid @277a * //
translated: It is like the fire that arises from the origin of another fire.

original: du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di nyid ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa dgod par mdzad de /
analyzed: du bsgrub pa'i phyir 'di nyid ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa dgod par mdzad de /
translated: In order to prove that it is mistaken, he presents the argument beginning with “How is it that…”

original: me gzhan sngon du song ba can dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can gyis ci ltar 'gron pos btang ba'i 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: me gzhan sngon du song ba can dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can gyis ci ltar 'gron pos btang ba'i 'khrul pa yin /
translated: How is it a mistake that the guest started it?

original: me sngon du song ba can nyid ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: me sngon du song ba can nyid ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why don’t you accept that the fire is preceded by the fire?

original: me las byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'khrul pa smra ste /
analyzed: me las byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'khrul pa smra ste /
translated: In response, he says, “It is not a mistake to say that the fire arises from the fire,” and so on.

original: 'bar ba las byung ba'i nus pa la brten nas 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i rgyu gzhan gtsub shing gtsubs pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'bar ba las byung ba'i nus pa la brten nas 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i rgyu gzhan gtsub shing gtsubs pa spong bar byed do //
translated: In dependence on the potential that arises from the fire, he rejects the other cause of the fire that the guest started, namely, the rubbing of sticks.

original: dang po yang 'gron pos btang ba'i me ni gtsub shing gis gtsubs ba sngon du song ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po yang 'gron pos btang ba'i me ni gtsub shing gis gtsubs ba sngon du song ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: The fire that the guest started is not preceded by the rubbing of sticks.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gal te me 'di me med par 'gyur na gzhan la yang ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te me 'di me med par 'gyur na gzhan la yang ste /
translated: Why is that?🔽He says, “If this fire were to arise without fire,” and so on.

original: de ltar ba'i 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i gnas su mngon par 'dod pa la yang me med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ba'i 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i gnas su mngon par 'dod pa la yang me med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If this fire were to arise without fire, then in that case, in the place where the fire that the guest started is desired, fire would arise without fire.

original: de la ste sgrub par byed pa de yang ma nges pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de la ste sgrub par byed pa de yang ma nges pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: and that which is to be established is said to be uncertain.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽me dang cig shos las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / me dang cig shos las byung ba dag ste /
translated: How so?🔽Because fire and what is produced from another are not mutually contradictory.

original: me las byung ba gang yin pa dang / cig shos gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de dag la me'i spyi phan tshun gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa dag med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: me las byung ba gang yin pa dang / cig shos gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba gang yin pa de dag la me'i spyi phan tshun gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa dag med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Whatever is produced from fire and whatever is produced from the friction of sticks are not mutually contradictory in terms of the universal “fire.”

original: 'dir me yang yin la me gzhan sngon du song ba can yang ma yin pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir me yang yin la me gzhan sngon du song ba can yang ma yin pa la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Here, what contradiction is there in something being fire and not having another fire as a prior antecedent?

original: de ltar na gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa nyid yod na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa nyid yod na yang /
translated: Thus, even if there is that which is to be burned and that which burns,

original: me las byung ba can gyi me'i ngo bo ni gzhan dag la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: me las byung ba can gyi me'i ngo bo ni gzhan dag la yang 'gyur te /
translated: the nature of fire that is produced from fire would also occur in others,

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it would also occur from the friction of sticks.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: me dang cig shos las byung ba 'gal ba'i chos nyid dag me'i spyi'i don gcig la phan tshun gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa med pa nyid du srid pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang cig shos las byung ba 'gal ba'i chos nyid dag me'i spyi'i don gcig la phan tshun gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa med pa nyid du srid pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Fire and the other are contradictory qualities, but they are possible as the cause of a single general object of fire, because they are mutually non-obstructive.

original: 'gron pos btang ba'i me las byung ba can de'am /
analyzed: 'gron pos btang ba'i me las byung ba can de'am /
translated: The fire that is set by a traveler is produced from that fire,

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa la sogs pa gzhan ni gcig la so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa la sogs pa gzhan ni gcig la so sor nges pa ste /
translated: or the other, such as the recitation of the Vedas, is individually ascertained in one.

original: sngon du song ba can nam /
analyzed: sngon du song ba can nam /
translated: It is preceded by that,

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yang yin no zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de ltar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yang yin no zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de ltar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: or it is preceded by the recitation of the Vedas. Since there is no contradiction, that is the intended meaning.

original: 'don par byed pa la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: The reason proving that the recitation of the Vedas and so on are not created by a person is mistaken,

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction.🔽It is the recitation of the Vedas,

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa yang yin @277b la ;
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa yang yin @277b la ;
translated: and it is preceded by the recitation of the Vedas.

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa'i sngon du song ba can yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa'i sngon du song ba can yang ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that the Vedas are not preceded by a composer?

original: dper na da ltar ba dag bdag nyid rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: dper na da ltar ba dag bdag nyid rtsom par byed la /
translated: For example, some present things are composed by themselves,🔽and some are composed by Brahmā, and so on.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa yang byed pas gcig la so sor nges pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu dang dper na me 'ga' zhig me sngon du song ba can yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa yang byed pas gcig la so sor nges pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu dang dper na me 'ga' zhig me sngon du song ba can yin la /
translated: For example, some fires are preceded by other fires,

original: 'ga' zhig gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can yin pas na gcig la so sor nges pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gtsub shing gtsubs pa sngon du song ba can yin pas na gcig la so sor nges pa lta bu'o //
translated: and some are preceded by the rubbing together of sticks.

original: me las byung ba can nyid dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba can gyi chos gnyis po de ni phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: me las byung ba can nyid dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba can gyi chos gnyis po de ni phan tshun 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: But aren’t the two properties of being preceded by fire and being preceded by the rubbing together of sticks mutually exclusive?

original: ci ste me gcig la gnas pa na gang gis 'gal ba'i chos gnyis gcig la gnas pa brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste me gcig la gnas pa na gang gis 'gal ba'i chos gnyis gcig la gnas pa brjod ce na /
translated: If they exist in one fire, how can you say that mutually exclusive properties exist in one thing?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'on kyang phan tshun tha dad pa can te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phan tshun tha dad pa can te /
translated: They are mutually different.

original: gcig la gcig spangs pa'i ngo bo can gyi chos gnyis me las byung ba can dang / gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jug cing gnas pa de yang dngos po'i spyi ste /🔽me'i spyi de la 'gal ba med do zhes brjod par bya ba'i gnas skabs tha dad pa can gyi me'i khyad par me las byung ba can nam /
analyzed: gcig la gcig spangs pa'i ngo bo can gyi chos gnyis me las byung ba can dang / gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jug cing gnas pa de yang dngos po'i spyi ste / me'i spyi de la 'gal ba med do zhes brjod par bya ba'i gnas skabs tha dad pa can gyi me'i khyad par me las byung ba can nam /
translated: The two properties, which are the nature of mutual exclusion, are the property of being produced from fire and the property of being produced from the rubbing of sticks.🔽The general property of fire is not contradictory.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba can nyid la ni 'gal ba med par mi brjod do //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba can nyid la ni 'gal ba med par mi brjod do //
translated: But the particular fire, which is the locus of the statement, is not said to be non-contradictory with the property of being produced from fire or the property of being produced from the rubbing of sticks.

original: 'on kyang de las 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de las 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But it is just that there is contradiction in it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: cha med pa'i bdag nyid la ste cha med pa'i rang bzhin la de nyid dang de nyid ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha med pa'i bdag nyid la ste cha med pa'i rang bzhin la de nyid dang de nyid ma yin pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the partless, i.e., the nature of the partless, is contradictory with being that and not being that.

original: me las byung ba can ni sngon du song ba can nyid dang / de sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: me las byung ba can ni sngon du song ba can nyid dang / de sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin la /
translated: The property of being produced from fire is contradictory with being preceded by that and not being preceded by that.

original: gtsubs shing las byung ba can dag kyang de sngon du song ba can nyid dang de sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gtsubs shing las byung ba can dag kyang de sngon du song ba can nyid dang de sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid ni 'gal ba yin zhing /
translated: The fire produced from rubbing sticks is both preceded by that and not preceded by that, and it is contradictory that it is both preceded by that and not preceded by that.

original: 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i spyi la ni gnyi ga 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i spyi la ni gnyi ga 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But there is no contradiction in both being the general class of fire that is set out by a traveler.

original: 'gron pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'gron pos btang ba'i me ste /
analyzed: 'gron pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'gron pos btang ba'i me ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, “The fire set out by a traveler,” and so on.🔽The fire set out by a traveler

original: 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i spyi la me dang cig shos kyis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gron pos btang ba'i me'i spyi la me dang cig shos kyis bskyed pa ste /
translated: is the general class of fire that is set out by a traveler.

original: me las byung ba dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba ni gnod bya gnod byed ma yin no //
analyzed: me las byung ba dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba ni gnod bya gnod byed ma yin no //
translated: The fire produced from fire and the fire produced from rubbing sticks are not mutually exclusive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gron pos btang ba'i me tsam de ni mes bskyed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gron pos btang ba'i me tsam de ni mes bskyed pa med pa ste /
translated: That mere fire set out by a traveler is not produced by fire.

original: me las byung ba ma gtogs par gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang srid pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: me las byung ba ma gtogs par gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang srid pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is possible that fire is produced from rubbing sticks, apart from the fire produced from fire.

original: me med par gzhan la yang srid @278a * //
analyzed: me med par gzhan la yang srid @278a * //
translated: It is possible that fire is produced from other things, without fire.

original: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of that.

original: me las byung ba can ci 'dra mthong ba de lta bur gyur pa gzhan la yang me las byung ba can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: me las byung ba can ci 'dra mthong ba de lta bur gyur pa gzhan la yang me las byung ba can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever is seen to be produced from fire is like that, and it is produced from fire.

original: khyad par med par me thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med par me thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not from all fire without distinction.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu tha dad pas tha dad pa can gyi me de la khyad par spong bar te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas tha dad pa can gyi me de la khyad par spong bar te /
translated: Because of the difference in the cause, the difference in the fire is not denied.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba'i khyad par bsnyon par byed mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba'i khyad par bsnyon par byed mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The difference produced from the rubbing of the kindling sticks cannot be denied.

original: me la rgyus byas pa'i khyad par yod pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: me la rgyus byas pa'i khyad par yod pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since there is a difference produced by the cause in fire,

original: khyad par yod pa can te /
analyzed: khyad par yod pa can te /
translated: it has a difference.

original: gang la rgyus byas pa'i khyad par yod pa de ni khyad par yod pa can yin la /
analyzed: gang la rgyus byas pa'i khyad par yod pa de ni khyad par yod pa can yin la /
translated: That which has a difference produced by the cause has a difference.

original: de yang de'i gnas skabs nyid la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i gnas skabs nyid la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not ascertained in that very state.

original: me las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: me las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi gnas skabs la nges pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because there is no certainty that the state characterized by fire exists.

original: gal te gang yang thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me med par yang 'gyur na ni gzhan dag la yang ste /
analyzed: gal te gang yang thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me med par yang 'gyur na ni gzhan dag la yang ste /
translated: If it were the case that the fire that was carried by the guest would not exist at the beginning, then it would also be the case that

original: mes stong pa'i phyogs dag las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so//
analyzed: mes stong pa'i phyogs dag las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so//
translated: it would arise from other places that are empty of fire.

original: de la lan rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de la lan rjod par byed de /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: gal te gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshogs pa gang gis 'gron pos btang ba'i me de btang bar 'gyur ba na tshogs pa de 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshogs pa gang gis 'gron pos btang ba'i me de btang bar 'gyur ba na tshogs pa de 'gyur te /
translated: If the fire that was carried by the guest were to be ignited by the collection that has the characteristic of rubbing sticks together, then that collection would be the cause of the fire that was carried by the guest.

original: mes stong pa'i sa phyogs gzhan dag la yang 'gron pos btang ba'i me nyid 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mes stong pa'i sa phyogs gzhan dag la yang 'gron pos btang ba'i me nyid 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It would also be the case that the fire that was carried by the guest would arise from other places that are empty of fire.

original: 'di skad du me med pa'i phyir thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du me med pa'i phyir thog mar 'gron pos btang ba'i me med par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not saying that the fire that was carried by the guest would not exist at the beginning because fire does not exist.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: but because the collection of the rubbing stick and the effort of the hand that rubs it does not exist.

original: gal te yang tshogs pa de yod pa bstan nas de med pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang tshogs pa de yod pa bstan nas de med pa ste /
translated: If the collection of causes and conditions exists, then the absence of that,

original: de med na med pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na med pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: the absence of that, is taught.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs pa yod par bstan pa de la me yod par ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe me ni me sngon du song ba can kho na nyid yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs pa yod par bstan pa de la me yod par ston par 'gyur ba de'i tshe me ni me sngon du song ba can kho na nyid yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the existence of fire is taught in the collection of causes and conditions as it has been explained, then at that time fire would only be preceded by fire.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na 'gron pos btang ba'i me thams cad ni me sngon du song ba can du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'gron pos btang ba'i me thams cad ni me sngon du song ba can du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that all fires set by travelers are preceded by fire.

original: ji ltar 'gron pos btang ba'i me thams cad sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin pa de ltar rig byed 'don par byed pa thams cad ni rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub par
analyzed: ji ltar 'gron pos btang ba'i me thams cad sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin pa de ltar rig byed 'don par byed pa thams cad ni rig byed 'don pa sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub par
translated: Just as the reason is mistaken in proving that all fires set by travelers are preceded by fire, in the same way, in proving that all recitations of the Vedas are preceded by the recitation of the Vedas,

original: bya ba la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba la gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement “the reason is mistaken” is for the purpose of showing that.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi @278b phyir da lta yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi @278b phyir da lta yin pa de bas na /
translated: Because it is present, therefore.

original: de ltar ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba gcig gis 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can te /
analyzed: de ltar ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba gcig gis 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can te /
translated: Thus, one who is devoid of the ability to perform the recitation, who has another recitation as a prior condition,

original: lung ston pa'i skyes bu sngon du song ba can mthong ba gzhan sngon du song ba can de lta bu'i ngo bor dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa 'don par byed pa thams cad kyi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung ston pa'i skyes bu sngon du song ba can mthong ba gzhan sngon du song ba can de lta bu'i ngo bor dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa 'don par byed pa thams cad kyi yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: who has seen another as a prior condition, who has a nature like that, does not establish all recitations of Suvarṇaprabhāsa, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa 'don par byed par 'dod pa de la rnam pa gzhan du ste /
analyzed: dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa 'don par byed par 'dod pa de la rnam pa gzhan du ste /
translated: Because that which is desired as the recitation of Suvarṇaprabhāsa, etc., is not possible in any other way,

original: gzhan sngon du song ba can med par mi srid pa gang yin pa de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sngon du song ba can med par mi srid pa gang yin pa de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is, without another as a prior condition, because it does not exist.

original: gzhan sngon du song ba can med par yang bdag nyid kyis sbyar ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ni rig byed rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan sngon du song ba can med par yang bdag nyid kyis sbyar ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa ni rig byed rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is that it exists by itself without depending on another.🔽The meaning is that the author of the Veda is not a person who is born and dies, because the author of the Veda is eternal, like the eternal sound of a conch.🔽The meaning is that the author of the Veda is not a person who is born and dies, because the author of the Veda is eternal, like the eternal sound of a conch.

original: da ltar ba nus pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de byed pa ste /🔽rig byed byed pa gang yin pa de la spobs pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba de ltar bdag nyid kyis byas nas /
analyzed: da ltar ba nus pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de byed pa ste / rig byed byed pa gang yin pa de la spobs pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba de ltar bdag nyid kyis byas nas /

original: rig byed 'don pa med pa'i rnam pa de lta bu la ste /🔽rig byed byed pa'i nus pa'i blo dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽skyes bu de ltar gyur pa'i rig byed 'don pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa ste /🔽'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed 'don pa med pa'i rnam pa de lta bu la ste /🔽rig byed byed pa'i nus pa'i blo dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽skyes bu de ltar gyur pa'i rig byed 'don pa gang yin pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa ste /🔽'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can gyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that the author of the Veda is not a person who is born and

original: de lta bur gyur zhes bya ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i 'don par byed pa gang yin pa de la de ltar brjod par bya bar 'gyur gyi khyad par srid pa can gyi yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur zhes bya ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i 'don par byed pa gang yin pa de la de ltar brjod par bya bar 'gyur gyi khyad par srid pa can gyi yin no //
translated: But the recitation that has the ability to perform the rites is not like that.

original: skyes bu phul du byung ba yod pas bdag nyid kyis byas nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir khyad par srid pa can gyi 'don par byed pa de yang /
analyzed: skyes bu phul du byung ba yod pas bdag nyid kyis byas nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir khyad par srid pa can gyi 'don par byed pa de yang /
translated: Because there are excellent people who, having performed the rites themselves, recite the mantras.

original: bye brag med pa ste 'don par byed pa thams cad 'don par byed pa can gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: bye brag med pa ste 'don par byed pa thams cad 'don par byed pa can gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes brjod pa na /
translated: When it is said that this recitation that has the ability to perform the rites is also without distinction, that is, that all recitation is preceded by other recitation,

original: khyab pa ma grub pas 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab pa ma grub pas 'khrul pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then that is a mistake, because the pervasion is not established.

original: mdzes pa thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mdzes pa thob pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not attain beauty.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not establish the probandum that is intended to be established.

original: sgrub par byed pa mdzes pa gso ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa mdzes pa gso ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not heal the beauty of the proof.

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “How could it be possible that others . . . ?”

original: rig byed kyi ngag rnams bdag nyid kyis brtsams nas 'don par byed pa de ji ltar khyad par srid pa yin te ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi ngag rnams bdag nyid kyis brtsams nas 'don par byed pa de ji ltar khyad par srid pa yin te ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the statements of the Vedas were composed by the self, and then recited by others. How could it be possible that they are different? It is not possible, he thinks.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽gang gi tshe skyes bu de dag ces bya ba rig @279a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / gang gi tshe skyes bu de dag ces bya ba rig @279a * //
translated: “When . . . ”

original: byed kyi byed pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pa dag kyang /
analyzed: byed kyi byed pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pa dag kyang /
translated: When those beings, such as Brahmā, who are asserted to be the authors of the Vedas,🔽are not able to compose the Vedas, because they are beings, like beings who are presently unable to compose the Vedas.

original: rig byed rtsom pa'i nus pa med pa yin te skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i nus pa med pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra'o slob dpon gyis 'di la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rig byed rtsom pa'i nus pa med pa yin te skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i nus pa med pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra'o slob dpon gyis 'di la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The master says, “In this case, too . . . ”

original: sbyor ba 'di la yang skyes bu dang nus pa dag la zhes bya ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang skyes bu la phan tshun 'gal ba cung zad kyang mthong ba med do //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la yang skyes bu dang nus pa dag la zhes bya ba rig byed byed pa'i nus pa dang skyes bu la phan tshun 'gal ba cung zad kyang mthong ba med do //
translated: In this argument, too, there is not the slightest contradiction between the being and the ability to compose the Vedas.

original: de bas na tshangs pa la sogs pa dag la skyes bu nyid gtan tshigs nyid du bshad pa la 'gal ba med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed byed pa'i nus pa ma bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshangs pa la sogs pa dag la skyes bu nyid gtan tshigs nyid du bshad pa la 'gal ba med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed byed pa'i nus pa ma bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the capacity of the Vedas to perform a function is not refuted, because there is no contradiction in explaining that the status of being a person is the reason for Brahmā and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa can te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa can te /
translated: Because it is a proof of noncontradiction.

original: mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba gang la yod pa zhes bya ba go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po'o //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba gang la yod pa zhes bya ba go bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhi tha dad pa'i 'bru mang po'o //
translated: The term “that which has a proof of noncontradiction” is an instance of a compound in which the terms are construed as a bahuvrīhi, because it is an expression that has the meaning “that which has a proof of noncontradiction.”

original: yang na sgrub pa'i sgra ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na sgrub pa ste las sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na sgrub pa'i sgra ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na sgrub pa ste las sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Or the term “proof” is a proof that is to be proven, that is, it is a proof that is the object of an action.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba gang la mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba gang la mi 'gal ba bsgrub pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa kho na nyid yin no //
translated: The term “that which has a proof of noncontradiction” is a bahuvrīhi compound.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: A proof of noncontradiction is not a proof of nonobservation.

original: gal te rig byed pa'i nus pa dang skyes bu nyid la 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed pa'i nus pa dang skyes bu nyid la 'gal ba yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the capacity to produce the Vedas and the person are contradictory,

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the reply is that “in the case of what is beyond the senses, etc.”

original: dbang po las 'das pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa dag la ni 'gal ba rtogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa dag la ni 'gal ba rtogs pa dag ni /
translated: In the case of what is beyond the senses, i.e., what is extremely hidden, there is no apprehension of contradiction.

original: 'gal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no apprehension of contradiction,

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang de la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang de la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both kinds of contradiction are impossible there: contradiction in the sense of non-coexistence and contradiction in the sense of mutual exclusion.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa rig byed byed pa'i nus pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa rig byed byed pa'i nus pa yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Brahma, etc., who are the capacity to produce the Vedas are beyond the senses.

original: de bas na 'dir 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'gal bar mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang 'gal bar mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, in this case, both kinds of contradiction are not apprehended.

original: skyes bu gang yin pa de ni rig byed la nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu gang yin pa de ni rig byed la nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The person is not the capacity to produce the Vedas.

original: dper na da ltar ba'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la yang sbyor ba snga ma las te rig byed 'don par byed pa ni rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: dper na da ltar ba'i skyes bu lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la yang sbyor ba snga ma las te rig byed 'don par byed pa ni rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: For example, the syllogism, “The present person is like the present reciter of the Vedas” is not different from the previous syllogism, because the reciter of the Vedas is preceded by the reciter of the Vedas.

original: da ltar ba rig byed 'don par byed pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba snga ma de las ma nges pa nyid du tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba rig byed 'don par byed pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba snga ma de las ma nges pa nyid du tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The previous syllogism, “The present reciter of the Vedas is like the present reciter of the Vedas,” is not different from the previous syllogism.

original: gang gis 'don par byed pa la khyad par yod pa la gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'don par byed pa la khyad par yod pa la gnod par 'gyur /
translated: How could it undermine the difference between the reciter of the Vedas?

original: @279b gang yang gal te thog ma'i skyes bu'i rig byed bdag nyid kyis byas nas 'don par byed par nus par gyur na yang /
analyzed: @279b gang yang gal te thog ma'i skyes bu'i rig byed bdag nyid kyis byas nas 'don par byed par nus par gyur na yang /
translated: If the original person could recite the Vedas after composing them himself,

original: da ltar bas kyang nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar bas kyang nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the present person could also do so.

original: 'dir lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we reply:

original: skyes bu rnams la khyad par med pa yin na ni bshad ma thag pa der 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la khyad par med pa yin na ni bshad ma thag pa der 'gyur na /
translated: If there were no difference between persons, then the previous explanation would be correct.

original: skyes bu rnams la khyad par med pa de yang bsgrub par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la khyad par med pa de yang bsgrub par dka' ba ste /
translated: It is difficult to establish that all beings are equal.

original: bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: And that is difficult to establish, that is, it is impossible to establish,

original: gnod pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a valid reason.

original: de bas na gang la skyes bu gcig la nus pa med pa de la skyes bu thams cad nus pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gang la skyes bu gcig la nus pa med pa de la skyes bu thams cad nus pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, when one person is incapable, all persons are incapable,🔽because they are all alike in being persons.

original: skyes bu nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa 'di la yang 'don par byed pa nyid la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du rtags skyes bu nyid ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa 'di la yang 'don par byed pa nyid la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du rtags skyes bu nyid ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: This proof is also faulty, because the reason, “person,” is inconclusive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Because, although present persons are incapable of creating the Vedas, etc.,

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ba ra ta la sogs pa yang da ltar ba'i skyes bu rnams la nus pa med pa yin na yang rgyas pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la skyes bu phul du byung ba'i nus pas grub pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ba ra ta la sogs pa yang da ltar ba'i skyes bu rnams la nus pa med pa yin na yang rgyas pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la skyes bu phul du byung ba'i nus pas grub pa'i phyir ro
translated: which are accepted as being created by persons, they are established by the power of the extraordinary persons of the past, such as Vyāsa.

original: // gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na rgyu rnams 'byed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: // gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na rgyu rnams 'byed par byed pa ste /
translated: Because it is so, therefore, the causes are distinguished.

original: 'di'i rgyu ni 'di yin la 'di'i ni 'di ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed par byed pa don rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu ni 'di yin la 'di'i ni 'di ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed par byed pa don rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The cause of this is this, and the cause of that is that. The distinction of the intrinsic natures of the objects should be taught.

original: ci lta bur gyur pa dag gi zhe na de las byung ba can te /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur pa dag gi zhe na de las byung ba can te /
translated: What kind of intrinsic natures? Those that arise from that.

original: rgyu de las de'i rgyu can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu de las de'i rgyu can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: those that arise from that cause and those that do not arise from that cause.

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par bstan par bya ste /
translated: The distinction of the intrinsic natures should be taught.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu de las byung ba can dang rgyu de las byung ba can ma yin pa dag ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes de ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs pa nyid bstan par bya zhing /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin ni rgyu de las byung ba can dang rgyu de las byung ba can ma yin pa dag ni de dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes de ltar rang bzhin sna tshogs pa nyid bstan par bya zhing /
translated: The intrinsic nature that is similar to that arises from that cause. That which does not arise from that cause is not similar to that. Thus, the variety of intrinsic natures should be taught.

original: de dang de las byung ba can ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa gang gis shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang de las byung ba can ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa gang gis shes par 'gyur /
translated: By what distinction of those that arise from that and those that do not arise from that is it known?

original: de med na ste rang bzhin gyi khyad par med na thams cad de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de med na ste rang bzhin gyi khyad par med na thams cad de'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If it did not exist, that is, if there were no distinction of nature, everything would have that nature.

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
translated: That is, they would have the nature of being causes that are similar to it.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i rgyu can gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: That is, they do not have the nature of being its causes.

original: sgra thams cad skyes bus byas par 'gyur ba'am 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra thams cad skyes bus byas par 'gyur ba'am 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that not all sounds are produced by a person.

original: 'dod par gyur na 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni skyes bus byas pa nyid du nges pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod par gyur na 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ni skyes bus byas pa nyid du nges pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, then it is certain that the distinction of nature of worldly and Vedic sounds is produced by a person.

original: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'gro ba 'di la'am sgra'i @280a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di la'am sgra'i @280a * //
translated: In this world,

original: sbyor ba 'di la 'jig rten pa dang rig byed kyi ngag dag skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la 'jig rten pa dang rig byed kyi ngag dag skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: In this context, we do not see any diversity in the nature of the worldly and Vedic statements that would establish them as either created or uncreated by a person.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par de la yod pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag de dag mtshungs pa nyid de 'dra ba'i ngo bo kho na'i yi ge'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid can mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par de la yod pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag de dag mtshungs pa nyid de 'dra ba'i ngo bo kho na'i yi ge'i go rims kyi mtshan nyid can mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa
translated: The nature of those worldly and Vedic statements, which do not exist in that way, is the same, because we see that they have the same nature, characterized by the sequence of letters.

original: dang rig byed kyi ngag gcig pa'i skyes bu'i byas pa nyid dam skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rnam par 'byed cing tha dad par 'jog par byed pa na skyes bu la 'khrul par dogs pa'i brjod pa can du byed do //
analyzed: dang rig byed kyi ngag gcig pa'i skyes bu'i byas pa nyid dam skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rnam par 'byed cing tha dad par 'jog par byed pa na skyes bu la 'khrul par dogs pa'i brjod pa can du byed do //
translated: Therefore, when distinguishing and positing the sameness or difference of the worldly and Vedic statements as either created or uncreated by a person, one should express oneself with the apprehension of error regarding the person.

original: skyes bu gang la 'khrul par dogs pa brjod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang la 'khrul par dogs pa brjod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That person with respect to whom there is apprehension of error is called that.

original: gang gis byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis byed ce na /
translated: By what?

original: de'i rang bzhin srid pa des te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin srid pa des te /
translated: By that which is its nature, that is, by the world and the Vedas.

original: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i dag srid pa'i yi ge dang tshig bkod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi des so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i dag srid pa'i yi ge dang tshig bkod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi des so //
translated: The general nature of the Vedas and the world is the arrangement of syllables and words of the Vedas.

original: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i chos can gyi rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brjod pa na /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i chos can gyi rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brjod pa na /
translated: If one says that the Vedas, which are similar in being products of a person, are not products of a person,

original: 'di brdzun du smra ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di brdzun du smra ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then he would be a liar.

original: rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa dag la de nyid kyi mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa dag la de nyid kyi mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The Vedas and non-Vedas have the same nature.

original: rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dag ni rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rig byed dang rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la rig byed pa'i sgra rnams ni rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dag ni rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t there a difference between the Vedas and non-Vedas, because the words of the Vedas have the nature of the Vedas and worldly things have the nature of non-Vedas?

original: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis go rims bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag dang / skyes bus byas pa nyid dang / skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis go rims bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag dang / skyes bus byas pa nyid dang / skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, as explained, they are respectively mundane and Vedic speech, and they are produced by a person and not produced by a person.

original: slob dpon gyis yod pa bden te zhes smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis yod pa bden te zhes smos te /
translated: The master says, “Yes, it is true that there is a difference.”

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par yod pa ni bden te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par yod pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that there is a difference as explained.

original: khyad par de 'dra ba ni 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi ngag dang / skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rnam par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de 'dra ba ni 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi ngag dang / skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rnam par sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: However, such a difference does not establish that speech is either produced by a person or not produced by a person.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag 'ba' zhig kho na'i khyad par ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag 'ba' zhig kho na'i khyad par ma yin no //
translated: Because the difference is not only of the mundane and Vedic speech.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: kha bya'i gna' gtam dang cig shos dag la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kha bya'i gna' gtam dang cig shos dag la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Nor is it of the stories of the garuḍa and the others.”

original: kha bya ste lo rgyus mkhan dag gis byas pa'i gna' gtam dang / cig shos @280b yid ches par mngon par 'dod par byas pa la de 'dra ba'i khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: kha bya ste lo rgyus mkhan dag gis byas pa'i gna' gtam dang / cig shos @280b yid ches par mngon par 'dod par byas pa la de 'dra ba'i khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: The difference between the two is that the former is a story made by storytellers, while the latter is said to be what is manifestly believed.

original: de tsam gyis rang nyid kyi tha snyad kyi don du rang gi lo rgyus kyis bye brag gsal bar byed pa'i rang nyid kyi brdas tha snyad du byas pa nye bar btags pa'i ming gi khyad par gyis ni rig byed skyes bus byas pa la gnod pa ma
analyzed: de tsam gyis rang nyid kyi tha snyad kyi don du rang gi lo rgyus kyis bye brag gsal bar byed pa'i rang nyid kyi brdas tha snyad du byas pa nye bar btags pa'i ming gi khyad par gyis ni rig byed skyes bus byas pa la gnod pa ma
translated: This much does not undermine the fact that the Vedas are the work of an author, because the Vedas are designated by a term that is applied to them by the convention of their own history, which is their own conventional usage.

original: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jig rten pa gzhan dag la yang rang nyid kyis nye bar sbyar ba ming tsam gyi khyad par gyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa gzhan dag la yang rang nyid kyis nye bar sbyar ba ming tsam gyi khyad par gyis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that other worldly things would also be nonhuman compositions by the mere difference in the name that is applied to them.

original: gal te rig byed kyi ngag dag la yi ge dang tshig bkod pa mthong ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba'i sbyor ba skyes bus rnam pa thams cad du byed par mi nus par 'gyur ba'am byas pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi ngag dag la yi ge dang tshig bkod pa mthong ba gang yin pa de 'dra ba'i sbyor ba skyes bus rnam pa thams cad du byed par mi nus par 'gyur ba'am byas pa ste /
translated: If one were to analyze the statements of the Vedas, one would find that the arrangement of the letters and words is not something that a person can create in any way.

original: yi ge dang tshig gi bkod pa rig byed kyi rjes su byed pa grub pa'i ngo bo la /🔽skyes bus ma byas pa'i brda thos pa tsam las /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig gi bkod pa rig byed kyi rjes su byed pa grub pa'i ngo bo la / skyes bus ma byas pa'i brda thos pa tsam las /
translated: The arrangement of the letters and words that is the nature of the Vedas is established.

original: 'di skyes bu tsam gyis byas pa 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed par 'gyur na /🔽rig byed de skyes bus ma byas par gsal ba yin gyi /🔽de lta ma yin na gang las rigs mi mthun pa nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skyes bu tsam gyis byas pa 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed par 'gyur na / rig byed de skyes bus ma byas par gsal ba yin gyi / de lta ma yin na gang las rigs mi mthun pa nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere hearing of the sign that is not created by a person does not imply that a person created it.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba ni bden na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba ni bden na /
translated: If that were not so, how could one understand that the Vedas are not the same as other texts?

original: skyes bu dag gis sngags ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa dang mi ldan pa de bas na /
analyzed: skyes bu dag gis sngags ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa dang mi ldan pa de bas na /
translated: If that were true, then why do people not accomplish the desired goal by merely reciting the mantras of the Vedas?

original: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore the Vedas are not created by a person.

original: gal te de ltar 'gyur na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'gyur na ni de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were so, then it would be so.

original: 'on kyang sngags kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no zhes de ni 'og nas skabs su bab pa dang rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags kyang skyes bus byas pa kho na yin no zhes de ni 'og nas skabs su bab pa dang rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: But the mantra is only created by a person. This will be examined in the appropriate section below.

original: gzhan yang sngags zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, there is no other so-called mantra at all.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /🔽bden pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / bden pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What then is it?🔽It is said, truth, austerity, and the power of truth and austerity.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ni bden pa yin pa la dbang po dang yid thul ba ni dka' thub yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ni bden pa yin pa la dbang po dang yid thul ba ni dka' thub yin no //
translated: Truth is teaching things as they really are, and austerity is subduing the senses and mind.

original: de dag gi mthu ni dug bcom pa la sogs pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mthu ni dug bcom pa la sogs pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: Their power is the ability to destroy poison, etc.

original: gang la de yod pa de dag ni bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de yod pa de dag ni bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who have that are endowed with the power of truth and austerity.

original: bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de dag ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa'i skyes bu de dag ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Those people who are endowed with the power of truth and austerity accomplish their desired goals.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i tshig gang yin pa de nyid sngags yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i tshig gang yin pa de nyid sngags yin no //
translated: The words that are the cause are the mantra.

original: de 'dra bar gyur pa'i sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig de dang de ni da ltar nyid kyang skyes bu rnams la snang ba kho na yin no /
analyzed: de 'dra bar gyur pa'i sngags kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig de dang de ni da ltar nyid kyang skyes bu rnams la snang ba kho na yin no /
translated: Those words that have the characteristics of a mantra, which are like that, are seen by people right now.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because of the power of the truth of reality,

analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du @281a * //

analyzed: 'on kyang da ltar yang ri khrod la 'ga' zhig rang gi nges pa la gnas pa dug la sogs pa sel ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sngags byed pa'i phyir skyes bu sngags byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: But even now, some who dwell in the mountains have the power of mantras that can eliminate poison and so on, and they are called “men who have the power of mantras.”
