analyzed: rig byed ma yin pa ni rig byed las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: Nonindicative form is other than indicative form.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'ongs pa nyid dang / nam mkha' lding dang dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i sngags dang sngags kyi rtog pa dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni 'ongs pa nyid dang / nam mkha' lding dang dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i sngags dang sngags kyi rtog pa dag mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “of Buddhists” and so on indicate that mantras and mantra theories of the Buddha, Garuḍa, Maheśvara, and so on are seen.

original: rig sngags kyi yi ge rnams ni rig byed skyed par byed pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi yi ge rnams ni rig byed skyed par byed pa'i sngags so //
translated: The letters of a mantra are the mantra that generates the indicative form.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i cho ga ston par byed pa'i sngags kyi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i cho ga ston par byed pa'i sngags kyi rtog pa yin no //
translated: The mantra theory teaches the rite that accomplishes that.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de dag kyang skyes bus byas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de dag kyang skyes bus byas pa ste /
translated: Those mantra and mantra theories of Buddhists and so on are created by humans.

original: skyes bus brtsams pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bus brtsams pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because they are composed by persons,

original: 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa bdun ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa bdun ba /
translated: the nature of the Vedas and so on of worldly people is not different.

original: de ltar na rig byed pa la sogs pa sngags dang rtog pa dag kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod cing /
analyzed: de ltar na rig byed pa la sogs pa sngags dang rtog pa dag kyang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod cing /
translated: Thus the Vedas and so on, as well as mantras and tantras, are asserted to be uncreated by persons.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtogs pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtogs pa na /
translated: When you realize that the mantras and tantras of the Buddha and so on are uncreated by persons,

original: ji ltar na da skyes bus ma byas pa'i dag thams cad bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar na da skyes bus ma byas pa'i dag thams cad bden par 'gyur te /
translated: how could all uncreated things be true?

original: 'on kyang log pa'i don can du yang 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'on kyang log pa'i don can du yang 'gyur ro ;
translated: They would also have false meanings.

original: /'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dang cig shos pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: /'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dang cig shos pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this way, Buddhists and non-Buddhists,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa las 'tshe ba dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa las 'tshe ba dang / 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags dang / bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: in the mantras and tantras of the Buddha and so on, harm, the desire of sexual intercourse, the view of self, and so on are taught.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The words “and so on” indicate that lying and so on are causes of the lower realms.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gsungs so //
translated: They are said to be causes of suffering.

original: cig shos te sangs rgyas pa ma yin pa'i sngags las 'tshe ba la sogs pa de dag rnams gzhan du ste /
analyzed: cig shos te sangs rgyas pa ma yin pa'i sngags las 'tshe ba la sogs pa de dag rnams gzhan du ste /
translated: The other, that is, non-Buddhist, mantras and tantras, which are the source of violence and so on, are said to be

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur brjod do //🔽gal te sngags dang rtog pa thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyur brjod do // gal te sngags dang rtog pa thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa yin par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: causes of the higher realms.

original: 'gal ba brjod pa'i ngag @281b gnyis skyes bus ma byas pa gcig la ji ltar bden par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba brjod pa'i ngag @281b gnyis skyes bus ma byas pa gcig la ji ltar bden par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If all mantras and tantras are not composed by a person, then how could the two statements, which are contradictory, be true of a single mantra or tantra that is not composed by a person?

original: de ltar mi 'gyur na sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa las 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams rab tu ma grags pa'i don gzhan gang yin pa de ni rig byed pa'i sngags dang rtog pa 'gal ba med pa yin no zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur na sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa las 'tshe ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams rab tu ma grags pa'i don gzhan gang yin pa de ni rig byed pa'i sngags dang rtog pa 'gal ba med pa yin no zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If you say that this is not the case, then what is the other meaning of the words of the mantras and tantras of Buddhists that are not well known? It is that they are not contradictory with the mantras and tantras of the Vedas.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to this, Śāntarakṣita says, “In that case . . .”

original: sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de la rab tu grags pa'i don las gzhan du rtogs na /🔽don gzhan du rtogs pa de ni sangs rgyas ba ma yin pa'i rig byed pa'i sngags dang rtog pa gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir sngags dang rtog pa thams cad la don gzhan du yongs su rtogs pa srid pas don la nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i sngags dang rtog pa de la rab tu grags pa'i don las gzhan du rtogs na / don gzhan du rtogs pa de ni sangs rgyas ba ma yin pa'i rig byed pa'i sngags dang rtog pa gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir sngags dang rtog pa thams cad la don gzhan du yongs su rtogs pa srid pas don la nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If one understands the meaning of the mantra and tantra of the Buddhists in a way that is different from the well known meaning,🔽then that understanding of a different meaning is also possible for all mantras and tantras of non Buddhists, because it is the same for the mantras and tantras of non Buddhists.

original: don gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir des bstan pa'i don 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs shing nan tan du byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gtan la ma phab pa'i phyir des bstan pa'i don 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs shing nan tan du byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no certainty about the meaning, because the meaning is not ascertained, one will not understand any meaning taught by the mantra and will not practice it.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba don nges par nan tan du byas pa med pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba don nges par nan tan du byas pa med pa na /
translated: Thus, if one does not practice the meaning with certainty,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag yod du zin kyang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag yod du zin kyang skyes bu'i don la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: then even if the words are not composed by a person, they are not useful for the purpose of a person.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags la sogs pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags la sogs pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that the mantras and so on of Buddhists are not composed by a person,

original: sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Buddhist” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags nyid ma yin na de las gzhan pa la yang ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags nyid ma yin na de las gzhan pa la yang ste /
translated: If the mantras of Buddhists and so on are not mantras, then neither are those of others.

original: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags de las gzhan pa rig byed pa'i sngags kyang sngags nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mna' chu btung dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags de las gzhan pa rig byed pa'i sngags kyang sngags nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mna' chu btung dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the mantras of Buddhists and so on are not mantras, the mantras of non-Buddhists, such as the Vedas, must also be mantras.

original: gang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dag gi sngags nyid ma yin pa dang / rig byed la sogs pa'i sngags nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //🔽sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dag gi sngags nyid ma yin pa dang / rig byed la sogs pa'i sngags nyid du 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Because there is not the slightest reason why the mantras of Buddhists and so on are not mantras and why the mantras of non-Buddhists, such as the Vedas, are mantras.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags kyis kyang dug gi las la sogs pa byed pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gi sngags kyis kyang dug gi las la sogs pa byed pa mthong ba ste /
translated: It is not contradictory to say that the mantras of Buddhists and so on are not mantras because it is seen that the mantras of Buddhists and so on also perform the functions of poison and so on.

original: dug gi las la sogs pa byed pa mthong ba des sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags de la sngags nyid du bkag pa med de dug la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i sgo nas rig byed pa dag gi yang sngags nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dug la sogs pa'i las byed pa la bsnyon @282a * //
analyzed: dug gi las la sogs pa byed pa mthong ba des sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sngags de la sngags nyid du bkag pa med de dug la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i sgo nas rig byed pa dag gi yang sngags nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i sngags rnams dug la sogs pa'i las byed pa la bsnyon @282a * //
translated: The Buddha and so on are not refuted as mantras because of their function of poison and so on, because the Vedas are also established as mantras by way of their function of poison and so on.

original: bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bar mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be denied that the mantras of the Buddhists and so on function to produce poison and so on,

original: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen to do so.

original: de la bsnyon na ni de la yang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsnyon na ni de la yang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If you deny that, then it is the same for you.

original: rig byed pa'i ngang rnams dug la sogs pa sel bar nus pas dag gzhan las khyad par can yin pa ni bla ste /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i ngang rnams dug la sogs pa sel bar nus pas dag gzhan las khyad par can yin pa ni bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the Vedas are superior to others because they are able to remove poison and so on,

original: de tsam gyis de rtag pa nyid du rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis de rtag pa nyid du rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not reasonable that they are permanent merely because of that.

original: gang gi phyir phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la phyag rgya ni srog chags dag gi sor mo rnams kyi dbyibs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la phyag rgya ni srog chags dag gi sor mo rnams kyi dbyibs so //
translated: Seals are the shapes of the fingers of living beings.

original: dkyil 'khor ni lha la sogs pa bkod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni lha la sogs pa bkod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Maṇḍalas are the special arrangements of deities and so on.

original: bsam gtan ni nam mkha' lding la sogs pa sems pa ste /🔽phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan zhes zlas dbye ba'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni nam mkha' lding la sogs pa sems pa ste / phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan zhes zlas dbye ba'am /
translated: Contemplations are the thoughts of garuḍas and so on.🔽Seals, maṇḍalas, and contemplations are a dvandva compound.

original: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang phyag rgya la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Or seals, maṇḍalas, and the performance of seals and so on.

original: de dag gi yi ge med pa can te sgra med pa'i rang bzhin can dag gis dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las rnams byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi yi ge med pa can te sgra med pa'i rang bzhin can dag gis dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las rnams byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Those that lack syllables, that are of the nature of soundlessness, will perform the functions characterized by removing poison and so on.

original: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan de dag ni skyes bus ma byas par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang bsam gtan de dag ni skyes bus ma byas par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those seals, maṇḍalas, and contemplations are not reasonable to be uncreated by a person.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na phyag rgya la sogs pa yi ge med pa'i rang bzhin rnams la skyes bu rnams kyi dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i nus pa yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na phyag rgya la sogs pa yi ge med pa'i rang bzhin rnams la skyes bu rnams kyi dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i nus pa yod pa yin gyi /
translated: If that were so, then such things as the mudrā seal would have the ability to remove poison and so on, even though they are by nature devoid of letters.🔽

original: yi ge dang tshig gi go rims can gyi sngags la ni ma yin /
analyzed: yi ge dang tshig gi go rims can gyi sngags la ni ma yin /
translated: If that were so, then the power to remove poison, etc. would exist for those who have no letters, such as seals, etc., but it would not exist for the mantras that have the order of letters and words.

original: de bas na sngags rnams kyis dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na sngags rnams kyis dug la sogs pa sel bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the power to remove poison, etc. by the mantras is not created by a person.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “If they have a function,” etc.

original: phyag rgya la sogs pa de dag gi byed ba yod na /
analyzed: phyag rgya la sogs pa de dag gi byed ba yod na /
translated: If those seals, etc. have a function,

original: skyes bu ste bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa rnams la yi ge 'god par byed pa 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: skyes bu ste bden pa dang dka' thub kyi mthu dang ldan pa rnams la yi ge 'god par byed pa 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
translated: what is the contradiction in the powerful people, who have the power of truth and austerity, arranging the letters?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference.

original: de bas na skyes bu de dag gi byed pa nus pa med par ni cir yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu de dag gi byed pa nus pa med par ni cir yang mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, the function of those people is not possible without power.

original: gang gis skyes bu dag gi nus pa med pa phul du byung ba nye bar bstan pas 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis skyes bu dag gi nus pa med pa phul du byung ba nye bar bstan pas 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By which the power of men, which is not excellent, is demonstrated, and the nature of the actions of the world, which is different, is understood.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa dang cig shos dag gi sngags dang rtog pa skyes bus byas pa gnyis po bden pa las byung ba can bden pa ston pa'i skyes bu las skyes pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa dang cig shos dag gi sngags dang rtog pa skyes bus byas pa gnyis po bden pa las byung ba can bden pa ston pa'i skyes bu las skyes pa de dag kyang /
translated: If the mantras and tantras of the Buddhists and others are both produced by a person, and if they arise from the truth, and if they are produced by a person who teaches the truth,

original: da ni ji ltar na bden pa las byung @282b ba can sangs rgyas ba dang cig shos kyi sngags dang rtog pa de dag phan tshun 'gal ba dag tu mi rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na bden pa las byung @282b ba can sangs rgyas ba dang cig shos kyi sngags dang rtog pa de dag phan tshun 'gal ba dag tu mi rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: then how is it that the mantras and tantras of the Buddhists and others, which arise from the truth, are not reasonable as mutually contradictory?

original: gcig la 'tsho ba la sogs pa dag ni mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid dang gzhan dag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la 'tsho ba la sogs pa dag ni mngon par mtho ba ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid dang gzhan dag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in one [system] the life, etc., are not the cause of high rebirth, and because they are taught in other [systems].

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He answers with “Those, etc.”

original: sngags dang rtog pa de dag ni thams cad du bden pa las byung ba can dag ma yin na /
analyzed: sngags dang rtog pa de dag ni thams cad du bden pa las byung ba can dag ma yin na /
translated: Those mantras and fictions are not all produced from the truth.

original: gang gis 'di la 'gal ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis 'di la 'gal ba yin /
translated: By what are they contradictory?

original: 'on kyang skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa'i dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la yang sngags dang rtog pa de dag 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu mthu dang ldan pa'i dam bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la yang sngags dang rtog pa de dag 'gyur te /
translated: However, those mantras and fictions are also for those who have the characteristic of a powerful person’s vow.

original: skyes bu mthu dang ldan pas yi ge dang tshig bkod pa 'di goms par byed pa dang de'i cho ga rjes su sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de'i ji ltar dam bcas pa'i don bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i dam bcas pa gang yin pa de'i
analyzed: skyes bu mthu dang ldan pas yi ge dang tshig bkod pa 'di goms par byed pa dang de'i cho ga rjes su sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de'i ji ltar dam bcas pa'i don bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i dam bcas pa gang yin pa de'i
translated: For those who are powerful people, the letters and words are arranged, and those who cultivate them and accomplish the rite of that vow think, “I will accomplish the meaning of the vow just as it is.”

original: mtshan nyid can dag la yang sngags dang rtog pa dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can dag la yang sngags dang rtog pa dag 'gyur ro //
translated: Those mantras and fictions are also for those who have the characteristic of that vow.

original: de bas na gzhan du smra ba yin du zin kyang mthu dang ldan pas sngags dang rtog pa dag byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan du smra ba yin du zin kyang mthu dang ldan pas sngags dang rtog pa dag byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if one speaks otherwise, since the mantras and fictions are made by powerful people, there is no contradiction.

original: gal te bden pa med pa'i phyir mthu de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bden pa med pa'i phyir mthu de nyid gang las yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What is the source of that power, since it does not exist as a real entity?,”

original: mthu de ni 'gro ba dang grub pa'i khyad par dag las kyang 'gyur ba ste /🔽bsod nams bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: mthu de ni 'gro ba dang grub pa'i khyad par dag las kyang 'gyur ba ste / bsod nams bya ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'i 'gro ba'i khyad par de dang 'dra ba rnyed pa'am /
translated: that power also arises from the special attainment of a mantra and the special attainment of a being.🔽One attains a special being that is similar to the one who is the object of the mantra, such as the one who performs meritorious actions,

original: sngags grub pa'i khyad par gang gis de dang 'dra ba'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags grub pa'i khyad par gang gis de dang 'dra ba'i mthu dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: or one attains a special power that is similar to the one possessed by the one who has attained the mantra.

original: gal te sngags skyes bus byas pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sngags skyes bus byas pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the mantra is created by a person,

original: skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then because that person is a human being,

original: skyes bu thams cad ci'i phyir sngags mi byed de /
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad ci'i phyir sngags mi byed de /
translated: why don’t all human beings create mantras?

original: byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And yet they do not create them.

original: de bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dag gis kyang sngags ma byas so zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu dag gis kyang sngags ma byas so zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even those who desire to attain a special being do not create mantras.

original: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yin te /
translated: The statement “that” and so on is the proponent of the conclusion.

original: sngags de dag byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa bden pa dang dka' thub dang mthu la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad sngags byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngags de dag byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa bden pa dang dka' thub dang mthu la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad sngags byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are devoid of the truth, austerities, power, etc. that are the means of accomplishing those mantras, not all beings are mantra-makers.

original: gal te bden pa dang dka' thub la sogs ba sngags byed pa'i rgyu de dang 'dra ba dag dang skyes bu ldan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngags byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bden pa dang dka' thub la sogs ba sngags byed pa'i rgyu de dang 'dra ba dag dang skyes bu ldan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngags byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If truth, austerities, etc. were the causes of being a mantra-maker, then when a person is endowed with those similar to them, at that time they would become a mantra-maker.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu snyan dang gas byed pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa byed pa'i phyir de bye dpa'i spobs pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu thams cad kyang @283a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu snyan dang gas byed pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa byed pa'i phyir de bye dpa'i spobs pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu thams cad kyang @283a * //
translated: Moreover, because a person endowed with the eloquence of a speaker would be a mantra-maker, then all beings devoid of the eloquence of a speaker

original: skyes bu nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir snyan dang gas brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir snyan dang gas brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: would also be mantra-makers, because they are similar in being human.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang mi byed na gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang mi byed pa de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang mi byed na gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang mi byed pa de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: If one does not do anything, then another does not do anything either. It is similar to that.

original: skyes bu snyan dang gas byed pa'i nus pa med pa dang 'dra ba de ltar na rigs pa de dag ni snga nas med pa yin no /🔽sngags byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu snyan dang gas byed pa'i nus pa med pa dang 'dra ba de ltar na rigs pa de dag ni snga nas med pa yin no / sngags byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /

original: bden pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don grub par byed pa'i tshig dang / de bzhin du 'gro ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu khas blangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dam bcas pa las sngags zhes bya ba gzhan cung zad kyang med do //

translated: The words that accomplish the desired aim of persons who possess truth and so on, and likewise the mantra that is the characteristic of the promise accepted by persons who possess going and so on, are not even slightly different from that.

original: bden pa dang dka' thub dang 'gro ba dang grub pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid de dag kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la mthong ngo //
analyzed: bden pa dang dka' thub dang 'gro ba dang grub pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid de dag kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la mthong ngo //
translated: Those characteristics of truth, austerity, going, and special accomplishment are seen in some person.

analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang dang gang skyes bu yin pa de ni sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: If that is so, then whatever is a person is devoid of the activity of mantra-making.

original: dper na lam po che'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lam po che'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a person on the road.

original: sngags byed par 'dod pa'i skyes bu 'di yang skyes bu yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: sngags byed par 'dod pa'i skyes bu 'di yang skyes bu yin no zhe na ;
translated: This person who desires to make a mantra is a person.

original: de bas na 'di la yang skyes bu thams cad de dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la yang skyes bu thams cad de dang bral ba ste /
translated: Therefore, in this case, all persons are devoid of that.

original: sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dang bral ba de ltar yang nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dang bral ba de ltar yang nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The existence of the person who utters the mantra is not ascertained in the same way,

original: sngags skyed pa'i sgrub par byed pa de yod cing srid pa'i skyes bu dang lhan cig 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags skyed pa'i sgrub par byed pa de yod cing srid pa'i skyes bu dang lhan cig 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the person who utters the mantra exists and is not incompatible with the existence of the mantra.

original: gal te sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu rnams la med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu rnams la med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the person who utters the mantra is ascertained to be nonexistent because the nature of the person who utters the mantra is not observed,

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says:

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin can dag ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin can dag ste /
translated: The nature of things that are hidden🔽is not perceived by those with limited vision.🔽The nature of things that are hidden is not perceived by those with limited vision.

original: gang la dbang po las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i @283b don to //
analyzed: gang la dbang po las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i @283b don to //
translated: The meaning of “those with limited vision” is those whose vision is obstructed.

original: mi dmigs pa ni med par nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni med par nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: Nonobservation is not a reason for ascertaining nonexistence.

original: gal te bdag nyid la sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa dran pa la sogs pa dag mi dmigs pas gzhan dag la yang med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid la sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa dran pa la sogs pa dag mi dmigs pas gzhan dag la yang med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the self, which is the agent of the performance of mantra, is ascertained to be nonexistent in others because it is not perceived in oneself, then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: dran pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dran pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Memory, understanding, discernment, truth, and power🔽do not exist in all things.

original: dran pa ni 'das pa'i skye bo la sogs pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni 'das pa'i skye bo la sogs pa dran pa'o //
translated: Memory is the recollection of past things and so on.

original: blo ni gzhan gyi sems pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni gzhan gyi sems pa'o //
translated: Understanding is the knowledge of others’ minds.

original: so sor rig pa ni dngos po mthong ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rig pa ni dngos po mthong ba'i de kho na nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: Discernment is the knowledge of reality, seeing things as they are.

original: bden pa ni rnam pa gzhan du ma yin par smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa ni rnam pa gzhan du ma yin par smra ba nyid do //
translated: Truth is the nature of speaking without distortion.

original: nus pa ni mthu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nus pa ni mthu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Power is the nature of ability.

original: dran pa dang blo dang / so sor rig pa dang / bden pa dang nus pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o //🔽thams cad la 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang blo dang / so sor rig pa dang / bden pa dang nus pa zhes bya ba ni zlas dbye ba'o // thams cad la 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Memory, understanding, discernment, truth, and power are the terms that are distinguished.🔽They do not exist in all things.

original: skyes bu'i rgyud thams cad la 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rgyud thams cad la 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist in all the continuums of persons.

original: gang gis de dag bdag nyid la ma mthong bas gzhan la yang spong bar 'gyur ba gang gis sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu rnams la nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dag bdag nyid la ma mthong bas gzhan la yang spong bar 'gyur ba gang gis sngags byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa dang bral ba'i skyes bu rnams la nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they do not see those in themselves, they will also abandon them in others.

original: 'di ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag gi khyad par dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag gi khyad par dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: This is just like the special correct instructions for accomplishing those, which are not for all people who practice mantra.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dran pa la sogs pa dag 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub par byed pa ste /🔽skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i yang dag pa'i man ngag gdams ngag de'i khyad par gyi bye brag yid ches pa'i lung 'ga' zhig la yod pa yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar yon tan gzhan sgrub par byed pa dag
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dran pa la sogs pa dag 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub par byed pa ste / skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de'i yang dag pa'i man ngag gdams ngag de'i khyad par gyi bye brag yid ches pa'i lung 'ga' zhig la yod pa yin gyi thams cad la ma yin pa de dang 'dra bar yon tan gzhan sgrub par byed pa dag
translated: Since those who practice mantra accomplish mindfulness and so on, as explained, they are practitioners.🔽The special features of those correct instructions, which are the causes that generate them, exist in some scriptures of reliable testimony, but not in all.

original: kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, there are also other qualities that are accomplished.

original: sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po grub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po grub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Accomplishing the accomplishment is the accomplishment of an entity.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i sgra ni grub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i sgra ni grub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term “accomplishment” is a term for “establishment.”

original: rgyu dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan gzhan dran pa la sogs pa de dag sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dran pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i yon tan gzhan dran pa la sogs pa de dag sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: The other qualities such as memory that are the effects of the cause, memory, etc., are accomplished.

original: grub pa dag kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa dag kyang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And those that are established exist in some person.

original: ji ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yod pa de ltar nan tan du sgrub pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag skyes bu 'ga' zhig la yod pa de ltar nan tan du sgrub pa las /
translated: Just as the correct instruction that accomplishes those exists in some person, in the same way, through the accomplishment of practice,

original: dran pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'ga' zhig la yod par 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'ga' zhig la yod par 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: there is no contradiction in the existence of memory, etc., in some person. This is the meaning.

original: gal te dran pa la sogs pa de dag sgrub par byed pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa la sogs pa de dag sgrub par byed pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the accomplishment of those such as memory exists,

original: ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na yong du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi snang zhe na yong du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: why is it not seen? He says, “Even if it exists,” etc.

original: yod pa ste snang du zin kyang rgyud gzhan la brten pa'i yid kyi yon tan skyes bu tsam gyis @284a * //
analyzed: yod pa ste snang du zin kyang rgyud gzhan la brten pa'i yid kyi yon tan skyes bu tsam gyis @284a * //
translated: Even if it exists, that is, even if it is seen, the mental qualities that are based on another continuum are not seen by a mere person.

original: mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to see it.

original: gang gi phyir yod du zin kyang mthong bar mi nus pa de nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan la yod pa yid kyi yon tan ma mthong ba las bsnyon du med pas to spang du med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod du zin kyang mthong bar mi nus pa de nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan la yod pa yid kyi yon tan ma mthong ba las bsnyon du med pas to spang du med do //
translated: Since it is not possible to see it even if it exists, it is undeniable that the mental qualities that exist in other continua are not seen.

original: gal te skyes bu rnams la yid kyi yon tan thun mong ma yin pa skye ba na gnod pa can yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu rnams la yid kyi yon tan thun mong ma yin pa skye ba na gnod pa can yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that when mental qualities arise in beings, they are harmed,

original: skyes bu rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “If there is no contradiction in the arising of mental qualities in beings,” and so on.

original: skyes bu rnams la yid kyi yon tan skye bar 'dod pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin na gang gis de las gzhan pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba'i yon tan gang zhig med par 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la yid kyi yon tan skye bar 'dod pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin na gang gis de las gzhan pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba'i yon tan gang zhig med par 'gyur /
translated: If there is no contradiction in the arising of mental qualities in beings, then what other quality is there that is superior to that?

original: gal te skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i chos gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i chos gnod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the qualities of being a being and so on are harmful,

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: that is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i gnod par bya ba yon tan de ni skyes bu tsam gyis ma mthong bas /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i gnod par bya ba yon tan de ni skyes bu tsam gyis ma mthong bas /
translated: The qualities that are to be harmed, which exist in other continua, are not seen by mere beings.

original: skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the person, etc., as that which is to be harmed and that which harms is not established.

original: gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be rejected because it is not that which harms.

original: bshad ma thag pa 'dis ni don thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i lan nges par brjod cing lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa 'dis ni don thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de 'gog pa dang / sogs pa smos pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i lan nges par brjod cing lan btab pa yin te /
translated: By this just explained, he has given an answer to the question, “If you reject omniscience, etc.,

original: dper na smra ba nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dag spong ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na smra ba nyid la sogs pa'i rtags kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa dag spong ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the reason of being a speaker, etc., does not reject omniscience, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa spong ba de la yang skyes bus de lta bur gyur pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa spong ba de la yang skyes bus de lta bur gyur pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ste //
translated: In that rejection of being free from attachment, etc., it is not right to say that a person is not endowed with the qualities of being free from attachment, etc.

original: mi 'gyur bar ro zhes bya bar rigs pa ste tshul yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar ro zhes bya bar rigs pa ste tshul yin no //
translated: It is not right to say that he is not unchanging.

original: skyes bu ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of person is this?

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag med pa 'di ci 'dra ba ste /🔽gang de la sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i mang ngag med pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag med pa 'di ci 'dra ba ste / gang de la sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i mang ngag med pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: He is one who lacks the right instruction for accomplishing it.🔽The right instruction for accomplishing it is the instruction for accomplishing freedom from attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i thabs dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not logical to say that one who lacks the means for accomplishing freedom from attachment and so on will become free from attachment and so on.

original: shes par byed pa ma mthong ba can de'i rang bzhin can la ma yin no zhes bya bar yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma mthong ba can de'i rang bzhin can la ma yin no zhes bya bar yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not the case that one who lacks the means for knowing it does not have the nature of knowing it.

original: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba la @284b sogs pa'i rtags shis par byed pa ma mthong ba de ni shes par byed pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis de'i rang bzhin can ma yin na /
analyzed: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba la @284b sogs pa'i rtags shis par byed pa ma mthong ba de ni shes par byed pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis de'i rang bzhin can ma yin na /
translated: But it is not right to say that the nature of something is not to possess the qualities of being free from attachment, etc., just because one does not see the signs of being free from attachment, etc.🔽For, in that case, it would follow that the nature of something is not to possess the qualities of being free from attachment, etc., just because one does not see the mere non-apprehension of the evidence of being free from attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not right that the non-apprehension of the evidence of being free from attachment, etc.

original: shes par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis shes par bya ba med pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis shes par bya ba med pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: is the mere non-apprehension of that which is to be apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang rtags su gyur pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang rtags su gyur pa'i 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even if some object exists, the effect that would be the evidence of it does not occur.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnams kyi 'bras bu yin pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes mthong bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba dbang po las 'das pa'i don rnams kyi 'bras bu yin pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa 'di rnams kyi 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes mthong bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even though the intention is the effect of objects that are beyond the senses, still, because it is not possible to see that these things that are separated by time are its effect,

original: de bas na sngags byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba ni gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du thams cad la zhes de ltar nges pa can du nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na sngags byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba ni gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du thams cad la zhes de ltar nges pa can du nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the mantra-reciter as devoid of the object of his recitation is not certain in the same way that it is of the one object.

original: gang gi phyir de yin pa de bas na 'don par byed pa ni 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yin pa de bas na 'don par byed pa ni 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Since that is so, the proof that the reciter is preceded by another reciter

original: 'don par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags ni 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags ni 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: is inconclusive, because the reason, “because of recitation,” is mistaken.

original: skyes bus byas pa bha ra ta 'don par byed pa yang 'don par byed pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa bha ra ta 'don par byed pa yang 'don par byed pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recitation of the Bharata composed by a person is also recitation.

original: rig byed kyi khyad par du byas pa'i phyir skyon med pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi khyad par du byas pa'i phyir skyon med pa yin te /
translated: The reply is that there is no error, because the reason is specified as “the recitation of the Veda.”

original: gzhan gyis bsam pa ni 'don par byed pa tsam ni rtags ma yin na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsam pa ni 'don par byed pa tsam ni rtags ma yin na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
translated: The opponent thinks: “If mere recitation is not the reason, then what is?

original: 'on kyang rig byed khyad par can 'don par byed pa ni 'don par byed la gzhan sngon du song ba can bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang rig byed khyad par can 'don par byed pa ni 'don par byed la gzhan sngon du song ba can bsgrub par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: But the recitation of the special Vedas is the recitation itself, and the other is the object to be accomplished.

original: de la rig byed 'don par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs khyad par can dang bcas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rig byed 'don par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs khyad par can dang bcas pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And since the recitation of the Vedas is the reason, the reason is not applied to discordant cases.

original: rig byed 'don bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /🔽rig byed 'don par byed pa la phul du byung ba yang ci zhig yod na gang gis rig byed 'don par byed pa rnams gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bdag gis sbyar nas 'don par mi byed ba yin na phul du byung ba nyid du cung zad kyang yod
analyzed: rig byed 'don bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te / rig byed 'don par byed pa la phul du byung ba yang ci zhig yod na gang gis rig byed 'don par byed pa rnams gzhan gyis zhes bya ba bdag gis sbyar nas 'don par mi byed ba yin na phul du byung ba nyid du cung zad kyang yod
translated: The statement “The recitation of the Vedas” and so on is the opinion of the proponent of tenets.🔽What is the excellence of the recitation of the Vedas, since those who recite the Vedas are not recited by others?

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: If one were to add “by me,” there would be no excellence at all.

original: de bas na rig byed 'don par byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de nyid 'khrul pa yin no //🔽'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs te 'don par byed pa @285a * //
analyzed: de bas na rig byed 'don par byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de nyid 'khrul pa yin no // 'di ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs te 'don par byed pa @285a * //
translated: The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.🔽The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.

original: gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa dang lhan cig byed kyi khyad par 'gal ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di las gtan tshigs ldog par byed pa ma yin no //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa dang lhan cig byed kyi khyad par 'gal ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di las gtan tshigs ldog par byed pa ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.

original: rig byed nyid dang 'don pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa 'gal ba med pa dag ni /🔽rig byed kyi ngag gcig la srid pa'i phyir rig byed 'don par 'gyur ba yang yin la /
analyzed: rig byed nyid dang 'don pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa 'gal ba med pa dag ni / rig byed kyi ngag gcig la srid pa'i phyir rig byed 'don par 'gyur ba yang yin la /
translated: The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.

original: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.🔽The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.🔽The reason is not contradictory, because there is no contradiction between the property to be established and the property of the counter-example.

original: skyes bu da ltar ba rnams 'don par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skyes bu da ltar ba rnams 'don par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it causes the recitation of present persons.

original: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid kyi sgo nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid kyi sgo nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes recitation through the prior existence of another reciter.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa med par 'don par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa med par 'don par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to recite without the teaching of another.

original: de'i lan ni bha ra ta 'don par byed pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni bha ra ta 'don par byed pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The response to that is that it follows that the recitation of the Bharata would also be that.

original: de yang da ltar pa dag gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sgo nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir de yang dang po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin pas na rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa yin
analyzed: de yang da ltar pa dag gzhan gyis bstan pa'i sgo nas 'don par byed pa'i phyir de yang dang po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin pas na rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa yin
translated: Because that is recited through the teaching of another, and that also would be preceded by another reciter who is the original desire to recite. Therefore, like the Vedas, it would not be composed by a person.

original: par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gal te rig byed 'don par byed pa yin na ni rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: gal te rig byed 'don par byed pa yin na ni rig byed 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: If the Vedas are recitation, then they would be preceded by the recitation of the Vedas.

original: byed pa po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the agent is not seen.

original: 'di yang spangs zin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang spangs zin pa ste /
translated: This also has been refuted,

original: byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa can gyis byas pa yang mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du gsal ba yin no //🔽gal te de ltar rig byed kyi byed pa po ma mthong ba de ltar sngon yang med pa yin no zhes nges par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'i yang dag pa'i man ngag rgyun chad pa can gyis byas pa yang mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du gsal ba yin no // gal te de ltar rig byed kyi byed pa po ma mthong ba de ltar sngon yang med pa yin no zhes nges par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is clear from the above that the agent is seen to be one who has the right instruction in the performance of the rite.🔽If it is not possible to ascertain that the agent of the Vedic rites was not previously nonexistent because the agent is not seen,

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba tsam med pa go bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba tsam med pa go bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then the mere nonseeing of the agent cannot prove that he did not exist previously,

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
translated: because the reason “because he is seen to perform the Vedic rites” is mistaken.

original: de bas na rig byed kyi khyad par 'don par byed pa'i gtan tshigs phul du byung ba la brten par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na rig byed kyi khyad par 'don par byed pa'i gtan tshigs phul du byung ba la brten par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the reason “because he is seen to perform the Vedic rites” is not a good reason for the existence of the agent of the Vedic rites.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang 'gal ba med pas khyad par can du byed par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma log pa'i phyir khyad par bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs dang 'gal ba med pas khyad par can du byed par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ma log pa'i phyir khyad par bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not contradictory to the unchanging position, it does not serve to distinguish the two. And even if it did distinguish them, it would be the same as not distinguishing them, because it does not reverse the discordant position.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par ma bzung ba dang mtshungs pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the same as not distinguishing them,

original: gang cung zad rig byed 'don par byed pa de dag thams cad ni @285b rig byed 'don pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang cung zad rig byed 'don par byed pa de dag thams cad ni @285b rig byed 'don pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it follows that all those who recite the Vedas have previously studied other Vedas.

original: rig byed kyis khyad bar du byas pa gtan tshigs yin du zin kyang khyab par ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyis khyad bar du byas pa gtan tshigs yin du zin kyang khyab par ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Even if the reason is qualified by the word “Veda,” the pervasion is not established.

original: bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pas rig byed 'don par byed pa thams cad de lta bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pas rig byed 'don par byed pa thams cad de lta bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because there is no valid cognition that contradicts the reverse of the reason. Not all reciters of the Vedas are established as having that nature,

original: 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that they have previously studied the Vedas.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can te 'don par byed pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can bdag nyid 'don par byed par nus pa med pa ci 'dra ba mthong ba de ni de ltar zhes bya ba 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can kho na zhes bya bar🔽'gyur ro // bdag nyid 'don bar byed par nus pa med par 'don par byed pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can te 'don par byed pa gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can bdag nyid 'don par byed par nus pa med pa ci 'dra ba mthong ba de ni de ltar zhes bya ba 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can kho na zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // bdag nyid 'don bar byed par nus pa med par 'don par byed pa gang yin pa de'i khyad par mthong ba ste /
translated: The one who sees the reason is the one who sees the difference between the one who is able to recite the Veda and the one who is unable to recite the Veda.🔽The one who sees the difference is the one who rejects the reason, such as stupidity, and so on.🔽The one who rejects the reason, such as stupidity, and so on, is the one who sees the difference.🔽The one who sees the difference is the one who rejects the reason, such as stupidity, and so on.

original: glen pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de dor bar zhes pa glen pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'don par byed pa ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par can de dor zhing de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan sngon 'don pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis rig byed 'don par
analyzed: glen pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de dor bar zhes pa glen pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'don par byed pa ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par can de dor zhing de'i rgyu mtshan gzhan sngon 'don pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis rig byed 'don par
translated: The one who rejects the reason, such as stupidity, and so on, is the one who recites the Veda by the reason of another’s recitation.

original: byed pa nyid kyi spyi smos pa ni nus pa dang mi nus pa thams cad rig byed 'don pa ni 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: byed pa nyid kyi spyi smos pa ni nus pa dang mi nus pa thams cad rig byed 'don pa ni 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: The statement of the general rule of the act is that all that is possible and impossible is the recitation of the Veda, which is preceded by another who recites it,

original: rig byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rig byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is the same in being the recitation of the Veda. This is just a mistake.

original: bsreg za sgrub pa ste me grub ba las rdzas sngon po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsreg za sgrub pa ste me grub ba las rdzas sngon po dang 'dra'o //
translated: The establishment of the fire is like the substance blue.

original: me bsgrub par bya ba la du ba sngon po'i khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa de dor zhing rdzas sngon po'i spyi rjod bar byed pa na /
analyzed: me bsgrub par bya ba la du ba sngon po'i khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa de dor zhing rdzas sngon po'i spyi rjod bar byed pa na /
translated: When the particular of the blue smoke that is seen in the establishment of the fire is rejected and the universal of the blue substance is stated,

original: ci ltar me la 'khrul pa yin pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar me la 'khrul pa yin pa de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: just as there is a mistake about the fire, that is the meaning.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa 'dis na tshig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa 'dis na tshig la sogs pa ste /
translated: By this teaching of the just explained mistake, the words and so on are stated.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu nyid dang lag pa la sogs pa dad ldan pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ji ltar 'khrul pa yin pa bzhin du lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu nyid dang lag pa la sogs pa dad ldan pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ji ltar 'khrul pa yin pa bzhin du lan btab pa yin no //
translated: The words “and so on” indicate that the reasonings of “being a person,” “having arms and so on,” and “being a speaker” are also refuted in the same way that the reasonings of “being a speaker” and “being a knower” are refuted.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang la zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what is the probandum?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la ste /
translated: It is the establishment of desire and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag la 'dod chags pa las byung ba'i tshig gi khyad par ci 'dra ba mthong ba de dor zhing /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag la 'dod chags pa las byung ba'i tshig gi khyad par ci 'dra ba mthong ba de dor zhing /
translated: The specific words that arise from desire, such as “I desire,” are seen to be uttered by one who is desirous.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid kyi spyi brjod pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid kyi spyi brjod pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the general term “speaker” is applied to them erroneously.

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa 'di 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can sgrub par byed pa yin pa yang bla ste /🔽kho bo cag @286a * //
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa 'di 'don par byed pa sngon du song ba can sgrub par byed pa yin pa yang bla ste / kho bo cag @286a * //
translated: It is also possible that the recitation of the Vedas is established on the basis of the prior recitation of the Vedas.🔽What will we do with this?

original: shin tu zhen pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: shin tu zhen pas ci zhig bya /
translated: We are very attached to it.

original: 'on kyang de ltar byas nas kyang rig byed ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar byas nas kyang rig byed ni /
translated: But even if we do this, the Vedas

original: rnam kun thog med grub 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam kun thog med grub 'gyur te //
translated: are not established in any way whatsoever.

original: thog ma spangs pa nyid tsam grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma spangs pa nyid tsam grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that it is merely abandoned at the beginning.

original: da ltar skyes min rten can min te /
analyzed: da ltar skyes min rten can min te /
translated: It is not produced in the present, nor does it have a basis.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also not established that it is not created by a person.

original: ci ste thog ma med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'don na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste thog ma med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'don na de'i tshe /
translated: But if you say that it is not created by a person because it is beginningless,

original: thog ma med pa nas 'jug pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas 'jug pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: then because it has operated from beginningless time,

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gzhan yang mi min rten can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gzhan yang mi min rten can du 'gyur te /
translated: other conventions of the world would also not be created by a person.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They would be uncreated by a person.

original: skyes bu bdag nyid kyis brtags pa ste nye bar brtags nas 'don par byed pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu bdag nyid kyis brtags pa ste nye bar brtags nas 'don par byed pa'am /
translated: When a person recites it after investigating it himself,

original: gzhan slob dpon las 'don phar byed pa na /
analyzed: gzhan slob dpon las 'don phar byed pa na /
translated: or when he recites it after learning it from another teacher,

original: byed pa'i bya ba med pa can gyi skyes bu de dag gi sgra rang nyid sgrogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i bya ba med pa can gyi skyes bu de dag gi sgra rang nyid sgrogs par byed pa ste /
translated: the sound of those persons who do not perform the action of recitation is itself proclaimed,

original: rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but its own nature is not manifested.

original: de bas na skyes bu'i bya ba'i sgo nas rig byed kyi sgra de dag sgrogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu'i bya ba'i sgo nas rig byed kyi sgra de dag sgrogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the sounds of the Vedas are uttered by the activity of a person,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dag dang 'dra bar skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dag dang 'dra bar skyes bus byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: they are like anything else and are produced by a person.

original: bdag nyid sgogs par byed pa gang gis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: bdag nyid sgogs par byed pa gang gis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: What is it that makes them self-existent so that they are not produced by a person?

original: gal te de dag rang nyid sgrogs par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /🔽skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag rang nyid sgrogs par byed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe / skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were to utter themselves,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin par yang 'gyur te /
translated: then they would be produced by a person.🔽But that is not the case.

original: gal te skyes bu dag las sngar yod pa nyid du rig byed grub par 'gyur na rig byed skyes bus ma byas par 'grub par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu dag las sngar yod pa nyid du rig byed grub par 'gyur na rig byed skyes bus ma byas par 'grub par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If the Vedas existed prior to the person, then the Vedas would be established as not produced by a person.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu dag las sngar gnas pa nyid du rig byed de nyid ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu dag las sngar gnas pa nyid du rig byed de nyid ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But the Vedas are not established as existing prior to the person.

original: skyes bu rnams la thog ma nyid yod la /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams la thog ma nyid yod la /
translated: The person exists prior to the Vedas.

original: rig byed thog ma dang ldan pa nyid ma yin na de grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig byed thog ma dang ldan pa nyid ma yin na de grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not the case that the first reciter existed, then the Vedas would not exist.

original: 'don par byed pa thog ma med pa can de yang 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub pa na /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa thog ma med pa can de yang 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid du bsgrub pa na /
translated: And that beginningless recitation is established as having another reciter prior to it.

original: skyes bu rnams thog ma can nyid yin pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams thog ma can nyid yin pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: And when it is established that the first person exists,

original: dang po'i skyes bu 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can te /
analyzed: dang po'i skyes bu 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can te /
translated: then the first person is established as having another reciter prior to him.

original: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa gzhan sngon du song ba can du mi 'grub bo //
translated: But it is not established that he has another reciter prior to him.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'don pa po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i dang po'i 'don par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'don pa po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // de'i dang po'i 'don par byed pa ste /
translated: Because there is no other reciter.🔽His first recitation

original: rig byed de'i dang po'i 'don par byed pa po bdag nyid kyis brtags nas rig byed 'don par byed pa'i phyir rig byed kyi byed pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig byed de'i dang po'i 'don par byed pa po bdag nyid kyis brtags nas rig byed 'don par byed pa'i phyir rig byed kyi byed pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: is the first recitation of the Vedas. Since he himself imagines the first reciter of the Vedas and recites the Vedas, he would be the author of the Vedas.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rig byed 'don par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di ni gcig gi tha dad las 'don @286b par byas nas gzhan 'don par byed pa de ltar na snga ma snga ma mthong bas 'jug pa yin pas na skyes bu'i tha
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba de'i phyir rig byed 'don par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di ni gcig gi tha dad las 'don @286b par byas nas gzhan 'don par byed pa de ltar na snga ma snga ma mthong bas 'jug pa yin pas na skyes bu'i tha
translated: Therefore, because this is the case, this ritual is one that is performed by a single person, and it is performed by another person who has seen the previous performance.

original: snyad thog ma med pa can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snyad thog ma med pa can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the convention of a person would be beginningless.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it would not be uncreated by a person.

original: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: byis pas rdul gyi rtsed mo dang 'dra bar te /
analyzed: byis pas rdul gyi rtsed mo dang 'dra bar te /
translated: It is like the play of children with dust.

original: byis pa de dag gis rdul gyi rtsed mo ji ltar snga mas mthong ba 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byis pa de dag gis rdul gyi rtsed mo ji ltar snga mas mthong ba 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because children play with dust in the same way that the previous person saw it,

original: skyes bu'i tha snyad thog ma med pa can yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i tha snyad thog ma med pa can yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: the convention of a person would be beginningless.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni zas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni zas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words “and so on” include food and so on.

original: gal te rig byed ni thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed ni thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because the Vedas are beginningless, they are not created by a person,

original: thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: “Because of beginninglessness, etc.”

original: thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the Vedas are not created by a person because of their beginninglessness,

original: da ni rig byed las gzhan pa shin tu mang po skyes bus ma byas pa nyid thob ste thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni rig byed las gzhan pa shin tu mang po skyes bus ma byas pa nyid thob ste thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: then now you have obtained that a great many things other than the Vedas are not created by a person because of their beginninglessness.

original: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says,

original: kla klo la sogs tha snyad dang ste /
analyzed: kla klo la sogs tha snyad dang ste /
translated: “The conventions of barbarians, etc.”

original: rang gi rigs kyi rim pa las 'ongs pa ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag ni thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽sogs pa'i sgras ni thog ma med pa'i 'phags pa'i tha snyad gzhan yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi rim pa las 'ongs pa ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag ni thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro // sogs pa'i sgras ni thog ma med pa'i 'phags pa'i tha snyad gzhan yang gzung ngo //
translated: The conventions of barbarians, etc., which have the characteristic of taking a mother’s sister as a wife, etc., are not created by a person because of their beginninglessness, just like the Vedas.🔽The phrase “etc.” includes other beginningless noble conventions.

original: de bzhin du med par smra ba'i tshig rnams ni ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du med par smra ba'i tshig rnams ni ste /
translated: “Likewise, the words of the nihilists, etc.”

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs par 'jug pa rnams thog med phyir na de bzhin 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la skur pa 'debs par 'jug pa rnams thog med phyir na de bzhin 'gyur te /
translated: and they engage in deprecation of Dharma, nondharma, the next world, and so on, because they are beginningless, they would be like that.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not be created by persons.

original: gal te de dag gi thog ma nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gi thog ma nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, how can they be beginningless?

original: sngon legs byas pa'i rgyun phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngon legs byas pa'i rgyun phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the continuity of good actions in the past,” and so on.

original: sngon du byas pa'i dbang gis rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon du byas pa'i dbang gis rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they engage in continuity by the power of what was done in the past.

original: kla klo tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: kla klo tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “The conventions of barbarians,” and so on.

original: kla klo'i tha snyad kyang thog ma med pa can yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: kla klo'i tha snyad kyang thog ma med pa can yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The conventions of barbarians are also beginningless.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: If you ask, what are they?

original: ma bag mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma bag mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The marriage of a mother,” and so on.

original: pha shi nas bu phos ma bag mar blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kla klo la la dag gi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: pha shi nas bu phos ma bag mar blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kla klo la la dag gi tha snyad yin no //
translated: The convention of some barbarians is that after the father dies, the son marries the mother.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khor ba las thar bar byas pa'i phyir rgan rabs gsad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gzung ngo ;
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'khor ba las thar bar byas pa'i phyir rgan rabs gsad par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad gzung ngo ;
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the conventions “one should kill the old in order to liberate them from cyclic existence” and so on.

original: /'di tsam gyis ni kla klo'i tha snyad rnam par bshad pa yin no //🔽sogs pa'i sgras gzung ba gzhan ni 'dod pa'i dga' ston zhes bya ba @287a * //
analyzed: /'di tsam gyis ni kla klo'i tha snyad rnam par bshad pa yin no // sogs pa'i sgras gzung ba gzhan ni 'dod pa'i dga' ston zhes bya ba @287a * //
translated: This much explains the barbarian conventions.

original: la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The other “and so on” includes the statement “the festival of desire” and so on.

original: 'dod pas nye bar mtshon pa'i tshes bcu gsum gyi dus ston ni 'dod pa'i dga' ston no //
analyzed: 'dod pas nye bar mtshon pa'i tshes bcu gsum gyi dus ston ni 'dod pa'i dga' ston no //
translated: The festival of desire is a festival on the thirteenth day of the lunar month, which is characterized by desire.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras ni bu la sogs pa'i btsa' ston pa la sogs pa yang thog ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras ni bu la sogs pa'i btsa' ston pa la sogs pa yang thog ma med pa can yin no //
translated: Here, the phrase “and so on” also includes the festival of the birth of a son and so on, which are beginningless.

original: med par smra ba dag ste /
analyzed: med par smra ba dag ste /
translated: The nihilists are the Lokāyatas.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dag gi tshig kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dag gi tshig kyang sbyar ro //
translated: The words of the Lokāyatas are also included in the phrase “and so on.”

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What are they like?

original: snga na med pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la skur par byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la skur par byed pa dag ste /
translated: They are those who deny the past and future, and so on.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa snga na med pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol la skur bar byed cing spong bar byed pa de dag kyang thog ma can yin no zhes brtags par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa snga na med pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol la skur bar byed cing spong bar byed pa de dag kyang thog ma can yin no zhes brtags par bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
