translated: and they are the first to deny the existence of Dharma and Adharma and to deny the existence of the world beyond.

original: ji ltar na kla klo'i tha snyad la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang thog ma med pa nyid can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kla klo'i tha snyad la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang thog ma med pa nyid can yin zhe na /
translated: How can other things, such as the barbarian’s conventions, etc., be beginningless?

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The text says, “Those conventions, etc.”

original: tha snyad de dag dad med par smra ba de dag ces bya ba ma ning dang ma ning ma yin pa las /🔽lus pa gcig gi tshig can du 'gyur ba'am 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad de dag dad med par smra ba de dag ces bya ba ma ning dang ma ning ma yin pa las / lus pa gcig gi tshig can du 'gyur ba'am 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The conventions are the words of the nihilists, i.e., the words of those who are neither male nor female.🔽They are the words of the one who remains after the male and female have been eliminated.

original: de bas na don ni kla klo'i tha snyad dang med par smra ba'i tshig de dag ni sngon 'byung ba can gyi skyes bu gzhan rnams kyi legs par ma bsgos pa ste /🔽blo ma sbyangs pa can da ltar ba dag 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na don ni kla klo'i tha snyad dang med par smra ba'i tshig de dag ni sngon 'byung ba can gyi skyes bu gzhan rnams kyi legs par ma bsgos pa ste /🔽blo ma sbyangs pa can da ltar ba dag 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The meaning is that the barbarian’s conventions and the words of the nihilists are not the conventions and words of other beings who existed in the past.🔽They are the conventions and words of those who are not well cultivated, i.e., those who are not well trained.

original: 'on kyang blo ma sbyangs pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo ma sbyangs pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But this is not the case, so it is said that they are not trained in the mind.

original: de dag kyang gzhan dag gis yin la de dag kyang gzhan dag gis yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan dag gis yin la de dag kyang gzhan dag gis yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid du 'grub po //
translated: And since those are due to others, and those are due to others, it is established that they are beginningless.

original: snga na med pa'i snyan dngags la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gzhan gyis byas pa'i legs par byas pa kho na 'jug cing /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i snyan dngags la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang gzhan gyis byas pa'i legs par byas pa kho na 'jug cing /
translated: As for poetry and so on that did not exist previously, those are merely the engagement of the good composition of others.🔽And the conventions created by them are also beginningless.

original: des byas pa'i tha snyad kyang thog ma med pa can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des byas pa'i tha snyad kyang thog ma med pa can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says “those who are self-taught” and so on.

original: re zhig bdag nyid kyi spobs pa ste gang dag gis rang nyid kyi blos bkod pa'i snyan dngags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad brdar byed pa'i skyes bu de dag kyang gzhan las mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas ba ltar thos pa de la rnam par
analyzed: re zhig bdag nyid kyi spobs pa ste gang dag gis rang nyid kyi blos bkod pa'i snyan dngags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad brdar byed pa'i skyes bu de dag kyang gzhan las mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas ba ltar thos pa de la rnam par
translated: First, those who are self-taught, that is, those who create the conventions of poetry and so on that are characterized by their own intellect, they too, having heard it in brief or in detail from others,

original: rtog pa gang yin pa de dag gis bsdus pa na sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa gang yin pa de dag gis bsdus pa na sbyar ba ste /
translated: When those thoughts are collected, they are combined.

original: sde tshan du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sde tshan du byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are made into a group.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhung la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhung la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of just that aspect, they are the cause of engaging the treatise, etc.

original: bdag nyid kyi spobs pas gzhung brtsams su zin kyang dngos su gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi spobs pas gzhung brtsams su zin kyang dngos su gzhan sngon du song ba can nyid yin no //
translated: Even though the treatise was composed by one's own eloquence, it is actually dependent on others.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar na de dag gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar na de dag gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
translated: If one says, How then are they shown to be not dependent on others?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says that and so on.

original: snyan dang gas la sogs pa de @287b ni gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin no zhes brjod do zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: snyan dang gas la sogs pa de @287b ni gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin no zhes brjod do zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: That refers to the ear and so on. It is said that they are not dependent on others. This is connected.

original: gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin gyi /
translated: They are not dependent on others.

original: 'on kyang lha sbyin la sogs pa 'di nyid kyis byas pa brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang lha sbyin la sogs pa 'di nyid kyis byas pa brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is said that this very Devadatta and so on did it. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ston pa 'ga' zhig las don gyi rnam pa cung zad 'ongs pa'i phyir de ston par byed pa gcig ni rgyun gyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa 'ga' zhig las don gyi rnam pa cung zad 'ongs pa'i phyir de ston par byed pa gcig ni rgyun gyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some of the meaning has been conveyed by the teacher, and because there is no one who is the author of the treatise by way of a continuum.

original: re zhig ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas bdag nyid kyi spobs pas bkod pa'i gzhung yang don dam par gzhan sngon du song ba can kho na yin na /
analyzed: re zhig ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas bdag nyid kyi spobs pas bkod pa'i gzhung yang don dam par gzhan sngon du song ba can kho na yin na /
translated: First, the treatise that is composed by one’s own eloquence, in the manner that has been explained, is only preceded by another in the ultimate sense.

original: phal cher ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du 'jug pa can te /
analyzed: phal cher ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du 'jug pa can te /
translated: It is mostly engaged in the way that it is seen.

original: gang dag la gzhan dag las ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du 'jug pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la gzhan dag las ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du 'jug pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that are engaged in the way that they are seen by others are called that.

original: yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa can dag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang log par 'jug pa can dag ste /
translated: They are engaged in the correct and the incorrect.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gang dag la yang dag par log par 'jug pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gang dag la yang dag par log par 'jug pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that are engaged in the correct and the incorrect in worldly conventions are called that.

original: de la yang dag par 'jug pa can ni mchod par bya ba la mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'jug pa can ni mchod par bya ba la mchod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is engaged in the correct is the worship of those who are to be worshipped and so forth.

original: log par 'jug pa can ni 'dod pa dang nye bar ldan pa la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: log par 'jug pa can ni 'dod pa dang nye bar ldan pa la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Those who engage in error are those who are endowed with desire and so on.

original: de dag ni gsal ba kho nar gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni gsal ba kho nar gzhan sngon du song ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are only manifest and they are preceded by others.

original: 'di la 'khrul par dogs pa ni thog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul par dogs pa ni thog ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, the doubt is that there is no error, as stated by “at the beginning” and so on.

original: thog ma'i rtog pa ni dang po'i rtog pa dag ste /
analyzed: thog ma'i rtog pa ni dang po'i rtog pa dag ste /
translated: The initial thoughts are the first thoughts.

original: de rnams la mthong ba med par tha snyad rnams las phyis 'jug par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de rnams la mthong ba med par tha snyad rnams las phyis 'jug par 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it asserted that later, without seeing them, one engages in conventions?

original: de dag gi snga ma rnams las tha snyad dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi snga ma rnams las tha snyad dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The prior ones are not observed as the referents of those conventions,

original: de dag nyid thog ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag nyid thog ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are the very first.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: No, it is replied, and so on.

original: legs par byas pa gzhan gyis bsgoms pas te /
analyzed: legs par byas pa gzhan gyis bsgoms pas te /
translated: It is cultivated by others who have done what is right.

original: sngon gyi skye ba'i rgyun rnams sngar mthong ba'i tha snyad kyis bag chags su bsgos pa'i dang por brtags pa'i skyes bu de dag kyang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba'i rgyun rnams sngar mthong ba'i tha snyad kyis bag chags su bsgos pa'i dang por brtags pa'i skyes bu de dag kyang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The first person who imagined those who are the continuums of former births, who are imbued with the imprints of previously seen conventions, is also just like the conditions.

original: lhan cig byed pa thag nye ba ji lta ba bzhin du sad cing 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa thag nye ba ji lta ba bzhin du sad cing 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are awakened and engaged just like the proximate cooperative conditions.

original: de dag kyang gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan sngon du song ba can ma yin pa dag ma yin no //
translated: And they are not without something else that precedes them.

original: gal te thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir kla klo la sogs pa'i tha snyad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir kla klo la sogs pa'i tha snyad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that because they are beginningless, the conventions of barbarians, etc., are not created by a person,

original: phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa thams cad gang gi tshe /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa thams cad gang gi tshe /
translated: then all that is erroneous and nonerroneous

original: rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rig byed dang 'dra bar skyes bus ma byas pa de'i tshe /
translated: is like the Vedas, not created by a person.

original: tha snyad thams cad thog ma med pa tsam de dang 'dra ba'i skyes bus ma byas pa nyid grub na'ang yon tan ci zhig 'gyur te cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad thog ma med pa tsam de dang 'dra ba'i skyes bus ma byas pa nyid grub na'ang yon tan ci zhig 'gyur te cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If all conventions are just like that, created by a person, then what is the point of establishing that they are not created by a person? Nothing at all.

original: @288a * // de ltar na rnam pa gang gis mi slu ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod kyi rigs kyi chos bsrung ba'i phyir ni ma yin na /
analyzed: @288a * // de ltar na rnam pa gang gis mi slu ba'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod kyi rigs kyi chos bsrung ba'i phyir ni ma yin na /
translated: Thus, since it is nondeceptive in terms of any aspect, it is asserted to be unfabricated by persons, but not because it preserves the qualities of the class.

original: gang gis skyes bus ma byas pa de ni slu bar byed pa la la dag la ste /
analyzed: gang gis skyes bus ma byas pa de ni slu bar byed pa la la dag la ste /
translated: But that which is unfabricated by persons is deceptive for some.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gang dag la yod pas skyes bus ma byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gang dag la yod pas skyes bus ma byas pa nyid de /
translated: Since it exists in terms of worldly conventions, it is unfabricated by persons.

original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa ni 'khrul pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi brtags pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa ni 'khrul pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi brtags pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: But since it is not established as nonerroneous, what is the point of imputing it to be unfabricated by persons because it is mistaken?

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag thog ma med pa can nyin yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mtshungs par 'gyur ba nyid du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag thog ma med pa can nyin yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du mtshungs par 'gyur ba nyid du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, since worldly and Vedic statements are equal in being beginningless, they are equal in being unfabricated by persons.

original: gal te rigs pa las 'das nas rig byed kyi ngag skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rigs pa las 'das nas rig byed kyi ngag skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if you disregard logic and assert that Vedic statements are unfabricated by persons,

original: rig byed kyi ngag dag kho na skyes bus ma byas pa yin na yang de'i brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la the tshom dag kyang yin te //
analyzed: rig byed kyi ngag dag kho na skyes bus ma byas pa yin na yang de'i brjod par bya ba'i don rnams la the tshom dag kyang yin te //
translated: Even if the Vedic statements themselves are not humanly created, the meanings that they express are doubtful.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtog pa na yang the tshom kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtog pa na yang the tshom kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when one imagines that they are not humanly created, they are still doubtful.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: don ni 'dus byas khyad par rnams te /
analyzed: don ni 'dus byas khyad par rnams te /
translated: The meanings are the conditioned distinctions.

original: rig byed kyi don 'chad par byed pa'i slob dpon dag gi rtog pa dag go //
analyzed: rig byed kyi don 'chad par byed pa'i slob dpon dag gi rtog pa dag go //
translated: The meanings of the Vedas are the ideas of the teachers who explain them.

original: khyad par rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the distinctions are seen.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with “If, etc.”

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na yang de'i don spobs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na yang de'i don spobs pa ste /
translated: Even if they are not humanly created, the meanings are doubtful.

original: gal te rig byed kyi ngag gis 'jug par 'dod pa can gyi rig byed kyi ngag gi don la dmigs pa can gyi blo la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du so sor nges pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi ngag gis 'jug par 'dod pa can gyi rig byed kyi ngag gi don la dmigs pa can gyi blo la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du so sor nges pa bskyed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the meanings of the Vedic statements were to generate a certainty in the mind that perceives the meaning of the Vedic statements just as they are, when one desires to engage in them,

original: phyin ci log pa'i don srid pa med pa'i phyir yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i don srid pa med pa'i phyir yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: because the meaning of the erroneous is not possible.

original: skyes bus yid ches pa rnyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyes bus yid ches pa rnyed par 'gyur na /
translated: If a person were to find confidence,

original: de ni yod par ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod par ma yin te /
translated: that would not exist.

original: 'di ji ltar 'don pa bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis te /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar 'don pa bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis te /
translated: As it is recited, it is a superimposition and a denial,

original: don la lhag par 'jog pa dang don gzhan la bsnyon par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don la lhag par 'jog pa dang don gzhan la bsnyon par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is the meaning of “one posits an additional meaning and denies another meaning.”

original: nges brjod kyi bstan bcos kyi tha snyad du byed pa na nges brjod pa'o //
analyzed: nges brjod kyi bstan bcos kyi tha snyad du byed pa na nges brjod pa'o //
translated: When it is used as a convention of the Nirukta treatise, it is Nirukta.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brda sprod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brda sprod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes grammar and so on.

original: rig byed kyi ngag rnams tha dad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed kyi ngag rnams tha dad par byed pa ste /
translated: The statements of the Vedas are differentiated,

original: don sna tshogs su byed pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: don sna tshogs su byed pa mthong ngo //
translated: and they are seen to have various meanings.

original: 'chad pa tha dad pas brtags pa'i don rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chad pa tha dad pas brtags pa'i don rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin te /
translated: The meaning that is imputed by the different explanations does not exist in the statements of the Vedas.

original: gang gi phyir 'chad pa po tha dad pas nye bar byas pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i don de rnams kyang rig byed kyi dag de dag la ni 'thad par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'chad pa po tha dad pas nye bar byas pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i don de rnams kyang rig byed kyi dag de dag la ni 'thad par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because the meanings of the Vedic statements, which are mutually contradictory, are fabricated by different expounders, they cannot be tenable.

original: srid par 'gyur @288b ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid par 'gyur @288b ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is possible.

original: sgra de dag ni 'chad pa po tha dad pas nye bar brtags pa'i don thams cad rjod par byed pa ni srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de dag ni 'chad pa po tha dad pas nye bar brtags pa'i don thams cad rjod par byed pa ni srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that those words express all meanings fabricated by different expounders.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dbang po las 'das pa dag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa yang dbang po las 'das pa dag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because contradictions with reason and so on do not apply to things that are beyond the senses.

original: de bas na re zhig rang gi don dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yid ches pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig rang gi don dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir rig byed kyi ngag rnams la yid ches pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, first of all, one cannot have confidence in the statements of the Vedas because one doubts their meaning.

original: rig byed kyi dag rnams ni bdag nyid don dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rig byed kyi dag rnams ni bdag nyid don dang ldan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The statements of the Vedas do not have a meaning by themselves.

original: 'on kyang brda'i dbang gis yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang brda'i dbang gis yin te /
translated: Rather, they have meaning by the power of convention.

original: gang zhig gang la 'jug par byed pa de ni don des don dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la 'jug par byed pa de ni don des don dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one who engages in something is endowed with the meaning of that thing.

original: don la 'jug pa ste rjod par byed pa nyid dang 'jug pa ni brda gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: don la 'jug pa ste rjod par byed pa nyid dang 'jug pa ni brda gtso bo yin te /
translated: The engagement in meaning, i.e., the very expression, is the primary symbol,

original: brda la rag las pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda la rag las pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause that depends on the symbol.

original: dag gcig la yang brda ji lta ba bzhin du don gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma srid pa'i phyir the tshom kho na yin no //
analyzed: dag gcig la yang brda ji lta ba bzhin du don gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma srid pa'i phyir the tshom kho na yin no //
translated: Since many conceptual thoughts about the meaning are possible in regard to a single symbol, in accordance with the symbol, it is only doubt.

original: rang bzhin dang rkyen gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig byed kyi ngag dag bshad pa'i phyir de dag kyang don nges pa can nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rkyen gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rig byed kyi ngag dag bshad pa'i phyir de dag kyang don nges pa can nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since the statements of the Vedas are explained by following the nature and the conditions, they also have a definite meaning.

original: rig byed kyi dag rnams don gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin no //
analyzed: rig byed kyi dag rnams don gyi rnam par rtog pa du ma srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang log pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement, “The statements of the Vedas are not possible as many conceptual thoughts about the meaning,” is also false.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang bzhin dang rkyen rnams ni don du ma brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rkyen rnams ni don du ma brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the nature and the conditions are not expressed in the meaning.

original: rang bzhin gcig ni don du ma dag rjes su brjod pa yin pa de bzhin du rkyen dag kyang yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs can kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ni don du ma dag rjes su brjod pa yin pa de bzhin du rkyen dag kyang yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas skabs can kho na yin te /
translated: Just as a single nature is said to be the meaning of many words, so too it is a condition, and thus it is only a state of that.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas pa tha dad pa'i phyir the tshom za ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du byas pa tha dad pa'i phyir the tshom za ba kho na yin no //
translated: But since it is different from what is done according to thought, it is only doubtful.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na grags pa la brten nas rig byed kyi don nges pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis bshad pa'i khyad par gyis de'i don the tshom za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang snying po yod pa ma
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na grags pa la brten nas rig byed kyi don nges pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis bshad pa'i khyad par gyis de'i don the tshom za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang snying po yod pa ma
translated: If that were so, then since the meaning of the Vedas is ascertained in dependence on what is renowned, it is not doubtful that its meaning is qualified by the explanations of reificationists and nihilists.🔽But that is not the case.

original: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grags su zin kyang gcig nyid du bdag nyid du khas mi len pa ste /
analyzed: grags su zin kyang gcig nyid du bdag nyid du khas mi len pa ste /
translated: Even if it were renowned, it would not be accepted as a single nature.

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not accepted,

original: 'di ltar mtho ris dang lha'i bu mo la sogs pa'i sgra 'jig rten pa la don gzhan nyid du grags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtho ris dang lha'i bu mo la sogs pa'i sgra 'jig rten pa la don gzhan nyid du grags la /
translated: it is renowned in the world that the words of heaven, divine maidens, and so on have a different meaning.

original: dpyod pa rnams ni don gzhan nyid du don dang ldan par brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: dpyod pa rnams ni don gzhan nyid du don dang ldan par brjod mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of the words of the Veda is indeed expressed in a different way, but

original: 'on kyang ma grags pa'i sgra mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma grags pa'i sgra mang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the abundance of unknown words.

original: 'jig rten la ma grags pa'i sgra nyid gang dag yin pa de dag nyid rig byed la mang du mthong ba de bas na de la grags pa'i dbang gis nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten la ma grags pa'i sgra nyid gang dag yin pa de dag nyid rig byed la mang du mthong ba de bas na de la grags pa'i dbang gis nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The words that are not known in the world are seen in the Veda in abundance. Therefore, the meaning of the Veda is not ascertained by the power of what is known in the world.

original: de la de'i don te /
analyzed: de la de'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the Veda is that

original: ma grags pa'i sgra'i don nges par byed pa la skyes bu'i 'chad pa pos bstan pa la rag lus pa'i phyir @289a * //
analyzed: ma grags pa'i sgra'i don nges par byed pa la skyes bu'i 'chad pa pos bstan pa la rag lus pa'i phyir @289a * //
translated: the ascertainment of the meaning of unknown words depends on the explanation of a person.

original: ro ; ; des bstan pa ni skyes bus bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ro ; ; des bstan pa ni skyes bus bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation by a person is the teaching by a person.

original: de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows the desire of that person.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it follows the desire of a person,

original: rig byed kyi don rnams nges pa med pa kho na yin te //
analyzed: rig byed kyi don rnams nges pa med pa kho na yin te //
translated: the meaning of the Veda is indeed not ascertained.

original: gzhan yang rig byed smra ba 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed smra ba 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub na /
translated: Moreover, if you prove that the Veda is not made by a person,🔽then the meaning of the Veda is not ascertained by the power of what is known in the world.

original: yi ge rnams sam dag sgrub par byed par 'gyur grang na ste //
analyzed: yi ge rnams sam dag sgrub par byed par 'gyur grang na ste //
translated: If you are proving that the letters are not created, what is the point of that?

original: gang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis tshig rtog pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis tshig rtog pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the very conceptual thought that the words are conceptual thoughts,

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: two conceptual thoughts are set forth.

original: yi ge'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'jig rten pa'i yi ge dag las rig byed pa dag gi /
analyzed: yi ge'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'jig rten pa'i yi ge dag las rig byed pa dag gi /
translated: With reference to the conceptual thought of letters, he says, “In that regard, etc.”

original: yi ge rnams gzhan las khyad par med phyir /
analyzed: yi ge rnams gzhan las khyad par med phyir /
translated: The letters of the Vedas are not different from the letters of the world.

original: yi ge rnams la ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed na 'bras bu cir 'gyur te cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams la ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed na 'bras bu cir 'gyur te cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you are proving that the letters are not created, what is the point of that?

original: 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains this with “The letters of the world, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag dag gis yi ge dag tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i ngag dag gis yi ge dag tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the letters of the world and the letters of the Vedas are not different.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: ji ltar rig byed pa'i yi ge aa la sogs pa med par de ltar 'jig rten pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rig byed pa'i yi ge aa la sogs pa med par de ltar 'jig rten pa'i yang yin te /
translated: Just as the letters a and so on of the Vedas do not exist, so too they exist in the world.

original: gcig nyid du ngo shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid du ngo shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are recognized as the same.

original: ngo shes pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: ngo shes pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if they are recognized,

original: gal te 'jig rten pa dag las rig byed pa tha dad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa dag las rig byed pa tha dad pa de'i tshe /
translated: if the Vedas are different from the world,

original: 'jig rten pa dag las rig byed par dag gi tha dad par khas len pa na 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi yi ge dag tha dad pa yod du zin kyang ngo shes pa yod pa na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag las rig byed par dag gi tha dad par khas len pa na 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa dag gi yi ge dag tha dad pa yod du zin kyang ngo shes pa yod pa na /
translated: then if you accept that the Vedas are different from the world, even if the letters of the world and the Vedas are different, since they are recognized,

original: gnyi ga la yang gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa thams cad skye pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa thams cad skye pa de'i phyir /
translated: all cognitions of the form of one arise in both.

original: tha dad du zin kyang ngo shes pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad du zin kyang ngo shes pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, even if they are different, there is no difference in recognition.

original: ngo shes pa de las gcig nyid ma grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa de las gcig nyid ma grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it follows that one is not established from that recognition.

original: ngo shes pa'i shes pa mtshan nyid 'dra ba can las rig byed kyi ngag gis ngag thams cad la yi ge rnams gcig nyid du 'dod par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i shes pa mtshan nyid 'dra ba can las rig byed kyi ngag gis ngag thams cad la yi ge rnams gcig nyid du 'dod par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not established that all speech is the same in terms of the letters due to the speech of the Vedas, because of the similarity of the characteristics of the consciousness that recognizes them.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas ngo shes pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas ngo shes pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the summary is this: because recognition is mistaken in the way that it has been explained.

original: de bas na rig byed so so'i ngag yi ge du ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir byas pa dag las khyad par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na rig byed so so'i ngag yi ge du ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir byas pa dag las khyad par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, because the individual speech of the Vedas has the nature of many letters, it is not in the least different from what is produced.

original: khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no understanding of a difference.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa de dag gi las rig byed pa'i yi ge tha dad par 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa de dag gi las rig byed pa'i yi ge tha dad par 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: If the letters of the Vedas were different from the letters of worldly speech, then

original: de dag khyad par dang bcas par rtogs par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag khyad par dang bcas par rtogs par 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: the Vedas would be understood to have a difference. But that is not the case.

original: khyad @289b par rtogs pa med pa rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad @289b par rtogs pa med pa rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding of a difference.

original: rig byed pa'i yi ge rnams ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed pa'i yi ge rnams ma grub pa yin te /
translated: The letters of the Vedas are not established.

original: 'jig rten pa ngag las rig byed dag gi khyad par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ngag las rig byed dag gi khyad par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the difference between the world and the Vedas is not established from the words of the world.

original: de bas na 'jig rten dang rig byed dag gi yi ge du ma'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba de ltar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dang rig byed dag gi yi ge du ma'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba de ltar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it remains that the world and the Vedas have the nature of many letters.

original: ci ste 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed rnams khyad par yod pa kho na yin mod kyi de yang de'i bye brag bzung du zin kyang phyis 'byung ba gcig gi rnam pa sgro 'dogs pa 'khrul pa can gyi ngo shes pas bsgribs pa de nyid kyi
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten pa dag gi las rig byed rnams khyad par yod pa kho na yin mod kyi de yang de'i bye brag bzung du zin kyang phyis 'byung ba gcig gi rnam pa sgro 'dogs pa 'khrul pa can gyi ngo shes pas bsgribs pa de nyid kyi
translated: But if the Vedas are different from the world's actions, and even if that difference is apprehended, later the form of a single occurrence is obscured by the mistaken superimposition of recognition,

original: phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyir ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is uncertain.

original: de'i phyir ngo shes pa las rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo shes pa las rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it follows that there is no understanding from recognition.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag gi skad cig ma re re tha dad par 'dzin pa nyid du zin kyang de la ngo shes pa 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bas de la yang ngo shes las gcig nyid rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag gi skad cig ma re re tha dad par 'dzin pa nyid du zin kyang de la ngo shes pa 'khrul pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bas de la yang ngo shes las gcig nyid rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Although one apprehends each moment of a vase, etc. as different, still recognition arises in error. Therefore, it follows that one does not understand identity through recognition.

original: ro // khas blangs nas de skad du bshad nas 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa ngag gi ngag gi yi ge tha dad par dpyod pa pa rnams khas mi len to zhes bstan pa'i phyir khas mi len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: In order to demonstrate that the world and the Vedāntins do not accept that the letters of speech are different, he says, “because they do not accept that the letters are different.”

original: yi ge'i khyad par bdag nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i khyad par bdag nyid khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not accept that the letters are different.

original: 'jig rten dang rig byed kyi yi ge tha dad pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang rig byed kyi yi ge tha dad pa skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: When proving that the different letters of the world and the Vedas are not created by a person,

original: yi ge de dag 'jig rten pa dang rig byed thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge de dag 'jig rten pa dang rig byed thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: dpyod pa 'dis de ltar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa la yang yongs su spangs shing lhag mar byas pa ci zhig yod de yi ge'i rnam pa gang zhig skyes bus ma byas pa med cing /🔽cung zad kyang lhag mar byas par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dpyod pa 'dis de ltar skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa la yang yongs su spangs shing lhag mar byas pa ci zhig yod de yi ge'i rnam pa gang zhig skyes bus ma byas pa med cing / cung zad kyang lhag mar byas par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: There is no form of a syllable that is not made by a person, and there is nothing that remains to be done.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten dang rig byed dag gi yi ge thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa'i rten can du khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten dang rig byed dag gi yi ge thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa'i rten can du khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since all the syllables of the world and the Vedas are not different in being based on what is not made by persons,

original: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i sgra'i tha snyad thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na thams cad bden pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang rig byed pa'i sgra'i tha snyad thams cad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na thams cad bden pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: if all the conventions of words of the world and the Vedas are not made by persons, then all are false.

original: thams can phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams can phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all are not erroneous.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la yang don phyin ci log pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid la yang don phyin ci log pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that what is not made by a person is erroneous with respect to its object.

original: phyir te gtan tshigs kyi phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtogs pa'i yongs su ngal ba don med pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir te gtan tshigs kyi phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du rtogs pa'i yongs su ngal ba don med pa yin no //
translated: Because of that reason, the exhaustive effort to understand that it is not produced by a person is pointless.

analyzed: de ltar don phyin ci ma log pa nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: der rtogs par 'dod pa phyin ci ma log pa dag skyes bus ma byas pa nyid @290a * //
translated: those who wish to understand it as unmistaken are not produced by a person.

original: yin na de don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin na de don med par 'gyur ro //
